title: Director of Marketing
description:
**The Company: CallFinder - 800Response Marketing**

For over 30 years, 800Response has been revolutionizing the communications industry. We're not just a leading provider of vanity and shared toll-free numbers; we're innovators in real-time analytics tools that empower businesses to supercharge their lead generation and gain invaluable marketing attribution data. But we don't stop there – our **CallFinder** division is transforming contact centers with cutting-edge quality assurance software.

**Position Overview**

**CallFinder** & 800Response are looking for a Director of Marketing to lead the charge on all things brand, demand generation, and digital growth. You'll report directly to the CRO and lead a talented in-house marketing team of 3–4, while collaborating across Sales, Product, and Customer Success.

This is the ideal role for a marketing leader who likes to get in early, build scalable systems, and constantly iterate for better results.

**How You'll Make an Impact**

* Own the demand engine – Design and run multi-channel marketing campaigns (ABM, email, paid, webinars) to drive high-quality leads.
* Drive strategy with data – Use performance metrics, A/B testing, and funnel analytics to optimize and inform decisions.
* Build the brand – Shape our brand story and lead content strategy across blog, email, social, and website.
* Partner with Sales – Create sales enablement tools and help the team tell a clear, compelling product story.
* Lead the team – Coach and grow our internal team while managing agency partners as needed.
* Scale smartly – Build systems that help us move faster, stay aligned, and drive results at every stage of the funnel.
* ***Develop and implement AI Marketing Strategy.***

**What Makes You a Great Fit**

* 5+ years of B2B marketing experience - AI experience required
* 3+ years in a leadership role owning pipeline targets and managing teams
* Strong grasp of CRM (HubSpot or Salesforce), MAP (HubSpot, Pardot, Constant Contact), and analytics tools
* Excellent writing, messaging, and storytelling skills
* ***Able to employ state of the art AI tools and techniques to enable effective sales processes***
* A mindset of curiosity, structure, and adaptability — you test, tweak, and improve constantly
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Comfortable balancing high-level strategy with hands-on execution
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business (MBA is a plus), or Data Science

**How We Support You**

* Full-time position with a generous and competitive benefits package
* A high-autonomy role with room to shape strategy and build new systems
* A mission-driven, customer-first culture
* First 90 days will require in person presence with movement toward 2 days remote and 3 days in person to follow
* Professional work environment
* Strengths based organization
* A smart, motivated and collaborative team atmosphere

*Some overtime may be required to meet fluctuating workloads or staffing requirements.*

**Take the Next Step**

If you love solving problems with strategy, systems, and smart marketing - and you thrive in environments where no two weeks look the same - we'd love to hear from you

**CallFinder**-800Response is an equal opportunity employer and highly values diversity. **CallFinder**-800Response does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $90,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Ability to Commute:

* South Burlington, VT 05403 (Preferred)

Ability to Relocate:

* South Burlington, VT 05403: Relocate before starting work (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Business Accountability Specialist
description:
**About this role:**  
  
**Wells Fargo is seeking a Business Accountability Specialist for their Consumer Lending CAO Risk Program Enablement team. The CL CAO RPE team provides front line risk management functions and requirements on behalf of all CL business lines. This position will support the BSA/AML/Sanctions Program within CL CAO RPE. The ideal candidate will own and complete various forms of inherent and residual risk assessments, mostly related to product risk. Assessments require communication and collaboration across CL and SME's within the team and within the lines of business including analytics partners for data sourcing. New product, product change as well as ongoing product assessments are to be completed in accordance with regulatory and policy expectations.**  
  
**In this role, you will:**

* **Participate in research, assessment, and documentation of matters relating to the business' policy and regulatory adherence, risk mitigation, or control efforts; identify patterns and trends and looks for opportunities for procedural or control improvements within area of focus**
* **Conduct assessments and analysis of basic business or operational outcomes, systems of record, technical assignments, documentation, procedures, or challenges that require research, evaluation, and selection of alternatives; exercise independent judgment to guide completion of medium risk deliverables**
* **Present concise and well-articulated findings and recommendations, including rationale, to facilitate resolution of identified matters; exercise independent judgment while developing expertise in the risk mitigation or control activities of the business**
* **Engage in additional research and studies to enhance regulatory knowledge**
* **Collaborate and consult with colleagues, internal partners, and other business stakeholders to provide feedback, credibly challenge issues, and calibrate, as needed, to ensure alignment, consistency, and accuracy across groups**
* **Participate in cross-organizational or internal operational initiatives and improvement efforts**

**Required Qualifications:**

* **2+ years of risk management, business controls, quality assurance, business operations, compliance, or process experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education**

**Desired Qualifications:**

* **Experience with Sanctions Screening Operations Experience**
* **Working knowledge of the Consumer Lending (CSBB, Auto, Home Lending, Personal Lines & Loans, Merchant Services) products**
* **1 + years of experience in financial crimes risks and proven ability to develop best practices**
* **Experience in financial crimes compliance, fraud, risk management, auditing, or a related job function**
* **Ability to take initiative and work independently with minimal supervision in a structured environment**
* **Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills**
* **Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail and accuracy**
* **Ability to engage, influence, and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders to deliver results**
* **Ability to draft and present to senior management in a clear and concise manner in written and oral form**
* **Ability to exercise sound judgment, demonstrate professionalism, and proactively escalate issues along with recommendations for successful resolution**
* **Effective organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple and sometimes competing priorities**
* **Experience identifying and driving process improvements in a complex banking environment**
* **Experience working with the Bank's compliance and operational policies and procedures, and with corporate Operational Risk Platform tools such as SHRP**
* **Professional certifications or knowledge of such as BSA/AML Credentials, CAMS,**
* **Advanced Microsoft Office skills**

**Job Expectations:**

* **This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship.**
* **Hybrid work schedule**
* **Must reside within a commutable distance to posted work location and willingness to work on-site at stated location on the job opening**
* **No relocation assistance is available**

**Pay Range**  
  
Reflected is the base pay range offered for this position. Pay may vary depending on factors including but not limited to achievements, skills, experience, or work location. The range listed is just one component of the compensation package offered to candidates.  
$63,600.00 - $113,000.00  
**Benefits**  
  
Wells Fargo provides eligible employees with a comprehensive set of benefits, many of which are listed below. Visit Benefits - Wells Fargo Jobs for an overview of the following benefit plans and programs offered to employees.

* Health benefits
* 401(k) Plan
* Paid time off
* Disability benefits
* Life insurance, critical illness insurance, and accident insurance
* Parental leave
* Critical caregiving leave
* Discounts and savings
* Commuter benefits
* Tuition reimbursement
* Scholarships for dependent children
* Adoption reimbursement

**Posting End Date:**  
22 Jun 2025  

* **Job posting may come down early due to volume of applicants.**

  
**We Value Equal Opportunity**  
  
Wells Fargo is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected characteristic.  
  
Employees support our focus on building strong customer relationships balanced with a strong risk mitigating and compliance-driven culture which firmly establishes those disciplines as critical to the success of our customers and company. They are accountable for execution of all applicable risk programs (Credit, Market, Financial Crimes, Operational, Regulatory Compliance), which includes effectively following and adhering to applicable Wells Fargo policies and procedures, appropriately fulfilling risk and compliance obligations, timely and effective escalation and remediation of issues, and making sound risk decisions. There is emphasis on proactive monitoring, governance, risk identification and escalation, as well as making sound risk decisions commensurate with the business unit's risk appetite and all risk and compliance program requirements.  
  
**Applicants with Disabilities**  
  
To request a medical accommodation during the application or interview process, visit Disability Inclusion at Wells Fargo .  
  
**Drug and Alcohol Policy**  
  
Wells Fargo maintains a drug free workplace. Please see our Drug and Alcohol Policy to learn more.  
  
**Wells Fargo Recruitment and Hiring Requirements:**  
  
a. Third-Party recordings are prohibited unless authorized by Wells Fargo.  
  
b. Wells Fargo requires you to directly represent your own experiences during the recruiting and hiring process.

title: Director, Call Center Strategy
description:
**Company Description**

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**

Visa Commercial Solutions is a world-class organization responsible for growing all flows between businesses and governments, from SMBs to the largest global corporations. The B2B Acceptance team has the responsibility for defining and executing the global B2B product vision for Visa's commercial merchant solutions. With 20T in untapped card-able spend, Visa is positioning itself to capture more than its fair share of this opportunity by focusing on improving the value proposition of card payments for B2B merchants. This includes developing services and capabilities that reduces friction in the payment process while offering an economic model where cost is commensurate with the value.

We are responsible for the commercialization of new and enhanced products and services, research and thought leadership, and product engagement with our issuing & acquiring partners. The team serves financial institutions, processors, Fintech partnerships, and their downstream clients. We work collaboratively with Visa’s Merchant Services Accounts, B2B Partnerships and Commercial Sales organizations around the globe.

The Director, Call Center Strategy is responsible for growing Visa’s largest supplier outreach channel for B2B payments, managing our call center vendor to drive incremental growth, process efficiency and innovation. This role will help drive global adoption of the supplier enablement outbound calling service, of products and services, and partner with our Director, Go To Market Strategy, to support growth of Commercial Card payments by expanding our outbound calling channel to new markets. This an exciting new position, allowing the new Director of Call Center strategy to help build a vision for how our services will evolve globally to meet client needs and drive adoption.

This role requires strong experience leading a call center team that meets and exceeds sales goals, specifically for commercial card payments, or B2B payment products. The ideal candidate will have experience leading a sales or inside sales organization, preferably working with a third party vendor. The position will be focused on helping improve our campaign results in our core North America market, re-establishing best practices and behaviors to drive the best results, and then will pay a crucial role in leading our global expansion into new markets. This will require a keen sense of call center best practices, familiarity with buyer and supplier dynamics which impact enablement results and a growth mindset as we expand. Diplomacy to manage collaborative relationships and expectations, while ensuring a strong global approach and alignment, is critical to succeeding in this role. In addition to sales and call center management experience, this role requires deep expertise in commercial payments, Accounts Payable & Accounts Receivable practices.

Essential Functions

* The role of Director, Call Center Strategy will play a pivotal role in transforming Visa’s Supplier Enablement call center into a profit center that exceeds our issuing partners expectations in supplier enablement campaign results.
* Establish KPIs and metrics for Visa’s Supplier Enablement campaigns, where we partner with issuers to target merchants for Commercial Card products, selling acceptance on behalf of corporates looking to grow their Commercial Card programs.
* Oversee the relationship with our vendor responsible for conducting the outreach to suppliers to enable them for virtual card payments.
* Create attainable, aggressive targets for each commercial card campaign conducted by our call center partner, including global expansion into new markets unfamiliar with Supplier Enablement practices.
* Drive process efficiency, results improvement and innovation with our partner, focused on leveraging Artificial Intelligence to streamline the outreach efforts and improve results.
* Work with the Director of Supplier Enablement Strategy to execute on supplier enablement campaigns that exceed the expectations of our global issuer partners.
* Support growth of our Supplier Enablement Services suite by presenting our campaign results, best practices and innovations to our expanding client base.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your hiring manager.

 **Qualifications**

Basic Qualifications  

* 10 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 8 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters/ MBA/JD/MD) or at least 3 years of work experience with a PhD

  
Preferred Qualifications  

* 12 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD
* Minimum of 12 years experience leading sales or inside sales teams in a call center environment.
* Direct experience in commercial B2B payments space, preferably at a commercial bank.
* Proven track record of managing a third party vendor relationship strongly preferred.
* History of meeting or exceeding sales goals is required, as this position with require an ability to determine sales goals, underlying metrics or KPIs and then exceed them.

 **Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 166,600.00 to 241,800.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.**

Preferred Qualifications

* Bachelor's Degree required, Master's preferred.

Two years direct experience in commercial B2B payments space, preferably at a commercial bank.  

* Past experience or familiarity of inside sales teams in a call center environment.
* Proven track record of managing a third party vendor relationship strongly preferred.
* Data and analytical skills to develop measurements and success metrics to hold the call center and the agents accountable.

 **Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

title: Data Governance
description:
**Job Title: Data Governance**

**Location : Alpharetta Ga**

**Key Responsibilities:**

**GCP-Based Data Strategy Delivery**

* Lead end-to-end enterprise data strategy engagements on **GCP.**
* Define scalable, cloud-native operating models and data architectures using **BigQuery, Dataplex,** and other GCP tools.

**Executive Advisory**

* Partner with C-level executives to align GCP data initiatives with business goals and digital transformation strategies.
* Translate technical data capabilities into tangible business outcomes.

**Data Governance Enablement**

* Design and implement robust governance frameworks using GCP-native services.
* Deliver on key areas such as metadata management, data lineage, access controls, classification, and stewardship modeling.

**Workshop Facilitation & Road mapping**

* Conduct data maturity assessments and lead future-state visioning workshops.
* Create actionable, GCP-aligned roadmaps that drive long-term business impact.

**Solution Architecture Collaboration**

* Work closely with cloud architects and engineers to embed governance and quality standards into GCP-based data platforms.

**Data Quality & Compliance**

* Define and enforce data quality rules and controls using GCP tooling.
* Ensure alignment with regulatory frameworks (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and internal policies.

**Best Practices & Standards**

* Develop playbooks, templates, and best practices for cloud-native governance, metadata management, and data product lifecycle.

**Thought Leadership**

* Contribute to internal accelerators, frameworks, and industry thought leadership on modern data governance in the cloud.

Qualifications & Experience:

* **Experience:**

10+ years in data strategy, governance, or architecture, with 3–5+ years focused on **GCP-**based solutions.

* **GCP Tools Expertise:**

Strong working knowledge of:

* **BigQuery**
* **Dataplex**
* **Data Catalog**
* **Vertex AI**
* **Cloud Storage**
* **Looker (optional but preferred)**
* **Governance Frameworks:**

Proven experience implementing enterprise data governance, metadata management, data quality frameworks, and cloud-native controls.

* **Education:**

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field; Master’s degree preferred.

* **Soft Skills:**
* Strong executive presence and communication skills.
* Skilled in facilitation, storytelling, and bridging business and technology.
* Comfortable leading cross-functional teams and stakeholder engagements.

Job Type: Contract

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* BigQuery: 4 years (Required)
* Dataplex: 4 years (Required)
* Data Catalog: 5 years (Required)

Location:

* Alpharetta, GA 30004 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: VP, Channel Partnership Sales
description:
**Company Description**

QAD is a world-class SaaS company, and we are growing. We are looking for talented individuals who want to join us on our mission to help solve relevant real-world problems in manufacturing and the supply chain.

*This role is required to be based on the East coast of the U.S., ideally in the Miami, FL area.*

Travel will be required to build working relationships, collaboration, design, strategy, and alignment.

 **Job Description**

We are seeking a high-impact **Channels and Partner Leader** to build, lead, and scale our global partner ecosystem across both ERP and Supply Chain. This role will shape and own our channel strategy across strategic alliances, value-added resellers (VARs), and referral partners, helping us drive growth through indirect routes to market across manufacturing and other key industries.

You will be responsible for developing the strategy, hiring and enabling a team, and delivering measurable results across partner-sourced and partner-influenced pipeline.

Key Responsibilities

Partner Strategy and Execution

* Develop and execute a multi-pronged partner strategy across:

  + Strategic Alliances: Form high-value partnerships with global consulting firms, cloud providers, and complementary tech players.
  + Resell (VAR): Identify, onboard, and manage partners who can resell ERP and Supply Chain solutions into targeted accounts and regions.
  + Referral: Launch and scale a network of referral partners, including boutique consultants, implementation partners, and industry insiders who can introduce us to key manufacturing and enterprise accounts.

Team Leadership and Expansion

* Build and lead a world-class partner organization spanning multiple geographies and partner types.
* Recruit, onboard, and develop top partner managers with clear goals, accountability, and shared ownership of pipeline growth.
* Establish a scalable operating rhythm for performance tracking, enablement, and partner success.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

* Partner with Sales, Marketing, Product, and Services teams to ensure partner programs are aligned with core company priorities.
* Lead co-marketing, co-selling, and field engagement initiatives that create joint wins and long-term value.

Growth and Metrics Ownership

* Own KPIs for partner-sourced and partner-influenced pipeline and bookings across ERP and Supply Chain product lines.
* Build reporting, dashboards, and insights to inform executive stakeholders and guide ongoing strategy.
* Constantly refine the partner portfolio and engagement models to maximize return.

 **Qualifications**

* 10 or more years in enterprise software partnerships, channels, or alliances, including at least 5 years in a team leadership capacity.
* Deep understanding of the ERP and/or Supply Chain software market and its buyer personas.
* Demonstrated success building a partner organization from scratch or transforming an underperforming partner model.
* Proven ability to attract, retain, and grow top talent within a fast-paced, matrixed environment.
* Comfortable toggling between strategy and execution; this is a hands-on leadership role.

*Preferred Experience*

* Familiarity with ERP platforms, Planning, Scheduling, GTM, SRM, and/or Manufacturing Execution solutions.
* Experience working with global hyperscalers such as AWS, including co-sell and marketplace integration.
* Global experience and the ability to scale programs across regions.

 **Additional Information**

Your health and well being are important to us at QAD. We provide programs that help you strike a healthy work-life balance.

* Opportunity to join a growing business, launching into its next phase of expansion and transformation.
* Collaborative culture of smart and hard-working people who support one another to get the job done.
* An atmosphere of growth and opportunity, where idea-sharing is always prioritized over level or hierarchy.
* Compensation packages based on experience and desired skill set

**Compensation Package:**

* Base Pay range: $205,000 - $210,000 Annually (12 Months).
* Position eligible for Variable Compensation.
* The range applies to the US only. If the final candidate is in another country, the local currency and range would be based on competitive ranges in those countries in alignment with the job grade range.
* Placement within our pay range will vary based on knowledge, skills, experience, and market location variations as well as internal peer equity
* U.S. benefits package includes medical, dental and vision coverage, a 401(k) plan with company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, paid-time off, parental leave, and well-being programs

**About QAD:**

QAD Inc. is a leading provider of adaptive, cloud-based enterprise software and services for global manufacturing companies. Global manufacturers face ever-increasing disruption caused by technology-driven innovation and changing consumer preferences. In order to survive and thrive, manufacturers must be able to innovate and change business models at unprecedented rates of speed. QAD calls these companies Adaptive Manufacturing Enterprises. QAD solutions help customers in the automotive, life sciences, packaging, consumer products, food and beverage, high tech and industrial manufacturing industries rapidly adapt to change and innovate for competitive advantage.

QAD is committed to ensuring that every employee feels they work in an environment that values their contributions, respects their unique perspectives and provides opportunities for growth regardless of background. QAD’s DEI program is driving higher levels of diversity, equity and inclusion so that employees can bring their whole self to work.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Account Executive
description:
**About DTIQ Technologies, Inc**

DTiQ empowers businesses to transform operations and elevate performance with industry-leading Video Intelligence and business analytics solutions. Serving the QSR, retail, and convenience store sectors, we deliver actionable insights that drive efficiency, enhance security, and improve customer experiences. Join us as we redefine the future of operational intelligence.

**Position Overview:**

DTiQ is seeking a seasoned **Account Executive** who is a true hunter—driven, metric-focused, and experienced in acquiring net new business within the **QSR, Drive-Thru, and Retail** verticals. This role requires a results-oriented sales professional who thrives in a fast-paced environment and brings a book of business, expertise in crafting proposals, and an exceptional ability to conduct impactful product demonstrations.

The **Account Executive** will report to the VP of Sales, work in a regional capacity, and focus on growing DTiQ’s market presence and RMR through new business acquisition.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Drive New Business:** Proactively identify, prospect, and secure net new opportunities to achieve and exceed sales quotas.
* **Engage & Present:** Conduct compelling product demonstrations, highlighting DTiQ’s innovative solutions and their measurable impact on operational efficiency.
* **Proposal Crafting:** Develop tailored proposals that resonate with client challenges and objectives, aligning with DTiQ’s value proposition.
* **Relationship Building:** Cultivate strong, lasting relationships with prospects and clients, positioning DTiQ as a trusted partner.
* **Market Insights:** Stay informed on industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to inform strategy and maintain a competitive edge.
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with marketing, product, and customer success teams to ensure seamless execution and customer satisfaction.
* **Data-Driven Strategy:** Maintain meticulous records in CRM software to track pipeline activities, forecast accurately, and measure success.
* **Event Representation:** Represent DTiQ at industry events, conferences, and trade shows to build brand awareness and generate leads.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** Minimum of 5 years of sales experience with a proven track record of exceeding quota in the QSR, Drive-Thru, or Retail verticals.
* **Expertise:** Strong familiarity with video intelligence, business analytics, and/or operational technology.
* **Client Base:** Existing relationships or book of business in the QSR or Retail space is highly preferred.
* **Hunter Mentality:** Demonstrated ability to independently drive the sales cycle from prospecting to close.
* **Sales Acumen:** Skilled in conducting client-facing product demos, crafting persuasive proposals, and negotiating deals.
* **Technical Skills:** Proficient in CRM tools and sales enablement platforms.
* **Communication:** Exceptional interpersonal, presentation, and negotiation skills.
* **Flexibility:** Willingness to travel within the assigned region to meet client and business needs.

**Why Join DTiQ?**

* **Growth Opportunity:** Be part of a high-growth, innovative company leading the industry in video intelligence and analytics.
* **Rewarding Compensation:** Competitive base salary of $100K-$120k with uncapped commission potential, offering OTE of $277K+.
* **Top Clients:** You will have the opportunity to work some of the top brands in the industry.
* **Team Culture:** Join a collaborative team dedicated to excellence, professional development, and achieving aggressive growth targets.
* **Cutting-Edge Solutions:** Leverage best-in-class technology to provide clients with actionable insights that drive success.

**How to Apply:**  
If you’re a motivated sales professional passionate about technology and excited to work with a forward-thinking organization, we’d love to hear from you. Apply with your resume and cover letter at dtiq.com/careers.

**DTiQ is an equal opportunity employer** and committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Operations Consultant I
description:
**Company Description**

Privia Health™ is a technology-driven, national physician enablement company that collaborates with medical groups, health plans, and health systems to optimize physician practices, improve patient experiences, and reward doctors for delivering high-value care in both in-person and virtual settings. The Privia Platform is led by top industry talent and exceptional physician leadership, and consists of scalable operations and end-to-end, cloud-based technology that reduces unnecessary healthcare costs, achieves better outcomes, and improves the health of patients and the well-being of providers.

 **Job Description**

**Travel Required:** Yes, 70% local travel our Ohio Market

**Overview of the Role:**

The Operations Consultant I is responsible for directly managing a portfolio of clinically integrated multi-specialty practices and be accountable for driving overall performance results.

**Primary Job Duties:**

* Manage and own a portfolio of partner physician practices
* Serve as point of contact for portfolio care centers and provide routine and regular updates as they relate to the partnership.
* Partner with physicians owners and focus on strategic planning & execution (VBC & FFS performance, same store growth, succession planning)
* Partner with Privia VBC and physician leadership to drive care transformation
* Track and manage metrics and goals related to finance, revenue cycle, productivity, clinical performance, value-based care and customer experience.
* Review data, share best practices and coach Care Center teams on strategies to succeed in value-based care agreements with payers.
* Drive growth and operational improvement to a portfolio of physician practices.
* Facilitate, in coordination with each Care Center, the development and implementation of action plans designed to meet the Care Centers’ strategic plans and key performance initiatives as set by the medical group.
* Review relevant reports and data with practices in order to maintain transparency with practices about their financial performance in order to drive performance and change.
* Develop presentation materials, as appropriate, to communicate the status of actionable initiatives.
* Evaluate and assist in re-engineering the practice workflow to streamline patient throughput and efficiency.
* Mentor and coach practice administrators, in the management of their physician practice.
* Engage company resources, as necessary, to meet the needs of the Care Center, serving as the project coordinator to ensure timely completion and delivery of requested deliverables.
* Manage expectations with Care Centers as they relate to timeframes and service delivery.
* Assist in the development and execution of strategies aimed at driving growth, performance and revenue.
* Assist in coordination and presentation of key, in-market, physician meetings for both primary care and specialty care providers.
* Evaluate practice operations and offer strategic and constructive feedback for the benefit of the physician practice.
* Maintain current knowledge of relevant health care topics and share information as appropriate.
* Develop and maintain expert-level knowledge in key software platforms such as athenaHealth’s. Performance Management System and electronic health record.
* Provide top-notch customer service to physician practices to ensure issues are resolved and clients are satisfied.
* Ensure that operations are conducted in accordance with applicable accreditation, statutory and regulatory requirements.
* Aide in the transition of the physician practice from Fee-For-Service to the future Risk-based world of healthcare reimbursement
* Roll out and communicate new Privia initiatives
* Serve as an effective leader, offering constructive feedback and coaching to Associate Consultants and other MSO based teams with the constant goal of driving Care Center performance and service. Serve as a strategic thinker who assesses situations carefully and delivers scalable recommendations and results
* Provide oversight, coaching and mentoring to assigned Performance Associates

 **Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree preferred. Healthcare Master’s or MBA highly preferred.
* 5+ years of healthcare experience required, particularly working with physicians and medical group staff
* Quantitatively and financially proficient; must know how to read, interpret and explain financial data
* Comfort in functioning independently and autonomously and can effectively build a case to effect change. Demonstrates the judgment to appropriately escalate situations as necessary..
* Project management experience, juggling multiple projects and urgent deliverables while providing exceptional client service
* General understanding of Population Health Management and how it applies to risk-based contracts.
* Must have access to reliable transportation
* Must comply with HIPAA rules and regulations

**Interpersonal Skills & Attributes:**

* Able to have honest, difficult conversations with physicians and their teams about financial performance and areas of opportunity for improvement
* Skilled in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with providers, management, clients and staff, in order to get buy-in to decisions
* Expresses ideas clearly and effectively, motivates the listener to action
* Responds calmly and maturely in high pressure situations
* Positive attitude toward company, work, clients, management, and team members
* Uses a customer-focused approach in dealing with conflict and resolution of problems

*The salary range for this role is $80,000 to $95,000 in base pay and exclusive of any bonuses or benefits (medical, dental, vision, life, and pet insurance, 401K, paid time off, and other wellness programs). This role is also eligible for an annual bonus targeted at 15% & restricted stock units. The base pay offered will be determined based on relevant factors such as experience, education, and geographic location.*

 **Additional Information**

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

**﻿Technical Requirements (for remote workers only, not applicable for onsite/in office work):**

**In order to successfully work remotely, supporting our patients and providers, we require a minimum of 5 MBPS for Download Speed and 3 MBPS for the Upload Speed. This should be acquired prior to the start of your employment. The best measure of your internet speed is to use online speed tests like** **https://www.speedtest.net/****. This gives you an update as to how fast data transfer is with your internet connection and if it meets the minimum speed requirements. Work with your internet provider if you have questions about your connection. Employees who regularly work from home offices are eligible for expense reimbursement to offset this cost.**

Privia Health is committed to creating and fostering a work environment that allows and encourages you to bring your whole self to work. Privia is a better company when our people are a reflection of the communities that we serve. Our goal is to encourage people to pursue all opportunities regardless of their age, color, national origin, physical or mental (dis)ability, race, religion, gender, sex, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Partnerships Director - IT Solutions - Sales
description:
Job Title: Partnerships & Alliances Director

The company: A recognized leader in IT Solutions that secures, modernizes, and connects multi-cloud infrastructure, applications, and data for our clients. Our holistic approach was built with our customers in mind to provide one-to-one service during all phases of a project. We partner with industry giants like Cisco, Palo Alto, Microsoft, AWS etc. in securing and optimizing our clients’ digital landscapes through innovation and expertise.

**Location**

Northeast (NYC preferred) or Remote

**Department**

Business Development / Strategic Alliances

**Reports To**

COO

**Role Overview**

We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented **Alliances Manager / Director** to lead and expand our strategic technology and channel partnerships. In this role, you’ll be responsible for managing and accelerating our relationships with key partners—including cloud providers, cybersecurity vendors, and global system integrators—while identifying new co-sell and go-to-market opportunities.

This is a high-impact, cross-functional role ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of sales, marketing, and partner strategy, and who brings a proven track record of driving revenue through alliances.

**Key Responsibilities**

* **Own and expand partner relationships** with key technology vendors and strategic alliances (e.g., AWS, Microsoft, Cisco, Palo Alto Networks, Pure, Rubrik etc.)
* **Develop and execute joint go-to-market (GTM) strategies**, campaigns, and co-selling motions with alliance partners
* Collaborate with internal sales, marketing, product, and delivery teams to align alliance strategies with business goals
* Define and monitor joint business plans, performance metrics, and revenue goals with each partner
* Drive partner enablement activities including joint training, solution development, and field engagement
* Negotiate partner agreements, incentives, and MDF (market development funds) utilization
* Represent the company at partner events, conferences, and executive meetings
* Stay ahead of market trends and competitive landscapes across the partner ecosystem

**Qualifications**

* 7–10 years of experience in strategic alliances, partner management, or business development, ideally in the technology or cybersecurity sectors
* Deep understanding of enterprise sales cycles and the partner ecosystem (resellers, MSPs, hyperscalers, ISVs)
* Experience building GTM strategies with Fortune 500 technology partners
* Strong executive presence and ability to influence both internal and external stakeholders
* Proven ability to manage multiple complex projects in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and negotiation skills
* Bachelor’s degree required; MBA or equivalent a plus

**Preferred Experience**

* Prior experience working with a VAR/MSSP or SI or at top cloud or cybersecurity vendors (e.g., AWS, Microsoft, Google Cloud, Cisco, Palo Alto Networks)
* Familiarity with PRM tools, co-sell platforms, and alliance ecosystems
* Experience working in or with a VAR, MSSP, or consulting services business

**We Offer**

* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A dynamic and supportive team environment that values innovation and continuous learning.
* Access to cutting-edge technologies and projects that shape the future of network, data center, and security solutions.
* Generous Paid Time Off Policy
* Additional Company Paid
* Holidays in addition to PTO
* Premium medical, dental, vision benefits
* Life Insurance
* Disability Insurance
* 401(k) Participation Availability

Join a high-growth, mission-driven company that’s transforming how organizations secure, modernize, and connect their applications, data, and users. We offer a collaborative, fast-paced culture with endless opportunities to grow and make an impact.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $150,000.00 - $225,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

description:
**Company Description**

Privia Health™ is a technology-driven, national physician enablement company that collaborates with medical groups, health plans, and health systems to optimize physician practices, improve patient experiences, and reward doctors for delivering high-value care in both in-person and virtual settings. The Privia Platform is led by top industry talent and exceptional physician leadership, and consists of scalable operations and end-to-end, cloud-based technology that reduces unnecessary healthcare costs, achieves better outcomes, and improves the health of patients and the well-being of providers.

 **Job Description**

title: Technical Product Marketing Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**

Visa is seeking a talented and driven Technical Product Marketing Analyst for our Value-Added Services Marketing Team. In this role, you will bridge a critical gap that sits between product experts and creative storytellers and designers, responsible for leading the effective communication of complex technical products to a wide range of audiences.

Your role will involve a blending product and payments knowledge with a keen ability to creatively translate technical information and concepts into compelling narratives that strengthen and deepen the messaging and materials we create. This role requires a dynamic individual who can quickly learn and understand our rapidly evolving market, products, and customer needs, while capturing value and functionality, and delivering adept storytelling that conveys a clear and convincing message.

As part of our team, you will be at the forefront of our company's efforts to position our Risk and Identity Solutions effectively in the marketplace. You will also support the creation and delivery of our Global Sales Play narratives and assist our design and solution marketing teams in connecting and facilitating conversations at the intersection of product, marketing, sales, and GTM activities. If you are a versatile marketer with a passion for deeply understanding products to communicate value, or if you have a background in product with a talent for delivering the story and “why” behind solutions, so that it is easily understood by your customers, we would love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

* Technical Acumen: Assist in understanding and articulating complex technical concepts and translating them into compelling marketing content, sales enablement materials, and solution narratives. Able to understand and validate the accuracy of demos and flow diagrams captured from technical teams. Experience working closely with engineering or product development teams is essential.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Drive initiatives within cross-functional teams and collaborate with stakeholders across product management, sales, design, marketing, and engineering. Influence and drive consensus in a matrixed organization.
* Research and Market Insights: Partner with our Competitive Intelligence and the Analyst Relation teams to help capture, validate, and incorporate findings to strengthen marketing collateral and product strategies.
* Drive Meaningful Materials: Push teams to go deeper with concepts and messaging to connect with our audiences and enable product leaders and sellers who are taking our message to market.
* Storytelling and Narrative Building: Assist in developing clear, compelling narratives that highlight the value of Visa’s solutions, effectively translating complex product strategies into relatable and persuasive stories. Think like a journalist to uncover insights, ask the right questions, and ensure our narratives are both impactful and relevant for sellers and buyers.
* Strong Communicator: Effectively articulate messaging and communicate across a wide spectrum of stakeholders and leaders. Ability to ask great questions, be a good listener, communicate concisely, and willing and able to speak up when clarification is required is a key to success.
* Growth Mindset Life-long learner who continually stretches themselves to learn more and test their boundaries in risk, payments, and product knowledge. Comfortable with change and ambiguity, and willing to actively pursue answers or ask questions to understand more.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

 **Qualifications**

Basic Qualifications:

* 2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)

Preferred Qualifications

* 3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)
* Ideal candidates would have a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Finance, or IT related fields. MBA or Masters showing a strong mix of technical and marketing acumen preferred.
* Minimum of 3+ years of experience in product marketing or product management within the payments industry, with a focus on storytelling and creating sales collateral, preferably with strong focus on risk management, payments systems, and identity verification solutions. Experience in FinTech or financial services is a plus.
* Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, as well as payments systems, API-based services, and fraud and risk related to transaction monitoring or identity verification products. Comfortable with technical diagrams such as transaction flows, use case and user flow diagrams
* Proven ability to translate complex product strategies into clear, compelling marketing materials that resonate with target audiences.
* Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. A proactive learner with the ability to quickly adapt to changing market conditions and emerging technologies. Innovative thinker with a passion for driving product success through creative marketing solutions
* Empathy and the ability to put yourself in the shoes of both sellers and buyers to create relevant and impactful marketing materials.

  
**Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 84,600.00 to 119,650.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. title: Technical Product Marketing Analyst
description:
**Company Description**

Visa is a world leader in payments and technology, with over 259 billion payments transactions flowing safely between consumers, merchants, financial institutions, and government entities in more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose – to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.

Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. Join us today and experience Life at Visa.

 **Job Description**

Visa is seeking a talented and driven Technical Product Marketing Analyst for our Value-Added Services Marketing Team. In this role, you will bridge a critical gap that sits between product experts and creative storytellers and designers, responsible for leading the effective communication of complex technical products to a wide range of audiences.

Your role will involve a blending product and payments knowledge with a keen ability to creatively translate technical information and concepts into compelling narratives that strengthen and deepen the messaging and materials we create. This role requires a dynamic individual who can quickly learn and understand our rapidly evolving market, products, and customer needs, while capturing value and functionality, and delivering adept storytelling that conveys a clear and convincing message.

As part of our team, you will be at the forefront of our company's efforts to position our Risk and Identity Solutions effectively in the marketplace. You will also support the creation and delivery of our Global Sales Play narratives and assist our design and solution marketing teams in connecting and facilitating conversations at the intersection of product, marketing, sales, and GTM activities. If you are a versatile marketer with a passion for deeply understanding products to communicate value, or if you have a background in product with a talent for delivering the story and “why” behind solutions, so that it is easily understood by your customers, we would love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

* Technical Acumen: Assist in understanding and articulating complex technical concepts and translating them into compelling marketing content, sales enablement materials, and solution narratives. Able to understand and validate the accuracy of demos and flow diagrams captured from technical teams. Experience working closely with engineering or product development teams is essential.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration: Drive initiatives within cross-functional teams and collaborate with stakeholders across product management, sales, design, marketing, and engineering. Influence and drive consensus in a matrixed organization.
* Research and Market Insights: Partner with our Competitive Intelligence and the Analyst Relation teams to help capture, validate, and incorporate findings to strengthen marketing collateral and product strategies.
* Drive Meaningful Materials: Push teams to go deeper with concepts and messaging to connect with our audiences and enable product leaders and sellers who are taking our message to market.
* Storytelling and Narrative Building: Assist in developing clear, compelling narratives that highlight the value of Visa’s solutions, effectively translating complex product strategies into relatable and persuasive stories. Think like a journalist to uncover insights, ask the right questions, and ensure our narratives are both impactful and relevant for sellers and buyers.
* Strong Communicator: Effectively articulate messaging and communicate across a wide spectrum of stakeholders and leaders. Ability to ask great questions, be a good listener, communicate concisely, and willing and able to speak up when clarification is required is a key to success.
* Growth Mindset Life-long learner who continually stretches themselves to learn more and test their boundaries in risk, payments, and product knowledge. Comfortable with change and ambiguity, and willing to actively pursue answers or ask questions to understand more.

This is a hybrid position. Expectation of days in office will be confirmed by your Hiring Manager.

 **Qualifications**

Basic Qualifications:

* 2 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD, or PhD)

Preferred Qualifications

* 3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)
* Ideal candidates would have a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Finance, or IT related fields. MBA or Masters showing a strong mix of technical and marketing acumen preferred.
* Minimum of 3+ years of experience in product marketing or product management within the payments industry, with a focus on storytelling and creating sales collateral, preferably with strong focus on risk management, payments systems, and identity verification solutions. Experience in FinTech or financial services is a plus.
* Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, as well as payments systems, API-based services, and fraud and risk related to transaction monitoring or identity verification products. Comfortable with technical diagrams such as transaction flows, use case and user flow diagrams
* Proven ability to translate complex product strategies into clear, compelling marketing materials that resonate with target audiences.
* Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence and engage stakeholders at all levels.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. A proactive learner with the ability to quickly adapt to changing market conditions and emerging technologies. Innovative thinker with a passion for driving product success through creative marketing solutions
* Empathy and the ability to put yourself in the shoes of both sellers and buyers to create relevant and impactful marketing materials.

  
**Additional Information**

**Work Hours:** Varies upon the needs of the department.

**Travel Requirements:** This position requires travel 5-10% of the time.

**Mental/Physical Requirements:** This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code.

**U.S. APPLICANTS ONLY: The estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is 84,600.00 to 119,650.00 USD per year, which may include potential sales incentive payments (if applicable). Salary may vary depending on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. In addition, this position may be eligible for bonus and equity. Visa has a comprehensive benefits package for which this position may be eligible that includes Medical, Dental, Vision, 401 (k), FSA/HSA, Life Insurance, Paid Time Off, and Wellness Program.**
