title: Senior Manager, Field Enablement Project Management Office
description:
**Get to know Okta**  
  
Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology, anywhere, on any device or app. Our flexible and neutral products, Okta Platform and Auth0 Platform, provide secure access, authentication, and automation, placing identity at the core of business security and growth.  
  
At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences.  
  
Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.

**The Field Enablement Operations team**

The Enablement Operations team serves as the Center of Excellence for planning, systems, analytics, and program infrastructure that power our global enablement strategy. This team ensures operational rigor, scalable execution, and data-driven insights that enable high-impact learning and field productivity.  

**The Senior Manager, Field Enablement PMO opportunity**

Reporting to the Director of Field Enablement Operations, the Senior Manager, Field Enablement PMO to build and lead our Project Management Office (PMO) within the Enablement Operations organization. You’ll be responsible for defining project management standards, implementing frameworks and tools, managing a portfolio of strategic initiatives, and coaching a small team to excellence. This role requires deep expertise in project management, strong leadership presence, and a collaborative mindset to partner across teams.

**What you’ll be doing**

* Building and leading the Project Management Office (PMO), establishing standards, processes, and tools for consistent execution across global Enablement initiatives
* Acting as a player-coach, leading complex projects yourself while mentoring team members to deliver against their portfolios
* Developing and implementing scalable project management methodologies (Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid) that align with business needs and enable high-quality execution
* Owning project intake, prioritization, tracking, and reporting processes while partnering closely with Field Enablement, Change management, and Enablement Operations
* Driving operational rhythm and governance, including project status reporting, risk/issue management, stakeholder communication, and post-mortems
* Serving as a trusted advisor to the Enablement LT, translating strategy into actionable project plans with clear milestones and outcomes
* Fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement

**What you’ll bring to the** **role & what we’re looking for**

* 8+ years of experience in an Enablement role specifically focused on managing projects in support of the Field
* Minimum of 3+ years in a leadership role; comfortable working in a player-coach capacity
* Proven experience building or scaling a PMO function within a global or matrixed organization
* **Active PMP certification is required**
* Demonstrated success in managing cross-functional initiatives with executive visibility
* Expert in project planning tools such as Asana, Smartsheet, or Microsoft Project
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills
* Strong analytical skills, with a data-informed approach to prioritization and reporting
* Thrives in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment with multiple stakeholders and shifting priorities
* Familiarity with change management and organizational readiness best practices
* Passion for team development, mentorship, and operational excellence

Okta’s Top 5 Core Leadership Competencies are part of the deeply ingrained principles that guide all of our company’s actions. They also align strongly to our cultural cornerstones, our Okta values: love our customers, empower our people, never stop innovating, act with integrity, and maintain transparency. It’s our expectation that our managers and leaders embody these core competencies:

* Builds Effective Teams: Building strong-identity teams that apply their diverse skills and perspectives to achieve common goals.
* Demonstrates Self-Awareness (EQ): Using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses.
* Develops Talent: Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organization’s goals.
* Drives Results: Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
* Strategic Mindset: Seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies.

#LI-Hybrid

Below is the annual base salary range for candidates located in California, Colorado, New York and Washington. Your actual base salary will depend on factors such as your skills, qualifications, experience, and work location. In addition, Okta offers equity (where applicable), bonus, and benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), flexible spending account, and paid leave (including PTO and parental leave) in accordance with our applicable plans and policies. To learn more about our Total Rewards program please visit: https://rewards.okta.com/us.

The annual base salary range for this position for candidates located in California (excluding San Francisco Bay Area), Colorado, New York, and Washington is between:$158,000—$236,000 USD

**What you can look forward to as a Full-Time Okta employee!**

* Amazing Benefits
* Making Social Impact
* Developing Talent and Fostering Connection + Community at Okta

Okta cultivates a dynamic work environment, providing the best tools, technology and benefits to empower our employees to work productively in a setting that best and uniquely suits their needs. Each organization is unique in the degree of flexibility and mobility in which they work so that all employees are enabled to be their most creative and successful versions of themselves, regardless of where they live. Find your place at Okta today! https://www.okta.com/company/careers/.  
  
Some roles may require travel to one of our office locations for in-person onboarding.

Okta is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, physical or mental disability, or status as a protected veteran. We also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and convictions records, consistent with applicable laws.
  
  
If reasonable accommodation is needed to complete any part of the job application, interview process, or onboarding please use this Form to request an accommodation.

Okta is committed to complying with applicable data privacy and security laws and regulations. For more information, please see our Privacy Policy at https://www.okta.com/privacy-policy/.

  

**Okta**

The foundation for secure connections between people and technology

Okta is the leading independent provider of identity for the enterprise. The Okta Identity Cloud enables organizations to securely connect the right people to the right technologies at the right time. With over 7,000 pre-built integrations to applications and infrastructure providers, Okta customers can easily and securely use the best technologies for their business. More than 19,300 organizations, including JetBlue, Nordstrom, Slack, T-Mobile, Takeda, Teach for America, and Twilio, trust Okta to help protect the identities of their workforces and customers.
company_description: Okta is the foundation for secure connections between people and technology.

title: Senior IT Product Manager (GTM)
description:
Santa Clara, California, United States Information Technology Full-time Ref ID: JR-004834

**Our Mission**

At Palo Alto Networks® everything starts and ends with our mission:

Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  
Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we’re looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.

**Who We Are**

We take our mission of protecting the digital way of life seriously. We are relentless in protecting our customers and we believe that the unique ideas of every member of our team contributes to our collective success. Our values were crowdsourced by employees and are brought to life through each of us everyday - from disruptive innovation and collaboration, to execution. From showing up for each other with integrity to creating an environment where we all feel included.

As a member of our team, you will be shaping the future of cybersecurity. We work fast, value ongoing learning, and we respect each employee as a unique individual. Knowing we all have different needs, our development and personal wellbeing programs are designed to give you choice in how you are supported. This includes our FLEXBenefits wellbeing spending account with over 1,000 eligible items selected by employees, our mental and financial health resources, and our personalized learning opportunities - just to name a few!

At Palo Alto Networks, we believe in the power of collaboration and value in-person interactions. This is why our employees generally work full time from our office with flexibility offered where needed. This setup fosters casual conversations, problem-solving, and trusted relationships. Our goal is to create an environment where we all win with precision.

**Your Career**

We are seeking a strategic Senior Product Manager to lead the GTM Sales Platform, driving innovation, rapid development, and launch, with a focus on Data Quality and CRM integrity.

In this role you will be pivotal in driving cultural transformation on utilizing cutting-edge technologies to revolutionize how we sell at Scale.

**Your Impact**

Shape the Future of Sales at Scale: Senior Product Manager GTM Sales at Palo Alto Networks

* Own and drive impactful business outcomes
* Drive transformative change within the organization, wearing multiple hats (strategy development, product & program management, execution) to do what it takes to “move the needle”
* Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to gather insights, co-create deliverables, and drive execution to achieve business goals
* Lead the creation of a comprehensive, long-term vision for the Sales and GTM platform that aligns with company-wide objectives and fosters cultural change
* Ensure the product remains adaptable by anticipating industry trends and Seller needs
* Cultivate relationships across all organizational levels, communicating progress and managing expectations effectively
* Identify system and process gaps across the organization and advocate for advanced technological solutions that drive ROI and operational efficiency
* Lead cross-functional product teams and engineering teams to execute the product vision - Foster collaboration and ensure projects are completed on time, within budget, and with measurable value to the enterprise
* Partner with the Enablement team to provide ongoing user training, ensuring the sales organization can fully leverage the product capabilities
* Stay ahead of industry trends by identifying and recommending technologies that enable scalability and maintain competitive differentiation

**Your Experience**

Must have:

* Must have 10+ years of experience with a minimum of 4 years in management consulting , or top-tier tech strategy or "bizops" roles
* Strong communication and presentation skills with the ability to to pitch product strategy to Executive leadership(including C-Suite)
* Strong experience in Go-To-Market systems with a proven track record of managing and delivering high-impact technology projects
* Expertise in managing Lead to Opportunity in the Salesforce Ecosystem with SFDC Expertise in the SaaS and/or Enterprise software industry is preferred - Knowledge of AI/ Gen-AI solutions and GTM is a plus
* Local to SF Bay Area who can be onsite

Preferred:

* Experience in program management and overseeing large-scale transformations
* Demonstrated ability to partner with geographically distributed teams and external vendors to deliver impactful and scalable solutions
* Expertise in product management, including incubating product capabilities and scaling , gathering requirements, and developing detailed functional plans
* Great teammate, willing to passionately roll up their sleeves and work cross-functionally to get things done
* A proactive self-starter who excels in fast-paced, high-growth environments

**The Team**

You will be part of a growing, passionate, and dynamic team with an opportunity to work on challenging and exciting projects centered on what we believe is one of the most significant mission statements in the world. We also strive to be the most people-centric company ever! That means were constantly working to make your experience amazing, and you are part of the team breaking boundaries of what the workplace can be!

This is a unique opportunity to lead transformative initiatives that will drive efficiency, innovation, and cultural change across a large, global sales organization. You will be at the forefront of integrating advanced technologies into our sales processes, positioning the company for long-term success while delivering meaningful value to customers and stakeholders alike.

**Compensation Disclosure**

The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. For candidates who receive an offer at the posted level, the starting base salary (for non-sales roles) or base salary + commission target (for sales/commissioned roles) is expected to be between $141,000/YR - $229,000/YR. The offered compensation may also include restricted stock units and a bonus. A description of our employee benefits may be found here.

**Our Commitment**  
  
We’re problem solvers that take risks and challenge cybersecurity’s status quo. It’s simple: we can’t accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.

We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at accommodations@paloaltonetworks.com.

Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
company_description: Your career will have a global impact: one that protects our way of life in the digital age by preventing successful cyberattacks.

title: Cloud Orchestration Technical Marketing Engineer
description:
This job is available in 2 locations

See all

Category

Engineering

Job Type

Full time

Job Id

1189681No

  

Cloud Orchestration Technical Marketing Engineer  
This role has been designed as ‘Hybrid’ with an expectation that you will work on average 2 days per week from an HPE office.

**Who We Are:**

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.

**Job Description:**

**Unicorn Wanted!** The HPE Morpheus Software stack is now powering HPE's virtualization and private cloud portfolio; we need your help developing technical content and executing programs to get the word out to a variety of audiences. This Cloud Orchestration Technical Marketing leader focuses on communicating the value and benefits of hybrid cloud orchestration technologies to internal and external stakeholders including customers, partners, sales engineers, and industry analysts. The role involves creating technical content, delivering presentations, providing product evangelism, and collaborating with other teams to influence product development, go-to-market strategy, and market positioning.

***Responsibilities***

* **Content Creation:** Develop technical documentation, presentations, white papers, blogs, and other materials that explain the features, benefits, and use cases of cloud orchestration solutions.
* **Product Enablement:** Train sales teams, partners, and customers on the technology, providing hands-on training and guidance.
* **Go-to-Market Strategy:** Contribute to the development of marketing strategies, including competitive analysis and positioning of the product in the market.
* **Product Feedback:** Collect and analyze market feedback, providing insights to product management and engineering teams to improve the product roadmap.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with product management, sales, engineering, and other teams to ensure alignment and successful product launches.
* **Industry Engagement:** Participate in industry events, trade shows, and conferences to promote the product and build relationships with key influencers.
* **Technical Expertise:** Maintain a strong understanding of cloud technologies, orchestration principles, and competitive offerings.
* **Problem Solving:** Address technical questions and issues from customers and partners, providing solutions and guidance.
* **Demo and POC Support:** May assist in setting up and managing demo environments and proof-of-concept projects alongside sales engineers
* **Communication:** Communicate technical information clearly and concisely to both technical and non-technical audiences.

***Domain Specific Knowledge and Skills:***

* **Cloud Computing Fundamentals:** cloud computing concepts (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS), deployment models (public, private, hybrid), and cloud architectures. Technical experience with major providers (AWS, Azure, and GCP)
* **Virtualization & Container Technologies:** Experience with virtualization technologies (e.g. VMware, Nutanix, Microsoft, KVM) plus containers and related orchestration tools (e.g. Kubernetes, Rancher, OpenShift).
* **Infrastructure-as-Code:** Understanding of Infrastructure-as-Code (IaC) principles and tools like Terraform, which are crucial for managing and automating cloud infrastructure.
* **Automation, and Configuration Management:** Knowledge of configuration management tools like Ansible, Chef, or Puppet for automating software deployment. Proficiency in scripting languages like Python or Bash for task automation.
* **Infrastructure Fundamentals:** Basic understanding of networking concepts, including network topologies, protocols, and security principles as well as storage, including block/file, backup, and DR
* **App Development Fundamentals:** Basic understanding of programming concepts and potentially a general-purpose language like Java.
* **Troubleshooting & Problem Solving:** Ability to diagnose and resolve technical issues, including those related to the Morpheus Data platform and related technologies.
* **IT Service Management (ITSM):** Understanding of ITSM concepts and experience with ITSM tools, specifically ServiceNow.
* **Competitive Landscape:** Experience and knowledge of VMware Aria Automation (vRA) and Nutanix Cloud Manager (calm.io), CloudBolt, and others
* **Morpheus Data Platform:** Knowledge of the Morpheus Data platform, its features, functionalities, and use cases. Hands-on experience with the platform a huge plus.

***Generalized Knowledge and Skills:***

* Extensive team skills and ability to cross functionally drive/influence work through others to lead and achieve results for complex, ambiguous projects.
* General business acumen and knowledge of root cause analysis and problem detection.
* Cross-functional skills and experience working with software development lifecycles, product management, solution architecture, and marketing/sales

***Education and Experience Required:***

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering or related field of study. MBA or advanced degree in computer science or engineering preferred.
* 10+ years of work experience in related field. Mix of experience as practitioner, sales engineer, customer, and/or professional services delivery is valuable.
* Technical understanding and knowledge of on hypervisors, Kubernetes, and public cloud as well as adjacent automation scripting and IaC

Cross Domain Knowledge, Customer Engagement, Design Thinking, Development Fundamentals, DevOps, Go-to-Market Expertise, Partner Management, Product Lifecycle Management, Security-First Mindset, Strategic Pricing, Strategy Creation, User Experience (UX), Value Creation, Vendor Management

We strive to provide our team members and their loved ones with a comprehensive suite of benefits that supports their physical, financial and emotional wellbeing.

**Personal & Professional Development**

We also invest in your career because the better you are, the better we all are. We have specific programs catered to helping you reach any career goals you have — whether you want to become a knowledge expert in your field or apply your skills to another division.

**Unconditional Inclusion**

We are unconditionally inclusive in the way we work and celebrate individual uniqueness. We know varied backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good.

title: Marketing Manager - Consumer & Private Bank
description:
Texas Capital is built to help businesses and their leaders. Our depth of knowledge and expertise allows us to bring the best of the big firms at a scale that works for our clients, with highly experienced bankers who truly invest in people’s success — today and tomorrow.

While we are rooted in core financial products, we are differentiated by our approach. Our bankers are seasoned financial experts who possess deep experience across a multitude of industries. Equally important, they bring commitment — investing the time and resources to understand our clients’ immediate needs, identify market opportunities and meet long-term objectives. At Texas Capital, we do more than build business success. We build long-lasting relationships.

Texas Capital provides a variety of benefits to colleagues, including health insurance coverage, wellness program, fertility and family building aids, life and disability insurance, retirement savings plans with a generous 401K match, paid leave programs, paid holidays, and paid time off (PTO).

Headquartered in Dallas with offices in Austin, Fort Worth, Houston, Richardson, Plano and San Antonio, Texas Capital was recently named Best Regional Bank in 2024 by Bankrate and was named to *The Dallas Morning News*’ Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex Top Workplaces 2023 and GoBankingRate’s 2023 list of Best Regional Banks. For more information about joining our team, please visit us at

www.texascapitalbank.com

.

Overview:

The Marketing Manager will work closely with the Texas Capital Bank Consumer and Private Bank lines of business in developing a marketing strategy, establishing a high level of business engagement, and accelerating business development that drives client adoption of solutions and services.

The Marketing Manager will create the most relevant marketing assets while rationalizing assets that are no longer relevant but require changes. Content and assets should be leveraged across all channels, with a focus on digital.

Responsibilities:

* Define in partnership with the brand, product and line of business leaders the positioning of the Private Bank and Texas Capital Bank Consumer teams and their related products and services.
* Develop go-to-market calendars in conjunction with the Marketing and Communication teams.
* Define a strategy of key product marketing activities and manage budgets to support the acquisition, deepening and retention of new customers.
* Deep understanding of product portfolio and collaboration with product team on launches of new products and changes of existing products.
* Identify and create relevant marketing assets that support the different stages of the product sales cycle; Execute effective marketing strategies to drive awareness, consideration and leads.
* Partner with content strategist to develop product one pagers, web content, insights and testimonials.
* Work cross-functionally across all marketing channels to ensure flawless execution of various channel-specific marketing campaigns (e.g. paid media, affiliates, social accounts, website, email and direct mail, events and sponsorships, etc.).
* Define KPIs that measure and optimize marketing strategies, partnering with sales enablement teams to provide regular reporting and executive summaries on programs and initiatives.

Qualifications:

* 8 years plus experience in financial services marketing; Consumer banking preferred.
* Bachelor’s degree in business or marketing.
* Knowledge of wealth management and consumer products and solutions.
* Extensive direct marketing experience with strong understanding of digital marketing techniques.
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and drive adoption in asset usage.
* Superior communication, problem solving skills and ability to learn and adapt quickly.
* Self-motivated with ability to work independently and strong organizational skills.
* Demonstrates flexibility in a growing and changing environment.
* Comfortable using collaboration and CRM tools such as Copilot, Asana and Salesforce.
* Familiar with marketing automation tools such as Salesforce, Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC), and Google Analytics.

*The duties listed above are the essential functions, or fundamental duties within the job classification. The essential functions of individual positions within the classification may differ. Texas Capital Bank may assign reasonably related additional duties to individual employees consistent with standard departmental policy.Texas Capital is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*
company_description: Texas Capital Bank builds long-term relationships with business leaders who are focused on securing financial success through every phase of their company.

title: IT Training and Enablement Specialist
company: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas
description:
Under the general direction of the Supervisor, Service Desk, the Information Technology Training and Enablement Specialist responsible for the design, development, implementation, and management of comprehensive information technology training programs that serve both the IT division and the broader organization. This role aligns training and initiatives to enable employees to adopt new and emerging technologies, identify skill gaps and targeted training solutions that enhance technical proficiency, user adoption of tools, and overall digital capability. This position cultivates and effectively utilizes current and emerging technologies, contributes to digital transformation efforts, and supports the organization’s digital evolution.  
  
\\*\\* This position is eligible to work onsite or hybrid (9 or more days a month onsite) in accordance with our Telecommuting Policy. Applicants must reside in Kansas or Missouri or be willing to relocate as a condition of employment.

Are you ready to make a difference? Choose to work for one of the most trusted companies in Kansas.

Why Join Us?

* Family Comes First: Total rewards package that promotes the idea of family first for all employees.
* Professional Growth Opportunities: Advance your career with ongoing training and development programs.
* Dynamic Work Environment: Collaborate with a team of passionate and driven individuals.
* Trust: Work for one of the most trusted companies in Kansas
* Stability: 80 years of commitment, compassion and community

Compensation

$72,000 - $86,000

Exempt 15

* Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas offers excellent competitive compensation with the goal of retaining and growing talented team members. The salary range for this role is a good faith estimate, it is estimated based on what a successful candidate might be paid. All offers presented to candidates are carefully reviewed to ensure fair, equitable pay by offering competitive salaries that align with the individual's skills, education, experience, and training. The range may vary above or below the stated amounts.

What you’ll do

* Partners and Collaborates with IT Leadership and other BCBSKS internal teams to identify training needs and to establish long-term training strategy.
* Organizes and coordinates all activities related to IT training programs.
* Develops training curricula and/or recommends utilizing vendor programs to meet instructional goals and objectives.
* Creates course content and materials that engage and encourage learner participation.
* Facilitates instructor-led training (ILT) in person or via virtual platforms, ensuring engagement and knowledge retention.
* Stays current with emerging technologies and trends.
* Researches, selects and/or develops training aids, course content, training handbooks, multimedia visual aids, tutorials, etc. To encourage learner participation.
* Establishes metrics to measure performance and success of learning/training programs.
* Maintains repository of training documentation and guides
* Maintains repository of training documentation and guides.
* Coordinates or performs administrative functions necessary to deliver and document training programs, including, but not limited to, training venues, timing, and modality.
* Develops and tracks annual training budget

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities

* Expertise in training and instructional design methodologies (e.g., ADDIE, SAM) with strong knowledge of business training techniques.
* Experience collaborating with IT departments, understanding technical terminology, workflows, and supporting IT-related communication initiatives.
* Proficient in Microsoft 365, Teams, SharePoint, and common enterprise applications.
* Skilled in translating complex technical concepts into clear, accessible learning content.
* Strong presentation, facilitation, and communication skills for engaging diverse audiences.
* Effective project and time management capabilities, with experience managing multiple priorities and organizational tasks.
* Analytical and problem-solving skills, including root cause analysis to identify training needs and innovate solutions.
* Collaborative approach with the ability to work cross-functionally across departments and represent training interests in committees or workgroups.
* Committed to continuous professional development to enhance instructional and technical expertise.

What you need

* Bachelor’s degree in information technology, business, instructional design, organization development, or related field.
* Three years’ experience as a Training Specialist or similar role in lieu of degree.
* Minimum of three years’ experience in developing and facilitating adult training programs in a business setting.
* Certifications such as: CompTIA Certified Technical Trainer, Certified Professional in Learning and Performance, ITIL Foundation Certification or Train-the-Trainer Certification preferred.
* Strong communication and presentation skills.
* Ability to translate complex technical concepts into accessible learning content.
* Excellent organizational and project management skills.
* Collaborative mindset with the ability to work across departments and with diverse teams.
* Analytical skills to assess training effectiveness and make data-driven improvements.
* Must have and maintain a valid Kansas Driving License

Benefits & Perks

* Base compensation is only one component of your competitive Total Rewards package.
* Incentive pay program (EPIP.
* Health/Vision/Dental insurance
* 6 weeks paid parental leave for new mothers and fathers
* Fertility/Adoption assistance
* 2 weeks paid caregiver leave
* 5% 401(k) plan matching
* Tuition reimbursement
* Health & fitness benefits, discounts and resources

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging

At Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas, we are committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB), where mutual respect is at the foundation of our workplace. We provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, belief, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation, and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical or mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military or veteran status, family or parental status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

We believe that embracing diversity and authentically promoting inclusion, equity, and belonging among our team members is crucial to our collective success. By intentionally recruiting, developing, and retaining a diverse pool of talent, we cultivate an environment where everyone feels valued, heard, and empowered to contribute. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities upon request, ensuring an inclusive and accessible hiring process for all.

Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Kansas conducts pre-employment drug screening, criminal conviction check, employment verifications and education as part of a conditional offer of employment.

title: Senior Marketing Specialist
description:
Summary

**Title:**

Senior Marketing Specialist

  

**ID:**

22872

  

**Department Name:**

Marketing

  

**Location:**

Atlanta, GA (Hybrid)

Description

LIMRA, LOMA, and our parent organization, LL Global, Inc., are the world's largest association of life insurance and financial services companies, which together represent more than 700 members across 60+ countries, including most of the world's largest life insurance and retirement companies. Our mission is to advance the financial services industry by empowering our members with knowledge, insights, connections, and solutions.

**We offer a ‘Work For Your Day’ extremely flexible hybrid schedule. Locations are either Atlanta, GA or Windsor, CT or potentially open to full time remote for the ideal candidate.**

**Essential Functions**  
  
As a B2B2C Snr. Marketing Specialist, you'll be responsible for optimizing learner engagement and generating referrals for our Professional Development products within our client companies to make the most of their professional development opportunities.

The ideal candidate is a creative, data-driven marketer with experience in integrated marketing across channels. This position requires a professional who will work closely with cross-functional teams including product and sales to align marketing efforts and deliver measurable results.

**Campaign Strategy & Execution:**

* Develop comprehensive marketing plans that include clear objectives, tactics, timelines, and KPIs for B2B member engagement and B2B2C learner engagement
* Responsible for creating content across various digital mediums and sales enablement content, such as sales presentations, case studies, emails, social posts, infographics, value statements, video scripts, etc.
* Develop and execute strategies to engage Learning & Development and Education Representatives in driving learner engagement
* Develop and execute joint campaigns with members to drive learner engagement, ensuring alignment on campaign goals, messaging, and performance metrics

* Provide member relations & sales with sales enablement needed to engage members and drive business development

* Use data and analytics to monitor campaign performance and generate insights that optimize strategy across B2B and B2B2C channels
* As needed, develop and execute B2B2C marketing strategies in support of other products/member benefits as needed
* Track KPIs related to campaign effectiveness providing regular reports to leadership
* Continuously improve the learner experience and marketing ROI through A/B testing, segmentation, and personalization tactic

**Education and Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field. (MBA preferred)
* 5-8 years of marketing experience, preferably in a business-to-business-to-consumer environment
* Experience with building and executing product marketing strategies
* Insurance or financial services experience a plus

* Demonstrated creativity and proven track record of independently developing innovative and creative marketing campaigns
* Excellent communication (both written and verbal) and influencing skills
* Proficiency in product positioning, understanding the competitive landscape, marketing plan development messaging strategy and story telling
* Knowledge of business-to-business-to-consumer marketing concepts and techniques
* Ability to plan, organize and manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines
* Ability to solve problems independently with minimal supervision
* Strong organizational, time and project management skills with attention to detail and ability to juggle multiple priorities to meet deadlines
* Strong interpersonal skills to listen and influence others throughout the organization
* Ability to make decisions, function and act independently with minimal supervision
* Excellence in collaboration and leading project teams.
* Must have strong analytical skills to effectively assess and communicate metrics
* Fluency with Microsoft Office — PowerPoint, Word, Excel
* Experience withdigital marketing and email marketing platforms (e.g., Pardot, Exact Target, Constant Contact, Real Magnet, INFORMZ)
* Must be able to work effectively across functional groups and with business partners
* Must possess a positive, can-do attitude with an ability to identify options when problems occur

* Must enjoy working in a fast-paced environment with daily deadlines and ongoing time demands
* Open and responsive to constructive feedback
* Strong time and project management skills as well as excellent organization skills and attention to detail

We are an Equal Opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, ancestry, color, religion, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, medical condition, disability, veteran status, or any other basis protected by law.

This Employer Participates in E-Verify. See the E-Verify notices.

Este Empleador Participa en E-Verify. Ver el E-Verify avisos.

title: Sr. Quoting Analyst
description:
At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com

**Job Function:**

Sales Enablement

**Job Sub Function:**

Contract Administration and Management

**Job Category:**

Professional

**All Job Posting Locations:**

Cincinnati, Ohio, United States of America, Raritan, New Jersey, United States of America, Raynham, Massachusetts, United States of America, West Chester, Pennsylvania, United States of America

**Job Description:**

Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for a **Sr. Quoting Analyst** within our Strategic Account Management team. This position is located onsite at our Raritan NJ site. Alternate locations available at our Cincinnati, OH; West Chester, PA; or Raynham, MA sites.

**An internal pre-identified candidate for consideration has been identified. However, all applications will be considered.**

**About Surgery**

Fueled by innovation at the intersection of biology and technology, we’re developing the next generation of smarter, less invasive, more personalized treatments.

Are you passionate about improving and expanding the possibilities of surgery? Ready to join a team that’s reimagining how we heal? Our Surgery team will give you the chance to deliver surgical technologies and solutions to surgeons and healthcare professionals around the world. Your contributions will help effectively treat some of the world’s most prevalent conditions such as obesity, cardiovascular disease and cancer. Patients are waiting!

Your unique talents will help patients on their journey to wellness. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/medtech

**Position Summary**

The Sr. Quoting Analyst is responsible for the development of offers including products, pricing, compliance requirements, financials, and T&Cs for customers in MedTech Surgery. The analyst will serve as the subject matter expert for the business represented and will partner closely with the Offer Development Manager/Directors, Contracting Directors, Pricing Managers, and other Offer Development Analysts to develop the most appropriate offers and scenarios to serve our customers and uphold our strategies. The analyst will shift focus between strategic partnerships involving development of complex innovative deal structures and enforcing a narrower set of options for less strategic customers. The analyst is also responsible for coaching, mentoring and developing Quoting Analysts on internal processes and strategies, and use of analytical tools. The analyst will serve as a consultant on pricing matrices, business rules, and new programs. They may be asked to serve as a product platform lead/SME.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Develop detailed, accurate offers and analysis using product expertise, business insight and professional judgment while adhering to contracting strategies and price matrices
* Own the quality of the offer and support its fit within our strategic and financial objectives
* Identify areas for improvement within systems, processes, and interactions. Surface and provide recommendations regularly to management to support efficiency and evolution of strategy
* Take an active role in developing and improving training materials and SOPs
* Coach / mentor developing Quoting Analysts to strengthen their proficiency and improve the quality of their work.

**Other Duties:**

* Ad hoc analytics for platform programs, rebates, etc.
* Salesforce analytics (# deals signed, when, extensions).
* Analysis and change recommendations of pricing matrices.
* Support of national account, gpo, and other significant RFPs.

**Qualifications**

**Education:**

* Minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required, concentration in Finance, Business, Accounting, Economics, Marketing, or Data Analytics is preferred.

**Required:**

* Minimum of 4 years related work experience.
* High Proficiency in MS Excel with experience extracting significant detailed data sets from various sources, compiling, and analyzing.
* Strong analytical skills with experience performing or assisting in complex and comprehensive analytics.
* Self-starter with demonstrated ability to incorporate strategies or guidelines based on situational competitive dynamics, financial goals, and customer needs.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required, with ability to make the complex simple when explaining analytical findings to non-analytical business partners.
* Ability to work well in a cross-functional environment and build support across a complex set of collaborators.
* Proficiency in prioritizing and managing multiple concurrent deliverables for different end users.
* Up to 10% business travel may be required.

**Preferred:**

* Experience with special project ownership and management within offer development.
* Experience in customer price benchmarking or risk assessment.
* Understanding of P&L and price implications on profitability.
* Demonstrated peer-to-peer leadership.

**Benefits Summary:**

* Employees and/or eligible dependents may be eligible to participate in the following Company sponsored employee benefit programs: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, business accident insurance, and group legal insurance.
* Employees may be eligible to participate in the Company’s consolidated retirement plan (pension) and savings plan (401(k)).
* This position is eligible to participate in the Company’s long-term incentive program.
* Employees are eligible for the following time off benefits:
  + Vacation – up to 120 hours per calendar year
  + Sick time - up to 40 hours per calendar year; for employees who reside in the State of Washington – up to 56 hours per calendar year
  + Holiday pay, including Floating Holidays – up to 13 days per calendar year
  + Work, Personal and Family Time - up to 40 hours per calendar year

Additional information can be found through the link below!

https://www.careers.jnj.com/employee-benefits

Johnson & Johnson is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by federal, state or local law. We actively seek qualified candidates who are protected veterans and individuals with disabilities as defined under VEVRAA and Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act.

Johnson and Johnson is committed to providing an interview process that is inclusive of our applicants’ needs. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request an accommodation, please email the Employee Health Support Center (ra-employeehealthsup@its.jnj.com) or contact AskGS to be directed to your accommodation resource.

**The anticipated base pay range for this position is :**

$77,000 - $124,200

Additional Description for Pay Transparency:

The Company maintains highly competitive, performance-based compensation programs. Under current guidelines, this position is eligible for an annual performance bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable plan. The annual performance bonus is a cash bonus intended to provide an incentive to achieve annual targeted results by rewarding for individual and the corporation’s performance over a calendar/performance year. Bonuses are awarded at the Company’s discretion on an individual basis.

title: DTC Partner Enablement Manager
description:
Seattle, WA • + 2 more•Full Time

**Meta**

**Facebook Reality Labs**

**Business Development**

**Consumer Marketing**

**Sales**

At Meta Reality Labs, we're building the future of human connection - one that bridges the physical and digital worlds through immersive technologies. We're looking for a strategic and results-oriented ecommerce leader to shape and scale our marketplace programs, elevating how people discover and engage with Meta's Wearables and Metaverse products.
As the DTC Partner Enablement Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in driving growth and brand visibility across our international marketplace footprint for the Reality Labs Global Sales organization. You'll lead the strategy and execution for experiential programs, integrated channel initiatives, and data-driven optimization for our Direct-to-Consumer business.

**DTC Partner Enablement Manager Responsibilities**

+ Develop and execute marketing strategies: Build and implement data-driven marketing plans to drive sales, conversion, and customer satisfaction for Meta's Direct to Consumer channel

+ Expand reach and customer impact: Launch new merchandising programs and customer touchpoints across all DTC channel surfaces to increase visibility and awareness during high-velocity seasonal moments

+ Optimize product listings: Own listing management and optimization across multiple marketplaces to drive customer engagement and sales conversion

+ Analyze performance metrics: Leverage sales and site performance data to optimize content, promotions, and marketing strategies at a global level

+ Monitor marketplace functionality and performance: Partner with cross-functional teams to resolve technical issues, ensure compliance with marketplace requirements, and maintain top-rated seller performance for our official Meta Store

+ Influence with marketplace expertise: Stay informed of marketplace and digital commerce trends, platform innovations, and evolving best practices to remain competitive

+ Innovate channel marketing: Identify opportunities to evolve the omnichannel customer experience for Wearables and Metaverse products to drive growth and increase channel share for the DTC business

+ Drive customer insights: Demonstrate understanding of Meta’s customer to inform messaging, product positioning, and assortment strategy

+ Operate with a growth mindset: Design and execute A/B tests to optimize engagement and conversion with an iterative experimentation approach to impact customer behavior across global marketplaces

+ Create compelling content: Develop engaging product descriptions, performant creative and video content that bring Meta’s technology to life for customers

+ Manage budgets: Oversee account and creative resourcing budgets to maximize ROI on initiatives and achieve business objectives

+ Plan strategically: Contribute to the annual and seasonal calendar for the DTC organization in alignment with business goals and company priorities

+ Conduct performance reviews: Track and report on business performance, sharing actionable insights with leadership and key stakeholders

+ Gather competitive intelligence: Monitor retail and category trends to identify game-changing growth opportunities

**Minimum Qualifications**

+ 3+ years of experience in e-commerce, digital merchandising, channel marketing, product marketing, product management, or category/vendor management or similar field

+ Proven track record of launching and scaling programs that deliver measurable growth

+ Demonstrated understanding of online customer behavior and marketplace dynamics

+ Effective cross-functional collaboration skills across Product, Marketing, Engineering, Analytics, Operations, and Sales

+ Data-driven decision-making mindset with experience in A/B testing and performance analytics

**Preferred Qualifications**

+ Experience with global online marketplaces like Shopify, Amazon, eBay, Target, or Walmart, strongly preferred

For those who live in or expect to work from California if hired for this position.

**About Meta**

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

  
$122,000/year to $176,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits  
  
Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.  

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures.

title: O&O Revenue and Brand Management Manager
description:
**Location: GA-Atlanta**

**Job Title: O&O Revenue and Brand Management Manager**

**Position Overview**
---------------------

Cox Media Group (CMG) is a dynamic media company with top-performing brands and a passion for innovation. The Manager, O&O Revenue & Brand Management plays a critical role in driving revenue through CMG’s owned and operated brand platforms.  
This role balances strategic planning and hands-on execution across both digital and traditional media. This individual will focus heavily on HubSpot stewardship, sponsorship development, and site experience optimization, the Brand Revenue Manager supports local market sales teams by aligning technology, content, and advertising products to optimize client solutions and maximize revenue outcomes.

The ideal candidate brings a deep understanding of digital media, broadcast operations, and sales enablement tools, working collaboratively across departments and vendor partners to deliver results.

This is a hybrid position based in Atlanta, GA.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**
-----------------------------------------

**Revenue Strategy & Enablement**

* Lead sponsorship opportunity creation and communication across CMG brands.
* Manage HubSpot dashboard stewardship, including optimization of lead capture and sales workflows.
* Evaluate and improve “Advertise with Us” paths to ensure ease of use and increased client conversion.
* Partner with Programmatic, AdTech, and Streaming teams to identify new monetization opportunities.
* Oversee live stream and now stream revenue tracking, ensuring accuracy and strategic insights.
* Support brand website audits, maintaining navigation structure standards that align with revenue goals.

**Site and Product Operations**

* Oversee brand website audits, ensuring content and navigation support both user experience and advertising goals.
* Serve as liaison with IT and Digital Operations for updates and revisions to CMG websites and mobile apps.
* Partner with Product and Programmatic teams to evaluate and onboard new advertising technologies including L-bar ads, overlays, pause ads, etc.

**Revenue and Partnership Oversight**

* Track and report on sponsorship and O&O revenue, including linear and digital streams, using Tableau, BI, and Amagi.
* Monitor live streaming and broadcast revenue performance; identify trends and optimize pricing or packaging strategies.
* Attend and represent CMG in partnership meetings with Google, Amagi, Streamguys, and other vendor/technology partners.
* Manage relationships with third-party vendors including QUU, Adsync, AudioServe, and Adswizz for audio and broadcast integrations.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities (continued)**
-----------------------------------------------------

**Market Support**

* Work with markets to escalate and resolve Wide Orbit billing or operational issues, including collaboration with ARM and finance teams.
* Provide insights and guidance on AI-generated content usage, branded promotions, and cross-platform sponsorships.

**Core Operational Responsibilities**

* Ensure operational efficiency in Wide Orbit and WOMS systems for both digital and linear orders.
* Manage specialized unit codes to maintain clean revenue reporting across platforms.
* Lead tracking and accountability for first-party data collection and monetization across both broadcast and digital.
* Support CMG’s branded content partnerships (e.g., Wunderkind, newsletters, and social brands).

**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

* Bachelor’s degree in marketing, Media, Business, or related field.
* 7+ years’ experience in media revenue operations across both digital and broadcast platforms.
* Proficiency with tools such as HubSpot, Tableau, Wide Orbit, WOMS, and Google Ad Manager.
* Excellent communication, organizational, and project management skills.
* Demonstrated ability to work cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Technology, and Finance teams.

**About Cox Media Group**  
CMG Media Corporation (d/b/a Cox Media Group) is an industry-leading media company with unparalleled brands, award-winning content, and exceptional team members. CMG provides valuable local and national journalism and entertainment content to the people and communities it serves. The company's businesses encompass 14 high-quality, market-leading television brands in 9 markets; 49 top-performing radio stations delivering multiple genres of content in 10 markets; and numerous streaming and digital platforms. CMG's TV portfolio includes multiple primary affiliates of ABC, CBS, FOX, NBC, Telemundo and MyNetworkTV, as well as several valuable news and independent stations. For more information about CMG, visit **www.coxmediagroup.com**

title: Head of Commercial Learning & Development, North America (NAM)
description:
Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.  
  
Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

The Head of Learning & Development, North America (NAM) is an integral part of the global Commercial L&D organization, reporting to the Global Head of Commercial Learning & Development. While globally connected, this role is accountable for supporting the NAM region’s strategic objectives by designing and delivering a tailored learning curriculum.  
  
This includes leading the transformation of our sales training process—shifting toward a scalable, value-based selling methodology that aligns with our customer-centric strategy and drives measurable commercial outcomes. This role ensures that global frameworks are adapted to meet regional needs, enabling consistency in capability building while addressing local market dynamics.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Strategy & Design**

* Expertise in adult learning principles, instructional design, and modern learning technologies. Ability to source, evaluate, and implement scalable methodologies—especially for sales training and execution.
* Develop and own the NAM L&D strategy for the commercial organization, aligned with business goals and performance outcomes.
* Define competency frameworks and career pathways for all commercial roles, including Account Executives, KAM, Sales Managers, Product Specialists, and others.
* Ensure scalability of programs across diverse markets while allowing for regional customization.
* Partner with commercial leaders to define competencies and behaviors critical to success in customer-facing roles.

**Execution & Delivery**

* Lead the design and implementation of onboarding, skills-based training, leadership development, and functional academies.
* Establish and manage an NAM L&D calendar, incorporating product launches, strategic priorities, and market needs.
* Drive consistent adoption of learning technologies (e.g., LMS, virtual learning platforms, digital coaching tools).
* Lead a team of learning professionals and collaborate with external vendors as needed.
* Oversee the development of training content, including role-plays, manager toolkits, and reinforcement mechanisms and keeping with current industry trends.

**Performance & Impact**

* Define KPIs and performance metrics to assess program effectiveness and learning ROI (e.g., time-to-productivity, quota attainment uplift, competency mastery).
* Continuously evolve content and formats based on data, feedback, and commercial priorities. Promote a learning culture embedded in the business with measurable impact on execution and commercial success.
* Ensure integration of learning programs into broader talent development and performance management systems.

**Qualifications:**

* 10+ years of experience in Learning & Development, with at least 5 years in a commercial leadership role.
* Proven success in designing and implementing sales training programs, ideally in a global or matrixed organization.
* Proven success in leading global training initiatives across geographies and cultures.
* Deep understanding of adult learning principles, instructional design, and sales enablement.
* Experience with methodologies such as SPIN Selling, Challenger, or Miller Heiman is a plus.
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
* Ability to lead cross-functional initiatives and influence at all levels of the organization.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, Strategy, or related field. MBA preferred.
* Familiarity with CRM tools and their role in sales enablement.
* Understanding of go-to-market models and commercial excellence frameworks.

**Success Metrics:**

* A fully operational commercial academy with clear tracks per role and career stage within 6-12 months.
* Tangible improvement in onboarding time, field productivity, and leadership pipeline.
* Improvement in commercial performance metrics (e.g., win rates, deal velocity, customer satisfaction).
* Increased manager engagement in coaching and reinforcement activities.
* Positive feedback from sales teams on training relevance and effectiveness.
* Integration of learning outcomes into performance reviews and talent assessments

**Key Competencies:**

* **Strategic Thinking & Commercial Acumen:** Ability to align learning strategies with business goals, particularly in commercial and customer-facing areas. Understands the impact of learning on revenue generation, sales enablement, and market competitiveness.
* **Global Leadership & Influence:** Proven experience leading global teams and initiatives across regions and cultures. Skilled in influencing senior stakeholders and driving alignment across matrixed organizations.
* **Learning Innovation & Methodology Design:** Expertise in adult learning principles, instructional design, and modern learning technologies. Ability to source, evaluate, and implement scalable methodologies—especially for sales training and execution.
* **Data-Driven Decision Making:** Uses learning analytics and performance metrics to assess impact and continuously improve programs. Familiarity with tools like Workday and other HRIS platforms for tracking development outcomes.
* **Change Leadership & Transformation:** Leads through ambiguity and drives cultural change through learning. Champions continuous learning as a lever for transformation and agility.
* **Talent Development & Succession Planning:** Deep understanding of potential assessment frameworks (e.g., aspiration, ability, engagement). Builds leadership pipelines and supports high-potential talent development.
* **Collaboration & Cross-Functional Partnership**: Works closely with HRBPs, business leaders, and external vendors to co-create impactful learning experiences. Facilitates knowledge sharing and peer learning across functions and geographies.

**Key Interfaces**

**Internal Stakeholders**

* Global Commercial Operations: Strategy alignment, performance data, execution planning.
* Zone and Country Commercial Leaders: Local adaptation, rollout support, talent feedback.

* Business Lines & Product Management: Product training content, value proposition alignment.
* HR / Talent Development: Career architecture, leadership development integration.
* Marketing & Enablement Teams: Campaign integration, tools utilization.

**External Stakeholders**

* Training vendors and consultants.
* Learning technology providers.
* Industry benchmarking partners (as needed).

**Who we are**: We are a team of more than 73,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

**How we work:** When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.

To find out more about Siemens Healthineers businesses, please visit our company page here.

The annual base pay for this position is:

Min $184,500 - Max $276,700

Factors which may affect starting pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

If this is a commission eligible position the commission eligibility will be in accordance with the terms of the Company's plan. Commissions are based on individual performance and/or company performance.

The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: medical insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401(k) retirement plan. life insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance, paid parking/public transportation, paid time off, paid sick and safe time.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager - AI Business Solutions
description:
As part of the AI Business Solutions team, you’ll join a pioneering group at Microsoft that is reshaping how work gets done across every business function. Our mission is to transform core business processes with AI and agents—empowering organizations to move beyond the constraints of traditional enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems. By reimagining how businesses operate, we help customers become more agile, unlock new levels of productivity, and accelerate growth through intelligent, adaptive solutions that drive real impact.

In this role, you’ll drive the strategy and execution that brings Microsoft’s AI-powered business solutions to market. As a Senior Product Marketing Manager - AI Business Solutions, you’ll shape how customers discover, adopt, and realize value from innovations that modernize business operations and elevate decision-making. You’ll work across product, engineering, and field teams to define positioning, craft compelling narratives, and build go-to-market plans that resonate with business audiences in finance and operations functions. This role offers the opportunity to grow your influence as a strategic marketer, sharpen your skills in competitive analysis and storytelling, and deepen your impact on how organizations evolve with AI.

Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.

In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Translate customer and market insights into differentiated messaging, positioning, and value propositions that resonate with finance, operations, and supply chain business decision-makers, and scale them globally through integrated marketing campaigns.
* Lead the development of go-to-market strategies that drive awareness, adoption, and advocacy for AI-powered business solutions.
* Build and deliver compelling content—including demos, presentations, and sales enablement materials—that clearly communicate product value and impact.
* You will lead cross-functional execution of marketing plans to drive awareness, engagement, and revenue growth, using data to optimize performance.
* Partner with engineering, sales, and partner teams to influence product direction and ensure alignment with customer needs and market opportunities.
* Represent the product at internal and external events, engaging with customers and partners to gather feedback and share the vision.
* Embody our Culture and Values

**Qualifications**
------------------

**Required/Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business or related field AND 5+ years experience in business
* + OR Master's Degree in in Marketing, Computer Science, Business or related field AND 3+ years experience in business
  + OR equivalent experience.

* Experience in product marketing or go-to-marketing strategy for enterprise solutions
* Experience translating complex technical capabilities into clear, compelling messaging for business audiences.
* Experience working with/or crafting messaging for business decision makers.

**Additional or Preferred Qualifications**

* Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business or related field AND 8+ years experience in business
* + OR Master's Degree in Marketing, Computer Science, Business or related field AND 6+ years experience in business
  + OR equivalent experience.
* Experience working for a highly matrixed organization.

Product Marketing IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $106,400 - $203,600 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $137,600 - $222,600 per year.  
  
Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay
  
  
Microsoft will accept applications for the role until June 27, 2025.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Storage System Administrator
description:
**About Peraton**  
Peraton is a next-generation national security company that drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted, highly differentiated solutions and technologies to protect our nation and allies. Peraton operates at the critical nexus between traditional and nontraditional threats across all domains: land, sea, space, air, and cyberspace. The company serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies and supports every branch of the U.S. armed forces. Each day, our employees do the can't be done by solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers. Visit peraton.com to learn how we're keeping people around the world safe and secure.  
  
**Program Overview**  
On-site agile acquisition model that delivers compute, storage, and networking infrastructure without vendor lock in. This program delivers a managed service for the operations and maintenance of data center and support center infrastructure and strategies for cloud enablement  
  
**About The Role**  
  
We are looking for a seasoned **Storage System Administrator**. This position requires a storage system administration background in support of the IRS MIDS contract and will handle a variety of Storage Admin responsibilities This position is responsible for ensuring that all storage devices operate at optimum levels. The candidate must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills. Should be comfortable working in a team environment and willing to work flexible hours. **On-call and after hours support is a requirement of this position.**  
  
**What you will do:**
  
  

* Provides technical oversight of hardware and software systems, with a focus on storage area network administration.
* Provides professional service within the parameters specified in the site's service level agreement and/or that meet or exceed the customer requirements.
* Ensures system security is in compliance with customer policy including patching and auditing.
* Implements and maintains network standards and guidelines.
* Monitors system utilization including data storage management, performance metrics and service levels.
* Ensures reliable backup and recovery of necessary data.
* Develops and maintains an automated environment including reporting, event notifications and actions, software updates and service packs.
* Reports on capacity and does proactive planning for additional storage.
* Allocates storage to servers, configuring fiber channel switches, and capacity planning for the SAN
* Coordinates and communicates activities, status updates, outage notifications and schedule information.
* Performs account maintenance.
* Ensures reliable backup and recovery of necessary data.
* Troubleshoots network communications.
* Maintains and documents SAN cabling plans. Installs, configures, administers, and optimizes servers (hardware and operating systems).
* Interfaces with users is an integral part of this role.
* Maintains network system documentation.
* Provide the root cause analysis on the major incidents/problems.

  
**Qualifications**  
  
**Required Qualifications:**
  
  

* Bachelors Degree and 5 years of experience. Additional 4 years of experience will be accepted in lieu of the degree
* Storage Infrastructure administarion experience
* Virtual Machine management experience
* Managing and Troubleshooting Servers experience
* Virtual Network/Storage Architecture and Connectivity planning experience
* Performance tuning & management experience
* Familiarity withDesign & implement Storage Server Virtualization Solutions
* Strong knowledge on Storage management tools
* Knowledge on Remote system administration
* Understanding of capacity planning, performance monitoring & tuning
* Should have scripting knowledge for scripted installs, comfortable with using Virtual Center.
* Strong knowledge on Storage & Networking concepts
* Able to contribute to internal knowledge management system
* Must be a US Citizen
* Must have resided in the U.S. three of the last five years
* Must be able to obtain and maintain the required agency clearance

  
**Preferred Qualifications:**  
  

* Knowledge on any monitoring tools like SNOW, VROPS, VRO , HPE One View
* PowerShell/PowerCLI Scripting experience is a plus
* One or more experince with the following Tools**:**
* Remote system administration
* Expertise in automation and reduction of manual efforts through scripting/tools
* Incident, Change & Problem Management
* Configuration Management
* Capacity Planning

  
**SCA / Union / Intern Rate or Range**  
  
**Details**  
  
Target Salary Range: $86,000 - $138,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.
  
  
**EEO:** Equal opportunity employer, including disability and protected veterans, or other characteristics protected by law.
