title: Partner Marketing Manager
description:
**Who are we?**

At Twelve Labs, we are pioneering the development of cutting-edge multimodal foundation models that have the ability to comprehend videos just like humans do. Our models have redefined the standards in video-language modeling, empowering us with more intuitive and far-reaching capabilities, and fundamentally transforming the way we interact with and analyze various forms of media.

With a remarkable $107 million in Seed and Series A funding, our company is backed by top-tier venture capital firms such as NVIDIA’s NVentures, NEA, Radical Ventures, and Index Ventures, and prominent AI visionaries and founders such as Fei-Fei Li, Silvio Savarese, Alexandr Wang and more. Headquartered in San Francisco, with an influential APAC presence in Seoul, our global footprint underscores our commitment to driving worldwide innovation.

We are a global company that values the uniqueness of each person’s journey. It is the differences in our cultural, educational, and life experiences that allow us to constantly challenge the status quo. We are looking for individuals who are motivated by our mission and eager to make an impact as we push the bounds of technology to transform the world. Join us as we revolutionize video understanding and multimodal AI.

**Why this role?**

We’re looking to bring a dynamic Partner Marketing Manager to join TwelveLabs’ quickly growing GTM team. This is a high impact, high visibility role combining elements of strategic partnership management and product marketing, you'll be instrumental in accelerating our growth through partner channels. As TwelveLabs revolutionizes how businesses understand and utilize video data with our foundation models, you'll create the bridge between our breakthrough technology and the partner ecosystem that can amplify our reach.

This is a unique opportunity to shape how our transformative AI is positioned, marketed, and sold through our strategic partners in hardware, hyperscalers, cloud platforms, systems integrators, and application providers.

**A typical day at Twelve Labs for this role would look like this:**

* **Partner Enablement & Education**: Create comprehensive enablement programs and materials to ensure partners thoroughly understand Twelve Labs' video foundation models, their unique value propositions, and how they complement partner offerings
* **Content Creation & Management**: Develop compelling partner-focused content including sales decks, one-pagers, case studies, whitepapers, and training materials that articulate our value and drive partner engagement
* **Co-Marketing Strategy & Execution**: Design and implement joint marketing initiatives with partners, including webinars, events, conferences, and digital campaigns to build brand awareness and generate leads
* **Partner Program Development**: Support Partnerships leadership to define, document, and evolve our partner program structure, benefits, and requirements
* **Campaign Management**: Conceive, plan and execute co-marketing campaigns that leverage partner channels to reach new audiences and drive adoption
* **Partner Success Measurement:** Track and report on partner marketing initiatives using relevant metrics, providing data-driven insights to optimize performance
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration**: Work closely with Sales, Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to ensure partners have access to the latest product information and technical resources
* **Industry Expertise**: Maintain deep knowledge of the model landscape to ensure partner messaging addresses industry-specific challenges and opportunities

**This role might be for you if you have some of the following:**

* 5+ years of experience in partner marketing, channel marketing, or product marketing, preferably in high growth startups or mid-stage technology companies
* Experience developing and executing co-marketing initiatives with infrastructure partners (cloud providers, data platforms) and application partners
* Proven track record of creating compelling marketing content and enablement materials for technical products
* Experience with partner management and marketing automation tools
* Exceptional communication and storytelling skills, with the ability to craft compelling narratives for diverse audiences
* Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment, learn rapidly, and adapt to changing priorities
* Strategic thinking combined with tactical execution skills and a data-driven approach to decision-making
* Collaborative mindset with strong project management abilities and cross-functional leadership skills
* Willingness to travel as needed for partner meetings, events, and conferences

Even if there are a few checkboxes that aren’t ticked through your prior experience, we still encourage you to apply! If you are a 0-to-1 achiever, a ferocious learner, and a kind and fun team player who motivates others, you will find a home at Twelve Labs.

We welcome applicants from all walks of life and are committed to equal-opportunity employment. We cherish and celebrate diversity not just because it is the right thing to do, but because it makes our company much stronger.

Benefits and Perks

An open and inclusive culture and work environment.

Work closely with a collaborative, mission-driven team on cutting-edge AI technology.

Full health, dental, and vision benefits

Extremely flexible PTO and parental leave policy. Office closed the week of Christmas and New Years.

title: Senior Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Senior Product Marketing Manager**

At Hive, we are dedicated to creating moments that matter by connecting event marketers to their biggest fans. We are looking to add a Senior PMM to work alongside our RND (Research & Development) teams and GTM teams to develop and implement marketing strategies for two of our most critical product lines: Integrations and Ads.

**What does being a Sr PMM at Hive look like?**

Hive is an email, SMS, and Ads marketing automation platform, empowering brands to personalize their marketing strategies. The Sr PMM role on our team plays a pivotal part in understanding and shaping our product strategy, creatively strategizing how best to get new and existing product into customer hands, and overseeing the launch of these features. Under the leadership of our VP, Product, you’ll be at the center of driving how we launch key products into the market.

**What you’ll do:**

* Understand the market: Stay on top of the competitive landscape, and conduct focussed research to help inform product strategy alongside your own GTM strategies.
* Launch products! Work directly with PMs on product teams to understand the upcoming product roadmap and own the launch for two of our most impactful product areas. Work across Marketing, CS, Sales, RND, Support, and partnership teams to make sure we hit the KPIs you set for our launches.
* Own GTM strategy: Think long term and strategically about how we best reach our customers where they are. You’ll own positioning, messaging, content strategy, segmentation, and performance tracking for your product areas.
* Work cross-functionally: Work directly with leaders on multiple teams, including executives, to make sure the right things get done to successfully bring our products to market.
* Enable customer-facing teams: Build enablement materials and supporting artifacts to help our Sales and CS teams hit their goals.
* Be part of a tightly knit, dynamic startup team! Our culture is the sum of all the folks on the team, and you’ll be a big part!

**What you bring to the table:**

* 5-7 years in B2B product marketing (ideally at a SaaS startup)
* Provide track record of owning go-to-market strategy forB2B product launches
* Storytelling skills that enable you to translate complicated or technical product details into digestible and compelling narratives
* Passion for product marketing, with a strong understanding of product marketing tactics and communication strategies
* The desire and ability to thrive in a fast paced environment with competing priorities; comfort prioritizing and making calls across multiple stakeholders and project goals
* Ownership and growth mindset that helps you seek out new opportunities while knowing when to invest deeply and when to move fast.
* Proficiency with (or curiosity about) using AI in your day to day work to move faster and more strategically

*We understand that we all bring different strengths to the table. If you meet some but not all of our requirements or think you bring something else unique to the table please don’t hesitate to apply. We’d love to hear from you even if you’re not an exact match to our list.*

**Bonus Experience**

It would be an asset (but is not a requirement) if you also have:

* Experience working on more technical integrations products or ads product
* First-hand experience working in the event space or running paid ads campaigns yourself
* Familiarity with the Music or Live Events industry

**How you work**

* You have excellent communication skills with the ability to influence and work with executives and team leaders across our organization
* You balance craft with scrappiness. You know when to deep dive and when to to ship it.
* You define success with data , and follow up to make sure we’re having the impact you want us to have.
* You thrive in ambiguity and create clarity for those around you.
* You’re hungry to understand our product as more than just the features as built. You work with teams across Hive to make sure features not only make it into customer hands, but have the impact we want them to have!

**Compensation & Benefits Package**

* Meaningful salary + equity: you’re rewarded based on impact
* Work fully remotely in Canada or the US where you are most productive whether that be from your house, or elsewhere. We just ask that you have the legal work authorization in the country that you reside and work within.
* Flexible work hours: customize your schedule as long as it’s not disruptive to your role, team, and Hive
* Health + Insurance: Comprehensive health and dental coverage with a generous parental leave top-up program
* Unlimited vacation/PTO policy: so you can be happy and healthy!

**About** **Hive.co**

Hive.co is the premier marketing platform for event marketers, revolutionizing the industry with its innovative and seamless integration with various ticketing platforms. This integration puts customer data directly at the fingertips of marketers, enabling them to build data-driven customer journeys.

We integrate with tech partners like Eventbrite and Shopify to let brands act on all their data, so they can easily segment their list in thousands of ways, and send more customized, timely email campaigns that land in inboxes. We pride ourselves on helping brands understand their email and SMS marketing, all while selling more and keeping their customers engaged.

We started our company inside a University of Waterloo computer lab in early 2014, graduated from Y Combinator that summer (S14 batch) and have been growing ever since. We strive to provide an online work environment that allows team members to have a strong work life balance while still feeling connected to their team and Hive’s mission.

To learn more about our team check out our About Us page on our website: https://www.hive.co/company

title: Sales Trainer
description:
**Role Summary:**
=================

At Fundera, a NerdWallet company, we’re more than just a financial resource—we’re the go-to growth partner for small businesses ready to scale big. Our mission? To empower entrepreneurs with the tools, guidance, and tailored financial solutions they need to turn bold ideas into thriving businesses.

By blending proprietary technology with deep financial expertise, we deliver customized recommendations that drive smarter decisions, create more jobs, and strengthen the economy from the ground up.

We’re on the hunt for a dynamic Sales Trainer to join our Sales Training & Enablement team! If you’re passionate about challenger-based and consultative selling, and you thrive in a fast-paced, high-impact environment, this is your chance to make a real difference. You’ll shape and deliver high-impact training programs that sharpen our sales team's skills, boost performance across the funnel, and fuel growth at every level.

**Where you can make an impact:**
=================================

* Design and deliver onboarding, ongoing, and advanced sales training programs aligned with our sales methodology (challenger-based/consultative hybrid).
* Coach and support sales reps in real-time, using call reviews, role-plays, and feedback loops to drive performance.
* Collaborate with Sales Leadership, Marketing, and Product to align training initiatives with business goals and go-to-market strategies.
* Create training content and enablement assets, including playbooks, decks, scripts, and video modules.
* Analyze performance data to identify training needs and measure program effectiveness.
* Facilitate in-person and virtual training sessions for both new hires and tenured reps.
* Champion a culture of continuous learning and sales excellence.

**Your experience:**
====================

* 3+ years of experience in B2B sales training in a fast paced environment with strict deadlines and sales quotas.
* Deep familiarity with challenger sales, transactional selling, and consultative approaches.
* Proven ability to influence and coach sales professionals across various experience levels.
* Strong communication, facilitation, and instructional design skills.
* Experience with LMS platforms, sales enablement tools (e.g., Gong, Highspot, Salesforce), and digital content creation.
* Results-oriented mindset with the ability to track and drive measurable improvements in sales behavior and outcomes.

**Preferred:**
==============

* Experience selling or training in small business financial solutions or alternative lending.
* Coaching certifications or formal sales methodology training (e.g., Challenger, SPIN, Sandler, etc.).

**What we offer:**
==================

**Work Hard, Stay Balanced (Life’s a series of balancing acts, eh?)**

* Industry-leading medical, dental, and vision health care plans for employees and their dependents
* Rejuvenation Policy – Vacation Time Off + 11 holidays + 4 Mental Health Days Off
* New Parent Leave for employees with a newborn child or a child placed with them for adoption or foster care
* Mental health support
* Paid sabbatical for Nerds to recharge, gain knowledge and pursue their interests
* Health and Dependent Care FSA and HSA Plan with monthly NerdWallet contribution
* Monthly Wellness Stipend, Cell Phone Stipend, and Commuting stipend

**Have Some Fun! (Nerds are fun, too)**

* Nerd-led group initiatives – Employee Resource Groups for Parents, Diversity, and Inclusion, Women, LGBTQIA, and other communities
* Hackathons and team events across all teams and departments
* Company-wide events like NerdLove (employee appreciation) and our annual Charity Auction
* Our Nerds love to make an impact by paying it forward – Take 8 hours of volunteer time off per quarter and donate to your favorite causes with a company match

**Plan for your future (And when you retire on your island, remember the little people)**

* 401K with company match
* Be the first to test and benefit from our new financial products and tools
* Financial wellness, guidance, and unlimited access to a Certified Financial Planner (CFP) through Northstar
* Disability and Life Insurance with employer-paid premiums

If you are based in California, we encourage you to read this important information for California residents linked here.

NerdWallet is committed to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment on the basis of any characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law, so all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

NerdWallet participates in the Department of Homeland Security U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services E-Verify program for all US locations. For more information, please see:

* E-Verify Participation Poster (English+Spanish/Español)
* Right to Work Poster (English) / (Spanish/Español)

#LI-Onsite

Compensation Range: $96K - $132K
company_description: NerdWallet is on a mission to provide clarity for all of life’s financial decisions.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Product Marketing Manager**

**About DriveCentric**

DriveCentric is the fastest-growing CRM and AI engagement platform in automotive. We’re built for dealers who want to move faster, sell smarter, and connect better with their customers. With over 2,200 dealerships on our platform and 5x growth since 2020, we’re not just keeping up with the industry – we’re redefining it.  
  
As the first Augmented Intelligence CRM in automotive, we pair intuitive design with smart automation to make complex processes feel easy. And because we’re certified by major OEMs and integrate with every major DMS, we fit seamlessly into the way dealerships work. No clunky bolt-ons, just results.  
  
We’re a team that moves fast, solves real problems, and believes better software drives better results.  
  
**Role Overview**  
We’re looking for a Product Marketing Manager who knows how to turn features into firepower for the sales team. You’ll help lead the charge on go-to-market strategy, competitive positioning, and enablement tools that help us win against the big names in automotive CRM.  
  
This is a role built for a sharp, driven marketer with 4–6 years of experience who loves diving into the “why it matters” behind every product release. You’ll work across Product, Sales, and Marketing to dig into the market, sharpen our value prop, and craft messaging that actually resonates with GMs, dealer principals, and sales managers.  
  
You’ll own everything from launch plans and persona insights to battlecards, pitch decks, and one-pagers—giving our sales team the tools they need to stand out and close strong. If you’ve got a knack for storytelling, a love for competition, and the drive to help dealers succeed, you’ll fit right in.  
  
**What You’ll Own**

Market & Customer Insights

* Keep a pulse on the market—track trends, size up competitors, and build battlecards that help our sales team win more deals.
* Dig into dealer roles and behaviors to sharpen our messaging and zero in on what each audience cares about.
* Capture feedback from the field and turn it into actionable insights that shape how we position and talk about our products.

Go-to-Market Strategy & Launches

* Help lead go-to-market plans for new features and product updates—from positioning and messaging to rollout timelines and success metrics.
* Partner with Product to translate roadmap updates into clear, compelling value for dealers.
* Rally the team for every launch—coordinating sales training, customer communications, and campaign support that drives feature adoption.

Sales Enablement

* Build and maintain high-impact tools like pitch decks, one-pagers, and objection-handling guides that make it easy for reps to tell the DriveCentric story.
* Equip the sales team with the messaging, training, and insights they need to confidently address customer questions and close more deals.
* Keep enablement materials fresh and field-tested—updating content as products evolve and feedback rolls in.

Content & Campaign Support

* Bring the product story to life across content formats—webinars, blog posts, case studies, and more.
* Align closely with the marketing team to ensure product messaging is clear, consistent, and driving engagement across every channel
* Use data (from HubSpot, Salesforce, etc.) to track performance and optimize what’s working—so we’re always leveling up.

**What We’re Looking For**

* 4+ years in marketing or product marketing, with a strong portfolio of messaging, positioning, and sales tools that drive results.
* Experience in the automotive space is a must—bonus if you’ve worked with or sold into dealerships, or supported automotive CRM or retail tech.
* Sharp eye for competition—able to break down what others are doing and clearly define why we’re better.
* You know how to turn features into dealer-friendly benefits, making complex ideas easy to understand and sell.
* Strong communicator—whether you’re writing a one-pager, leading a sales training, or presenting to leadership.
* Hands-on with tools like Salesforce and HubSpot, and comfortable using data to guide messaging and strategy.
* Organized, deadline-driven, and experienced juggling multiple projects across teams without missing a beat.
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Communications, or equivalent experience—we care more about what you’ve done than just what’s on paper.

**What It’s Like to Work Here**  
At DriveCentric, we move fast, think big, and put dealers first. Our culture is built on four core values: Exceptional, Visionary, Effortless, and Rewarding. Which means we aim high, keep things simple, and make sure our customers (and teammates) always see the value.  
  
We’re a team that collaborates hard, laughs often, and brings new ideas to life daily. Everyone here has a voice, and we celebrate initiative, creativity, and impact. If you like solving real problems, thinking a few steps ahead, and having fun while doing it, you’ll fit right in.  
  
**Perks & Benefits**

* Work Anywhere: Full-time, remote role with flexible hours.
* Competitive Pay: Salary + performance bonus potential, plus a 401(k) with company match.
* Health Coverage: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance to keep you covered.
* Time to Recharge: Generous PTO, plus paid holidays—we believe in work-life balance.
* Room to Grow: Ongoing training, mentorship, and real opportunities to level up as we grow.

**The Details**

* **Reports to:** Head of Marketing
* **Location:** St Louis, MO or Remote (Must be Mountain, Central, or East Coast)
* **Salary Range:** $130K
* **Bonus Eligible:** 10%
* **Interview Process:**
  + Screening Interview (30 Minutes)
  + Hiring Manager Interview (60 Minutes)
  + Interview Project Presentation (60 Minutes)

**Equal Opportunity**  
DriveCentric is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe diverse teams build better solutions—and we’re committed to creating a workplace where everyone feels welcome, valued, and supported. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected status.
company_addresses: 12900 Maurer Industrial Dr, St. Louis, MO 63127
company_description: DriveCentric is a fast paced, energetic company, specializing in CRM/CEM software for automotive dealerships across the United States.

title: Vice President, Client Experience and Success
description:
**Position Summary**

As an experienced and visionary **Vice President of Client Experience & Success** you will lead our post-go-live value realization efforts, ensuring client satisfaction, platform adoption, and measurable ROI across our customer base. As a strategic leader will be the voice of the customer internally, owning the experience and outcomes of our users—both buyers and frontline users—across their journey.

The VP of Client Experience and Success will play a central role in driving **platform stickiness, adoption, loyalty, and client evangelists**, while establishing frameworks for client advocacy, engagement metrics, and cross-functional feedback loops that inform product evolution and delivery excellence.

**Mission & Impact**

* Deliver Time to **Value Realization** to customers by tracking and improving ROI from platform use.
* Optimize **User, Super-user and Functional Leader Experience** post-implementation.
* Drive **Adoption, Engagement, and Platform Impact** through targeted interventions.
* Build a **Loyal Client Base** with high NPS, CSAT, and client advocacy scores.
* Serve as a champion for the **Voice of the Customer**, ensuring feedback directly influences roadmap priorities.

### **Key Responsibilities**

#### **Ownership Areas**

* **Post-Go-Live Success:**  
  Ensure user-level and department-level success, from training through optimal usage.
* **Adoption & Optimization:**  
  Deliver ongoing optimization services to help clients evolve use of the platform and derive more value.
* **Experience Management:**  
  Own and report on CSAT, NPS, and qualitative feedback; proactively reprove friction points in the client journey.
* **ROI Analysis & Benchmarking:**  
  Lead initiatives to measure and prove clinical, operational, or financial impact ongoing across the client base. Produce before (baseline)-and-after case studies to validate platform ROI.
* Create benchmarks to increase value for clients, so they can compare their value-realized/performance to their peer-groups.
* **Client Advocacy & Evangelism:**  
  Develop programs to convert satisfied clients into promoters, references, and strategic advisors.
* Co-lead creation of case-studies with marketing.

#### **Team Leadership**

* Lead a cross-functional **Client Success Team** including:  
  **Client Success Associate(s)**(managing super-users, champions, and department leads needs and optimization of their workflows)
  + **ROI Analyst** (measuring platform usage and outcomes)
  + **Training & Enablement** (equipping clients for success at every stage)
* Build and manage the **Voice of the Customer Program**, including NPS feedback loops, client councils, and user communities.
* Collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Sales to share insights, customer needs, and usage patterns.
* Travel intensive role, with a priority on optimized engagement and alignment of the client operational team and the product end-users.

**Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)**

* **Same-Store Growth** – % increase in users per contracted client (by site or specialty).
* **User Activation Rate** – % of active users vs. available or contracted.
* **User Churn Rate** – rate of disengagement or abandonment.
* **Time to Value/ROI** – measured time from go-live to observable impact.
* **Client Impact Metrics** – clinical or operational benchmarks achieved.
* **NPS / CSAT Scores** – client sentiment over time.
* **Product Feedback Contributions** – quantity and quality of client-driven feature requests and roadmap alignment.

### **Qualifications**

**Required:**

* 10+ years in client success, customer experience, or account management in a B2B SaaS or healthcare IT environments
* 5+ years in a senior leadership or executive role managing client-facing post-sale teams.
* Proven track record improving client retention, NPS/CSAT, and and value realization
* Experience with analytics tools to measure user engagement and business outcomes (e.g., Gainsight, Tableau, Salesforce, Mixpanel).
* Deep familiarity with enterprise workflows in healthcare, life sciences, or regulated industries.
* Exceptional communication skills and executive presence for internal and external stakeholder alignment.
* Project management experience preferred
* Excellent organizational skills
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
* Eligible to work in the U.S. without relying solely on a student visa or a visa sponsored by a third-party employer

**Preferred:**

* Experience with Voice of the Customer programs and client reference initiatives.
* Background in clinical or operational workflow optimization a plus.
* Bachelor’s degree required; MBA or advanced degree preferred.

**Core Competencies:**

* Flexible, Detail Oriented, Customer Focus, Team Working, Initiative, Problem Solving, Organized, Self-Motivated

**General:**

* Adopt the Onpoint culture of respect, integrity, and accountability that contributes to an internal environment of teamwork and promotes a positive brand image to our external customers
* Incorporate a leadership mindset to your role
* Comply with OnPoint procedures, policies, and regulations relevant to your role
* Successfully complete all Onpoint training requirements (i.e., HIPAA, compliance, etc.)
* Responsible for compliance with all regulatory requirements and/or guidelines. These requirements/guidelines include, but are not limited to: HIPAA, Federal Fraud and Abuse laws
* Able to communicate effectively with others, both verbally and in writing
* Proven ability to manage time, meet deadlines, and prioritize
* Able to maintain standards and professionalism during periods of fluctuating workloads
* Provide professional service to direct customers and vendors/delivery partners of Onpoint in all interactions
* Build effective working relationships with other team members

* Excellent customer service skills
* Able to work independently and as part of a team
* Can handle multiple tasks and prioritize work effectively

**Physical Demands:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to perform the essential functions of this job successfully.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to speak, hear, read, and type. The employee must be able to travel by airplane and vehicle to meet with internal and external customers.

This is largely a sedentary role; however, some shipping may be required. This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies up to 40 pounds.

**Work Environment:**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time, with or without notice.

title: AI Transformation Director
description:
**About Apptegy**

Apptegy partners with school districts to simplify communication, elevate their brand, and empower every role in their organization. We put our clients front and center in everything we do because it's our clients who are most passionate about education. We build our products and features to make everyone in a school community better communicators. Ask any of our clients about us, and they will tell you that Apptegy’s people are thoughtful and high-performing. Our fast response time and quality support mean school leaders, teachers, and staff always have a partner ready to help provide a solution. Joining Apptegy is your opportunity to be on a high-performing team and contribute to our growth and your own.

Our growth and client success are attributed to the caliber of our team. We offer the tools, mentorship, and resources needed for success within our expanding organization. We seek individuals who are internally motivated to excel and who value collaboration. The AI Transformation Director position is an opportunity to join our team and contribute to both company and personal development.

**Why You’ll Love This Job**

As the AI Transformation Director, you will play a critical role in defining, driving and scaling the internal AI strategy across our go-to-market and operations teams. You will lead cross-functional efforts to identify high-impact use cases, deliver solutions to streamline internal workflows and enhance customer outcomes, and drive measurable efficiency and effectiveness gains.

This is a high-visibility role at the intersection of strategy, technology, and operations, and is ideal for someone who thrives in fast-paced, cross-functional environments and has a passion for AI-driven transformation.

  

### **What You’ll Do**

* Develop and maintain a comprehensive internal AI transformation roadmap aligned to address operational challenges and opportunities
* Collaborate with Data Analytics, Engineering and third-party vendors to design and implement AI solutions, ensuring seamless integrations into existing workflows and systems
* Lead cross-functional teams to execute AI projects, ensuring timely delivery, measurable impacts and alignment with business objectives
* Develop playbooks, training, and enablement plans to ensure successful adoption of AI tools and processes
* Define KPIs and success metrics to track ROI (e.g., time savings, CSAT, pipeline velocity)
* Continuously evaluate emerging AI technologies and best practices to inform ongoing strategy
* Collaborate with Legal, Security, and Data teams to ensure responsible and ethical use of AI
* Drive internal education around responsible and effective use of AI

### **Who You Are**

* 5+ years experience in product management, business operations, management consulting, or transformation roles, preferably within a SaaS environment
* Proven experience leading large-scale digital or AI transformation programs with senior stakeholder engagement and board-level visibility.
* Demonstrated ability to manage cross-functional projects with measurable results
* Familiarity with AI/ML tools and frameworks, especially in GTM contexts (e.g., generative AI, predictive scoring, AI assistants)
* Working knowledge of technical concepts such as Python, SQL, and APIs
* Experience with SaaS tech stacks and tools (e.g., Salesforce, Intercom, HubSpot, Snowflake, Gong)
* Experience delivering measurable outcomes with AI or data-driven initiatives (e.g. cost savings, retention lift, time-to-resolution reduction)
* Expertise in driving cultural and organizational change, with a focus on emerging technologies and fostering readiness for AI adoption
* Comfortable navigating ambiguity and driving change in a dynamic environment

*Apptegy will not consider remote candidates from California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Illinois, Maryland, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington for this opening.*

**Why You'll Love Working With Us**

We take our responsibility as a company seriously and aim to make this the best job that you’ve had (and one that sets you up for future success). We want your day at work and your time at home to be a joyful experience, that’s why we provide:

* -Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance coverage
* -Retirement 401(k) with employer match
* -Health Savings Accounts (HSA) and Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)
* -Mental Health Reimbursement
* -Unlimited paid time off including seasonal (December) company-wide time off
* -Paid parental and medical leave

We value thoughtfulness and high performance in all candidates as we progress through the interview stages. If the challenge of building a rapidly growing company excites you as much as it does us, we hope you’ll consider joining us.

-

*Apptegy is an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, protected veteran or disabled status, or genetic information.*
company_description: Apptegy builds products that empower school leaders to run better schools. We make it easy for school leaders, administrators, and educators to change how communities think and feel about schools.

title: Sales Enablement Analyst, Global Sales Operations
description:
The Sales Enablement Analyst will partner with the sales team to maximize field sales selling time and reduce field sales administrative burden. Assist field sales reps, acting as a one stop shop to assist with any back-office coordination, and follow ups around new and existing contracts, inventory and consignment or sales order status. This role will assist with and own any issues reported by the sales team and take it to resolution on their behalf in support of sales enablement and revenue protection.

**What You’ll Work On**

* Coordinate group efforts with Customer Service, Supply Chain, Legal, IT, and Contracts & Pricing to enable field sales team to minimize administrative efforts.
* Lead the execution of inventory and order management initiatives to sales teams.
* Analyze, develop, and report on end-to-end order throughput, facilitating revenue recognition for orders held up by issues along invoice process or highlighting pending revenue for field sales team; obtain and provide order/invoice status as requested.
* Monitor and identify stagnant, expired, or obsolete inventory; signal levels of E&O inventory to management as discovered.
* Assist sales with obtaining signed consignment agreements and in the execution of consignment cleanup initiatives/changes in strategy.
* Work with Sales, Customer Service, and other teams to assist the sales team in proactively monitoring and maintaining inventory levels at customer accounts. Assist with field inventory and customer consignment cycle counts related challenges and resolving issues.
* Play critical role in navigating and troubleshooting blockades surrounding sales enablement and revenue acceleration.
* Assist in systematic change / upgrades by participating and assessing necessary improvements to drive company objectives.
* Assist, as needed, in sales analytics to facilitate revenue acceleration in support of corporate goals.
* Deliver training to increase sales report adoption among field sales, sales managers, and senior executive team.
* Understand and facilitate various promotional activities.
* Ensure sales territory alignments are accurately maintained, approved, and documented.
* Identify and implement opportunities for continued improvement of business processes and systems.
* Work with Sales Operations team members to improve global sales data reporting.
* Facilitate Sales Operations team project management.
* Align to designated work hours as identified by Sales Operations
* Adhere to the Company’s Quality Management System (QMS) as well as domestic and global quality system regulations, standards, and procedures.
* Understand relevant security, privacy and compliance principles and adhere to the regulations, standards, and procedures that are applicable to the Company.
* Ensure other members of the department follow the QMS, regulations, standards, and procedures.
* Perform other work-related duties as assigned

**What You Contribute**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance or related field with 2+ years of experience in Finance, Accounting, Business, Customer Service, Supply Chain, or analytics or an equivalent combination of education and experience
* Requires strong financial analysis skills and an ability to problem solve and make relevant recommendations
* Knowledge of SAP (or other ERP systems) preferred
* Knowledge of order management systems preferred
* Experience within the manufacturing or life sciences industries preferred
* General system savvy / ability to learn and help lead changes to new systems and apps
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs, with advanced modeling skills in Excel
* Strong oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills
* High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
* Excellent organizational skills with ability to prioritize assignments while handling various projects simultaneously

**Working Conditions**

General office environment. Business travel from 10%-15%. Requires some lifting and moving of up to 5 pounds. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk, sit, and reach with hands and arms, and to use a computer, sitting for extended periods. Specific vision abilities required by this job include ability to read, close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and depth perception.

**Annual Base Salary Range: $75,000 - $115,000**

We offer a competitive compensation package plus a benefits and equity program, when applicable. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, competencies, and work location.

**What We Offer**

* A collaborative teamwork environment where learning is constant, and performance is rewarded.
* The opportunity to be part of the team that is revolutionizing the treatment of some of the world's most devastating diseases.
* A generous benefits package for eligible employees that includes medical, dental, vision, life, AD&D, short and long-term disability insurance, 401(k) with employer match, an employee stock purchase plan, paid parental leave, eleven paid company holidays per year, a minimum of fifteen days of accrued vacation per year, which increases with tenure, and paid sick time in compliance with applicable law(s).

Penumbra, Inc., headquartered in Alameda, California, is a global healthcare company focused on innovative therapies. Penumbra designs, develops, manufactures, and markets novel products and has a broad portfolio that addresses challenging medical conditions in markets with significant unmet need. Penumbra sells its products to hospitals and healthcare providers primarily through its direct sales organization in the United States, most of Europe, Canada, and Australia, and through distributors in select international markets. The Penumbra logo is a trademark of Penumbra, Inc.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, military or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

If you reside in the State of California, please also refer to **Penumbra's Privacy Notice for California Residents.**

For additional information on Penumbra’s commitment to being an equal opportunity employer, please see **Penumbra's AAP Policy Statement.**
company_description: Penumbra is a specialty interventional therapies company that develops and markets innovative medical devices to treat challenging medical conditions with significant unmet clinical needs

title: Director, Program Marketing
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**
---------------------

The Director, Program Marketing is responsible for managing the production of Bravida Medical’s clinical marketing and training initiatives to promote customer awareness, education and engagement across product segments within each applicable market.

The position supports digital production of clinical programs and collateral, tasked with ensuring consistent, high-quality communications and marketing efforts that reflect the reputation and Bravida brand. This role is highly detail-oriented, organized, and able to lead multiple projects and manage completion on deadline. Excellent communication skills in all forms (email, text, social media, and verbal) and the ability to work independently and collaboratively within cross-functional teams (internal departments, field sales, customers, and vendors) is imperative. Primary responsibilities include branding and design for Bravida Academy and creation of all assets within the platform. This includes video production and product imagery, animations, podcasts, management of CE accreditation programming, webinar management and execution, self-study and eLearning LMS module production, other supporting collateral creation, and analytics reporting of activities for lead management and ROI review. Other responsibilities include general website development and maintenance, management of clinical study communication, KOL communication, advisory board support, budget management and support of support for tradeshows, event logistics and product marketing upon request. To be successful in this role requires hands-on experience with multiple digital tools, asset production in multiple forms, and the ability to turn creative ideas into effective clinical marketing and training projects working independently and within multiple groups.

This leadership role helps us build and maintain a strong and consistent brand through a wide range of online and offline marketing channels, tools, and content to drive customer awareness and engagement, creating customer loyalty and positioning Bravida as a thought leader in our business markets. The execution of value-add programs supports ongoing revenue generation and sustainable growth.

**Essential Functions (ACCOUNTABILITIES/RESPONSIBILITIES):**
------------------------------------------------------------

Program Marketing

* Build a deep understanding of customer experience and competitive marketing trends, execute programming to fill gaps, and generate deliverables that improve customer engagement and retention to drive growth.
* Create buy-in for utilization of value-add programs and clinical marketing vision both internally and with key external partner, vendors, and KOL customer groups.
* Translate clinical strategy into detailed technical requirements and digital deliverables to drive impact, credibility and thought leadership with customers.
* Scope and prioritize activities based on business and customer impact.
* Lead the production and execution of Bravida Academy and all related collateral and resources under this umbrella. Including videos, animations, photo imagery, podcasts, and other associated digital content.
* Lead On24 webinar event production, CE accreditation and all related programming. Manage Engagement Hub for webinar and eBook OnDemand libraries. Review and analyze data for lead generation and ROI. Work with product marketing to develop and launch nurturing campaigns pre and post events.
* Lead video and photo shoots to ensure optimal ROI and efficiency for high quality deliverables. Perform editing as needed and manage vendor workflow and product completion.
* Produce clinical marketing campaigns, program and service launches and provide support for product launches working with executives, and other marketing and sales team members for optimal execution and ROI.
* Evaluate promotional plans and content resources to ensure that they are consistent with product line clinical strategy and that the message is accurately and effectively conveyed.
* Understand and support clinical study logistics and associated clinical education tools to drive awareness.
* Represent the company by interacting with KOLs, Advisory Groups, working at tradeshows and in field visits to solicit feedback and identify opportunities for products, programs, and services.

Marketing Communications and Brand

* Develop strategies and tactics to improve awareness of Bravida by building ongoing engagement and brand loyalty through high quality, meaningful deliverables that exceed customer expectations and provide a high quality customer experience.
* Deploy successful marketing campaigns and programs with ownership of implementation from ideation to execution and analytical review.
* Utilize a variety of organic and paid acquisition channels through content creation, content curation, pay per click campaigns, event management, publicity, social media, lead generation campaigns, copywriting, conduct performance analysis to make ongoing recommendations for optimal strategy.
* Responsible for strategic social media campaign content production and execution of deliverables.
* Work with clinical and sales experts to understand customer needs and produce valuable and engaging content that helps convert and maintain utilization among our target audiences.
* Build strategic relationships and partner with key industry players, agencies and vendors that are crucial to our success.
* Lead vendor and consultant management for project timelines, execution, and deliverables. Keep costs in line and timelines on target.
* Monitor budget and support conscientious use and ongoing review to maintain spending within target.
* Oversee production and participate in approval of marketing, clinical, sales and other related materials in all formats to ensure brand and content consistency. Work within the QT9 regulatory document approval system and with the Regulatory, Quality and Compliance teams to ensure requirements are met.
* Measure and report on the performance of all clinical marketing programs and content, gain insight, assess against goals, and make recommendations to adjust plan accordingly.

Sales Enablement

* Management of website updates and general maintenance, overall production and maintenance for Bravida Academy educational content, management of webinar platform production and CE accredited activity reporting and maintenance to ensure all remain current, within regulation and useful for end-users.
* Work within collaborative databases such as: HubSpot, Marketo, Salesforce, Constant Contact, etc. Support lead generation and follow-up activities pre- and post-event with high level of sales engagement to track ROI.
* Incorporate customer evaluation measurements into all programs and events to ensure high satisfaction. Administer additional surveys and customer feedback activities to support knowledge, measure customer utilization and engagement, generate claims, and to further assess unmet needs.
* Work in collaboration with the sales team to understand customer field-based needs. Align program and product related platforms to facilitate customer awareness, successful adoption, and utilization of products. Attend team calls to promote new events, follow-up on analytics, and participate in field activities upon request.
* Assist with coordination of marketing trade shows to support optimal customer engagement, lead planning and logistics for associated educational events and initiatives (posters, abstracts, CE activities, etc.). Support plan for KOL engagement, in-booth education, CE options, customer surveys, focus groups, gaming events and creative ideas to increase traffic.
* Manage event communication, activity calendar, promotion, email templates, social media activities for sales team use to drive customer engagement.
* Assist with KOL contracting and study agreement administration activities, managing KOL events or advisory board activities, adding contracts to IntelAgree, and assisting with renewals and/or terminations.
* Support internal training resource production and deliverables such as PPT, LMS, other eLearning platforms, etc. Plan and manage calendars and determine and develop optimal online platform for new hire orientation and resource access.
* Responsible for content production to support internal newsletters and quarterly customer communications for sales and 1099 contract teams.

**Qualifications:**
-------------------

Experience

* Demonstrated success in marketing leadership with production of high-impact deliverables in multiple formats. Ability to manage, produce and maintain website platform.
* Proven experience in market assessment and segmentation by brand, identifying target audiences, in leading marketing campaigns across channels that enhance customer engagement and build brand credibility and loyalty.
* Demonstrated knowledge of website analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, NetInsight, Omniture, WebTrends).
* Experience in setting up and optimizing Google Adwords campaigns.
* Strong skillset with social media campaigns and managing content posting and analytics, experience with AI and application to the marketing function, development of videos, podcasts, and interactive content to engage audience.
* Experience with launching and operating webinar platforms and maintaining website activity and engagement (e.g., On24, Engagement Hub, ZOOM, MS Teams.). Managing registration, lead generation and post-event follow-up and nurturing campaigns.
* Experience with CE Accreditation processes, execution, reporting and requirements. Proven track record of KOL and thought leader consultant project management.
* Demonstrated ability to manage video and photo shoots, edit, and produce deliverables. Working with vendors and/or independently.
* Able to manage budget, spreadsheets and make recommendations based on optimal ROL.
* Proven ability to work independently and with teams to create original, creative, and engaging content as part of the Bravida Medical brand.
* Up to date with the latest trends and best practices in online marketing, content creation, webinar and digital collateral execution, branding and analytics for ongoing measurement and recommendations for best ROI.

Education

* Minimum of five years’ experience in healthcare marketing creative project management role. Ten years is ideal.
* Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in marketing, business, or another related field. Master’s degree is a plus.
* Project management, On24, AI, and other technology or digital platform certifications are a plus.

General Skills/Competencies/Specialized Knowledge

* Strong strategic thinking and leadership skills, with the ability to develop and communicate a clear vision and roadmap for program marketing and manage projects cross-functionally.
* Results-oriented mindset with a focus on driving business growth and achieving measurable marketing goals.
* Strong organizational and project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* Knowledge of healthcare market dynamics, trends, and competitive landscape.
* Detail-oriented mindset, with a commitment to accuracy and compliance in contract administration.
* Ability to adapt to a dynamic and fast-paced environment, demonstrating flexibility and resilience.
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team. Ability to lead teams and to manage personnel upon request.

**TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS/WORK ENVIRONMENT and PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**
--------------------------------------------------------------

Travel

* Travel is approximately 25% of the time and may include the following activities:
* Production events for videos, photo shoots, etc.
* Tradeshows for booth set-up/tear-down, staffing exhibit hours for customer interaction, managing KOL events or advisory board activities.
* Company meetings to include leadership, national sales meetings, and/or department events.
* Hospital or similar patient care settings to support product demonstration and training.
* Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed to meet customer requirements.

Work Environment and Physical Demands

* Similar to office environment.

title: Head of Commercial Learning & Development, North America (NAM)
description:
Join us in pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everyw Sustainably.
  
  
Our inspiring and caring environment forms a global community that celebrates diversity and individuality. We encourage you to step beyond your comfort zone, offering resources and flexibility to foster your professional and personal growth, all while valuing your unique contributions.

The Head of Learning & Development, North America (NAM) is an integral part of the global Commercial L&D organization, reporting to the Global Head of Commercial Learning & Development. While globally connected, this role is accountable for supporting the NAM region’s strategic objectives by designing and delivering a tailored learning curriculum.
  
  
This includes leading the transformation of our sales training process—shifting toward a scalable, value-based selling methodology that aligns with our customer-centric strategy and drives measurable commercial outcomes. This role ensures that global frameworks are adapted to meet regional needs, enabling consistency in capability building while addressing local market dynamics.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Strategy & Design**

* Expertise in adult learning principles, instructional design, and modern learning technologies. Ability to source, evaluate, and implement scalable methodologies—especially for sales training and execution.
* Develop and own the NAM L&D strategy for the commercial organization, aligned with business goals and performance outcomes.
* Define competency frameworks and career pathways for all commercial roles, including Account Executives, KAM, Sales Managers, Product Specialists, and others.
* Ensure scalability of programs across diverse markets while allowing for regional customization.
* Partner with commercial leaders to define competencies and behaviors critical to success in customer-facing roles.

**Execution & Delivery**

* Lead the design and implementation of onboarding, skills-based training, leadership development, and functional academies.
* Establish and manage an NAM L&D calendar, incorporating product launches, strategic priorities, and market needs.
* Drive consistent adoption of learning technologies (e.g., LMS, virtual learning platforms, digital coaching tools).
* Lead a team of learning professionals and collaborate with external vendors as needed.
* Oversee the development of training content, including role-plays, manager toolkits, and reinforcement mechanisms and keeping with current industry trends.

**Performance & Impact**

* Define KPIs and performance metrics to assess program effectiveness and learning ROI (e.g., time-to-productivity, quota attainment uplift, competency mastery).
* Continuously evolve content and formats based on data, feedback, and commercial priorities. Promote a learning culture embedded in the business with measurable impact on execution and commercial success.
* Ensure integration of learning programs into broader talent development and performance management systems.

**Qualifications:**

* 10+ years of experience in Learning & Development, with at least 5 years in a commercial leadership role.
* Proven success in designing and implementing sales training programs, ideally in a global or matrixed organization.
* Proven success in leading global training initiatives across geographies and cultures.
* Deep understanding of adult learning principles, instructional design, and sales enablement.
* Experience with methodologies such as SPIN Selling, Challenger, or Miller Heiman is a plus.
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
* Ability to lead cross-functional initiatives and influence at all levels of the organization.
* Bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, Strategy, or related field. MBA preferred.
* Familiarity with CRM tools and their role in sales enablement.
* Understanding of go-to-market models and commercial excellence frameworks.

**Success Metrics:**

* A fully operational commercial academy with clear tracks per role and career stage within 6-12 months.
* Tangible improvement in onboarding time, field productivity, and leadership pipeline.
* Improvement in commercial performance metrics (e.g., win rates, deal velocity, customer satisfaction).
* Increased manager engagement in coaching and reinforcement activities.
* Positive feedback from sales teams on training relevance and effectiveness.
Integration of learning outcomes into performance reviews and talent assessments  

**Key Competencies:**

* **Strategic Thinking & Commercial Acumen:** Ability to align learning strategies with business goals, particularly in commercial and customer-facing areas. Understands the impact of learning on revenue generation, sales enablement, and market competitiveness.
* **Global Leadership & Influence:** Proven experience leading global teams and initiatives across regions and cultures. Skilled in influencing senior stakeholders and driving alignment across matrixed organizations.
* **Learning Innovation & Methodology Design:** Expertise in adult learning principles, instructional design, and modern learning technologies. Ability to source, evaluate, and implement scalable methodologies—especially for sales training and execution.
* **Data-Driven Decision Making:** Uses learning analytics and performance metrics to assess impact and continuously improve programs. Familiarity with tools like Workday and other HRIS platforms for tracking development outcomes.
* **Change Leadership & Transformation:** Leads through ambiguity and drives cultural change through learning. Champions continuous learning as a lever for transformation and agility.
* **Talent Development & Succession Planning:** Deep understanding of potential assessment frameworks (e.g., aspiration, ability, engagement). Builds leadership pipelines and supports high-potential talent development.
* **Collaboration & Cross-Functional Partnership** : Works closely with HRBPs, business leaders, and external vendors to co-create impactful learning experiences. Facilitates knowledge sharing and peer learning across functions and geographies.

**Key Interfaces**

**Internal Stakeholders**

* Global Commercial Operations: Strategy alignment, performance data, execution planning.
* Zone and Country Commercial Leaders: Local adaptation, rollout support, talent feedback.

* Business Lines & Product Management: Product training content, value proposition alignment.
* HR / Talent Development: Career architecture, leadership development integration.
* Marketing & Enablement Teams: Campaign integration, tools utilization.

**External Stakeholders**

* Training vendors and consultants.
* Learning technology providers.
Industry benchmarking partners (as needed).  

**Who we are** : We are a team of more than 73,000 highly dedicated Healthineers in more than 70 countries. As a leader in medical technology, we constantly push the boundaries to create better outcomes and experiences for patients, no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

**How we work:** When you join Siemens Healthineers, you become one in a global team of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists, who believe in each individual’s potential to contribute with diverse ideas. We are from different backgrounds, cultures, religions, political and/or sexual orientations, and work together, to fight the world’s most threatening diseases and enable access to care, united by one purpose: to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everyw Sustainably.

To find out more about Siemens Healthineers businesses, please visit our company page here .

The annual base pay for this position is:

Min $184,500 - Max $276,700

Factors which may affect starting pay within this range may include geography/market, skills, education, experience, and other qualifications of the successful candidate.

If this is a commission eligible position the commission eligibility will be in accordance with the terms of the Company's plan. Commissions are based on individual performance and/or company performance.

The Company offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements: medical insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401(k) retirement plan. life insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance, paid parking/public transportation, paid time off, paid sick and safe time.

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement:** Siemens Healthineers is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.

**EEO is the Law:** Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination.

**Reasonable Accommodations:** Siemens Healthineers is committed to equal employment opportunity. As part of this commitment, we will ensure that persons with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations.

If you require a reasonable accommodation in completing a job application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, please fill out the accommodations form here . If you’re unable to complete the form, you can reach out to our HR People Connect People Contact Center for support at peopleconnectvendorsnam.func@siemens-healthineers.com. Please note HR People Connect People Contact Center will not have visibility of your application or interview status.

**California Privacy Notice:** California residents have the right to receive additional notices about their personal information.

**Export Control:** “A successful candidate must be able to work with controlled technology in accordance with US export control law.” “It is Siemens Healthineers’ policy to comply fully and completely with all United States export control laws and regulations, including those implemented by the Department of Commerce through the Export Administration Regulations (EAR), by the Department of State through the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), and by the Treasury Department through the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC) sanctions regulations.”

**Data Privacy:** We care about your data privacy (https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/careers/recruitment-application-privacy-notice) and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open.

**Beware of Job Scams:** Please beware of potentially fraudulent job postings or suspicious recruiting activity by persons that are currently posing as Siemens Healthineers recruiters/employees. These scammers may attempt to collect your confidential personal or financial information. If you are concerned that an offer of employment with Siemens Healthineers might be a scam or that the recruiter is not legitimate, please verify by searching for the posting on the Siemens Healthineers career site.

**To all recruitment agencies:** Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, employees, or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Director, Commercial Legal Affairs
description:
**About Us**

At **Crescendo**, we’re transforming customer experience with Augmented AI—a seamless blend of human expertise and AI automation that delivers better, faster, more scalable support. We’re not just changing how support works. We’re reshaping the economics of an entire industry.

**The Role**

We are seeking a **Director of Commercial Legal Affairs** to join Crescendo’s commercial legal function and support our continued global expansion. In this role, you will join the commercial legal strategy across North America, Europe, and other key jurisdictions, partnering with executive stakeholders to scale our AI-powered services model while navigating complex regulatory, privacy, and data governance landscapes.

You will serve as a critical partner to GTM, InfoSec, Product, and executive leadership—ensuring enterprise deal velocity, contract compliance, and AI-aligned legal innovation. This is an ideal opportunity for a strategic, execution-oriented legal leader who brings deep cross-border contracting expertise, a strong understanding of AI/data frameworks, and a passion for driving impact at the forefront of tech and customer experience.

**What You’ll Do:**

* Strategic Leadership & Business Enablement
  + Responsible for the global commercial legal function, aligning legal strategy with business objectives to support revenue growth and customer success in regulated and high-growth markets.
  + Serve as a senior legal advisor to Sales, Customer Success, and Executive teams on commercial transactions, partnerships, and go-to-market initiatives.
* Enterprise Contracting & Negotiation
  + Oversee the negotiation and execution of complex enterprise agreements including MSAs, SaaS agreements, AI/ML, services contracts, and DPAs across global regions.
  + Resolve escalations and drive creative solutions that balance business needs with regulatory requirements.
* AI, Data, and Privacy Governance
  + Provide strategic counsel on legal issues related to AI/ML deployment, data usage rights, model outputs, and emerging AI regulations.
  + Partner with InfoSec and Compliance to ensure contracts reflect security standards (ISO, SOC 2) and privacy laws (GDPR, CCPA/CPRA, Schrems II, etc.).
* Commercial Infrastructure & Operational Scale
  + Develop global legal infrastructure including contract templates, negotiation playbooks, escalation protocols, and enablement for internal stakeholders.
  + Implement scalable processes and systems that streamline legal review while mitigating risk.
* Global Expansion Support
  + Structure and advise on international partnerships, distribution models, reseller agreements, and cross-border data transfers to support Crescendo’s global footprint (LATAM, APAC, EU, U.S.).
  + Stay ahead of evolving digital service laws and AI regulations globally, proactively advising leadership on implications and strategies.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration and Training
  + Act as a key strategic partner to Product, Engineering, Marketing, and People teams—translating legal complexity into business clarity.
  + Champion legal excellence while supporting Crescendo’s culture of innovation, velocity, and customer obsession.
  + Providing training and guidance to internal teams on privacy, AI governance, and data protection best practices

**What We Expect From You:**

Legal Experience & Domain Expertise

* 10+ years of legal experience, with at least 8 years of legal experience focused on commercial contracting, privacy and global legal operations within tech or AI-driven companies (1+ years of AI governance is a plus).
* Deep knowledge of U.S. and EU commercial and privacy law and AI Laws (EU AI Act, emerging US AI regulations,etc)
* Extensive experience negotiating enterprise SaaS, privacy and AI-related contractual agreements.

Collaboration & Cross-Functional Leadership:

* Effective at working across departments, including product, engineering, finance and compliance, to embed legal best practices seamlessly.
* Comfortable operating in a fast-moving environment, adjusting strategies in real-time while maintaining legal integrity.

**What You’ll Get In Return:**

* Remote working arrangements
* Competitive Base Salary
* Generous paid vacation
* Attractive benefits package including medical, dental, and vision options that are applicable per country of residence for all our full-time employees
* Training opportunities provided by Crescendo and outside entities
* 1-on-1 coaching with feedback sessions, mentorship, and opportunities for cross-functional development

**Why Crescendo?**

* We’re creating a new category: Augmented AI.
* Our growth has been explosive—0 to $100M+ in ARR in under a year—and we’re just getting started.
* Our model is built on outcomes, not buzzwords. That means we only win when our customers do.
* You’ll join a high-performing, customer-obsessed team that values speed, creativity, and craft.
* We’re remote-first, people-first, and purpose-driven.

**Join us and help shape the future of customer experience.**

**Company Culture Is At Our Core**

Our core values bring intention to our work and set the tone for our culture. From the partners we serve to the associates who work with us, we share a set of core values that guide our actions.

* Care for others - Cooperate, empathize, and seek opportunities to put each other first.
* Embrace growth - Expand your mind by taking calculated risks, developing your skills, and staying open to change
* Manifest trust - Trust is the bond that allows us to work at our highest levels, as members of a team, in a unified direction. It is continuously earned by delivering on our commitments.
* Take ownership - Doing the right thing should come naturally.
* Be humble - Seek guidance, receive feedback, ask questions, and listen to your colleagues

Crescendo is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We value diversity, inclusion, equity, and belonging and these pillars are at the heart of how we work together. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements.

We are committed to the inclusion of all individuals and will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application process. If you require assistance or accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please contact careers@crescendo.ai.
