title: MTConnect Developer Relations Manager
description:
Description:

Software built on the MTConnect standard is deployed on tens of thousands of devices in factories all over the world. Now, the standard is evolving from serving monitoring and status reporting applications to **digital twins, flexible automation, and AI-driven factories**. 2025-26 is our breakout window, and we need a community champion who can translate the spec into code, content, and vibrant conversation.

**Why You’ll Love This Role**

* **Real impact:** You’ll shape the standard that powers tomorrow’s smart factories—alongside industry-leading companies.
* **Front-row seat:** This role is embedded in the industry. You’ll work directly with tech companies and end users. Within AMT, you will work cross-functionally with AMT’s growth, research, and standards teams.
* **Green-field DevRel:** Build community programming, tooling, and events from the ground up; your roadmap is the roadmap.
* **Breadth + depth:** Split time among community building, standards stewardship, and hands-on demos—ideal for multi-talented technologists.

**What You'll Do**

* **Standards Stewardship** – Attend SC and Working Group meetings; shepherd spec updates.
* **Community Growth & Advocacy** – Plan content calendar, meet-ups, and targeted outreach to open-source software & industrial internet of things communities.
* **Technical Storytelling** – Write blog posts, create short demo videos, and maintain the sample code.
* **Event Leadership** – Own MTConnect presence at conferences, workshops, and hackathons; budget and vendor wrangling included.
* **Partnership Enablement** – Serve as technical liaison when marquee partners add MTConnect to their stacks.

Requirements:

* **Manufacturing-tech savvy** plus hands-on coding or automation experience (APIs, OPC UA, MQTT, Unified Namespace, etc.).
* **Standards know-how** – ideally MTConnect; open to MODBUS/SEMI/OPC or open-source veterans ready to pivot.
* **Community chops** – you’ve run meetups, Discords, or open-source software roadmaps that drove adoption.
* **Top-tier communication** – from conference stages to GitHub PR reviews.

**Bonus Points:**

* Prior standards development or open-source project work.
* Familiarity with data modeling for digital twins or USD.
* Experience choosing community-ops tooling (Discourse, Common Room, Orbit…).

**Highlighted Benefits**

Full-time AMT employees are eligible to receive the following benefits:

* Medical | Dental | Vision coverage – 100% of premiums covered for employees and eligible dependents.
* Paid Time Off (PTO) – up to 5 weeks if start date is before July 1. After July 1, receive 2.5 weeks.
* Paid Winter Break and select holidays.
* 401k Plan (100% company match up to 6%, no vesting period).
* Free drinks/snacks/lunch catered monthly and so much more….

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

AMT is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, religion, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic disposition, or any other reason protected by law.

title: Senior Marketing Manager, Product Marketing
description:
Springer Publishing is seeking a strategic and results-driven Senior Manager to lead our Product Marketing and Integrated Campaign initiatives across our Academic and Healthcare Institutional businesses. This role will oversee B2B marketing and be a central part of the success of our digital courseware and learning solutions used across higher education and healthcare institutions. You’ll develop and execute go-to-market strategies and multi-channel campaigns that build awareness, drive adoption, accelerate lead generation, and nurture closed won sales conversions across a range of B2B and institutional customer segments in nursing, behavioral and health sciences, and medicine.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Product Marketing Leadership**

* Own the marketing strategy and execution for Springer Publishing’s academic and institutional products, including digital learning platforms, curriculum-based solutions, online databases, and core reference content.
* Oversee messaging, value proposition development, customer segmentation, and competitive insights for products serving both higher education and healthcare organizations.
* Lead the product-focused marketers and freelancers, supporting go-to-market efforts across disciplines.
* Partner closely with Sales, Content, and Digital Solutions teams to ensure launch and promotional plans align with business goals.

**Integrated Campaign Strategy & Execution**

* Build and execute full-funnel, omnichannel marketing campaigns—from brand awareness through lead generation and nurturing to conversion.
* Manage campaign calendars and product launch timelines across multiple internal teams and touchpoints.
* Plan, develop, and manage content marketing asset creation with special emphasis on the digital and short-form video content needed to actively acquire new quality leads across all marketing channels.
* Collaborate with Sales, Events, and Digital/Performance Marketing to support pipeline growth and account engagement.
* Ensure consistency in messaging, voice, and positioning across all customer-facing channels.

**Email & Marketing Automation**

* Oversee email marketing strategy and deployment of the multi-touch, nurture campaigns through HubSpot, driving qualified leads and supporting sales enablement efforts.
* Develop workflows and communications aligned to audience segments, buyer journeys, and campaign goals.
* Collaborate with Sales to build and optimize all lead generation efforts and to constantly improve lead quality.

**Measurement & Optimization**

* Analyze campaign performance across top-, mid-, and bottom-funnel KPIs.
* Leverage insights to refine targeting, messaging, and channel strategy for greater ROI and lead quality.
* Track and record program results and create reports for internal stakeholders, analyzing metrics and identifying areas of opportunity.

**Qualifications**

* 8–12 years of marketing experience with a focus on product marketing, B2B marketing, or integrated campaigns—preferably within Academic, EdTech, or healthcare education.
* Proven success leading go-to-market plans for institutional or curriculum-based products.
* Demonstrated ability to manage and mentor a marketing team.
* Email marketing expertise, including hands-on usage of a marketing automation platform, Hubspot.
* Understanding of the buying process and buyer personas for higher education and healthcare markets
* Strong collaboration skills and experience working cross-functionally with Sales, Product, and Editorial teams.
* Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms like HubSpot.
* Excellent project management and communication skills.
* Exhibit strong leadership skills, solve problems creatively, and display a high level of self-motivation with a sense of urgency.
* Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field.

**Preferred Skills**

* Experience with the academic sales cycle, institutional adoption processes, or healthcare workforce education.
* Familiarity with email marketing automation, SEO, digital advertising, and content strategy.
* Strong analytical mindset with comfort using campaign performance data to inform decision-making.

**Work Style**

This position is based out of Springer Publishing Company’s Princeton, NJ office and is not a remote-only opportunity. While Springer supports a hybrid work culture—allowing for a combination of remote and in-office work, ongoing on-site work in Princeton, both on a scheduled and as-needed basis, is a key requirement.

**About Springer Publishing**

At Springer Publishing we are dedicated to turning ideas into knowledge, connecting education to careers, and empowering the people who care for the world. We bring the ideas and innovation that help healthcare educators, learners, and professionals move confidently between education and employment to achieve their goals.

Named one of the fastest growing independent publishers in the United States by Publishers Weekly, we continue to grow our product portfolio in nursing, public health, healthcare administration, social work, counseling and medicine.

Join us and grow your career at Springer Publishing!

**What We Offer**

At Springer Publishing employee health, safety, and well-being is a key focus. We provide competitive compensation and benefits along with the opportunity for learning, career development, and a work-life balance. Our management team, even pre-pandemic, has always worked with individual needs to allow for flexibility in schedule and location whenever possible with the business needs.

Some of our offerings include:

* Medical, dental & vision
* Disability & life insurance
* 401k company contribution with immediate vesting
* Pre-tax savings
* Generous time off including holidays and PTO
* Work-life balance including a 35-hour work week & flexibility with remote or hybrid office arrangements
* Tuition reimbursement
* Wellness & discount programs

title: Technical Enablement Program Manager New
description:
**About Parsec**

Parsec Automation Corp. (Parsec) is a trailblazing creator and provider of manufacturing operations management software. Consistently recognized by organizations like Gartner and IDC and a winner of numerous awards, including the Data Breakthrough Awards, American Business, and Best in Biz, Parsec exemplifies leadership in the dynamic, fast-paced manufacturing sector. With major companies such as Johnson & Johnson, Merck, Toyota, Proctor & Gamble, Eli Lilly, Hershey, Siemens, and DuPont leveraging its innovative TrakSYS™ platform to tackle even the most complex manufacturing challenges, Parsec’s solutions are actively optimizing efficiency, quality, and compliance at over 11,000 plants in more than 140 countries. Committed to customer success and driven by innovation, Parsec continues to fulfill its mission of making the management of manufacturing operations as simple as possible.

Parsec is backed by BVP Forge, a $780M fund in partnership with the $20B Bessemer platform that has backed industry-defining businesses such as LinkedIn, MindBody, Procore, Shopify, and Toast. BVP Forge combines Bessemer’s front-line industry insights, proven growth IP, and robust executive network with tailored resources for self-sustaining companies and the ForgeEdge™ operational program.

  

**Role**

The **Technical Enablement Program Manager** will own the full lifecycle of our internal and external learning and enablement programs. The role is both hands-on and strategic and is responsible for defining and executing the strategy for designing, developing, implementing, and evaluating scalable training programs that empower employees, partners, and customers to succeed.

This is a high-impact individual contributor role. The role will not manage a team, but rather own and drive execution—collaborating cross-functionally while personally developing and delivering modern, engaging learning content. Success in this role requires a strong balance of strategy and execution, with a “roll-up-your-sleeves” approach to instructional design, project management, and stakeholder engagement. The role will partner with subject matter experts in product, services, and engineering to build outcome-driven training programs aligned to our business goals.

  

**Responsibilities**

* **Program Ownership**

* Define and lead the overall strategy for internal and external technical learning programs
* Build and maintain a roadmap of training priorities aligned to business goals
* Coordinate with subject matter experts (SMEs), product, engineering, and services teams to ensure enablement efforts stay aligned with evolving needs
* Advocate for SME availability and support within the organization
* Manage project timelines, training calendars, and program logistics—personally driving execution without a support team

* **Content Development**

* Work directly with internal experts to turn complex technical information into clear, useful training
* Develop content in a variety of formats like videos, guides, simulations, labs, and online courses
* Build learning paths for different audiences, such as new hires, engineers, support teams, and external users
* Make sure all content is accurate, consistent, and effective using proven instructional design practices
* Keep track of training needs and manage a list of content projects from start to finish

* **Deliver, Measure & Improve Training**

* Establish learning KPIs and reporting mechanisms to measure effectiveness and adoption
* Measure and ensure training content meets standards for accuracy, consistency, and instructional effectiveness
* Roll out training through live sessions, digital platforms, or self-paced courses
* Upload and organize content in the learning system so it’s easy to find and use
* Collect feedback from learners and look at usage data to see what’s working
* Make changes based on feedback to improve the learning experience
* Experiment with new training formats like microlearning, certifications, or gamified lessons to keep content fresh and engaging

  

**Minimum Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s Degree (Instructional Design, Computer Science, Information Technology, Learning & Development or related field)
* 5+ years of experience designing and delivering technical learning programs in a software or enterprise technology environment
* While deep technical expertise in our specific product is not required, experience with MES platforms (such as TrakSYS) or certification in enterprise manufacturing software is highly preferred.
* Ability to work with technical SMEs to translate complex concepts into learner-friendly content
* Proven ability to gather feedback and iterate based on learner needs and organizational goals

  

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Experience in manufacturing, industrial automation, MES, ERP, or plant operations
* Strong command of instructional design models (e.g., ADDIE, SAM, Bloom’s Taxonomy) and adult learning principles
* Experience designing multi-format content: e-learning, instructor-led training (ILT), virtual ILT, microlearning, labs, videos, documentation
* Strong command of instructional design models (e.g., ADDIE, SAM, Bloom’s Taxonomy) and adult learning principles
* Experience designing multi-format content: e-learning, instructor-led training (ILT), virtual ILT, microlearning, labs, videos, documentation
* Familiarity with learning measurement models (e.g., Kirkpatrick) and ability to report on training effectiveness
* Hands-on experience using Learning Management Systems (LMS) (e.g., Thinkific, Docebo, SAP Litmos, TalentLMS, or similar)
* Proficiency with authoring tools (e.g., Articulate Storyline, Rise, Camtasia, Adobe Captivate)
* Familiarity with SCORM, xAPI, or other e-learning standards

  

**Compensation / Benefits**

* $120,000 - $145,000 annual salary
* Variable bonus based on company and individual performance
* 100% Company-paid health insurance premiums for employee
* Ability to work a hybrid schedule
* Flexible vacation time
* Outstanding team environment

  

**Location (Hybrid/Remote)**

Hybrid (3 days in office, 2 days remote)

title: VP, Ops Services & Deployment
description:
The VP of Operations Services & Deployment plays a critical leadership role in enabling scalable, efficient, and guest-focused operations at Tatte. As the head of the Ops Services team, this individual will design and deliver systems, processes, and tools that simplify work for café and support teams, reduce friction, and unlock performance across the business. This leader serves as a strategic thought partner to the COO and cross-functional leaders, driving enterprise-wide initiatives that fuel operational excellence, innovation, and growth.

***Responsibilities:***

**Strategic Leadership**

* Serve as a core member of the senior leadership team, providing insight, analysis, and recommendations that shape Tatte’s operational strategy.
* Act as the primary liaison between café operations and support teams to ensure operational needs are proactively understood and addressed.

**Team & People Leadership**

* Lead, coach, and develop the Ops Services team with a focus on impact, ownership, and continuous improvement.
* Foster a culture of innovation, accountability, and service.

**Program & Project Management**

* Oversee planning, execution, and sustainment of key initiatives (KIs), tools, and systems.
* Establish project plans, success metrics, communication strategies, and post-launch reviews to ensure long-term value creation.

**Café Health & Guest Experience**

* Oversee all elements of café health, including Google reviews, Tattle, third-party health/inspection scores, and mystery shops.
* Lead reporting, analysis, and action planning to improve café health performance.
* Act as the functional lead for guest relations, ensuring strong recovery processes and communication standards that protect brand trust.

**New Café Openings (NCO)**

* Own the NCO setup process through systems, tools, and operational readiness, ensuring a seamless handoff to field operations.
* Partner with Learning & Development to support training plans and execution for new locations.

**Systems, Tools & Process Innovation**

* Lead the design, rollout, and optimization of systems including POS, inventory, labor planning, training, HRIS, menu management, and guest experience platforms.
* Monitor and enhance existing tools to keep them relevant, reliable, and value-adding.

**Deployment Management**

* Own the deployment calendar and playbook to ensure operational rollouts are well-sequenced, field-informed, and successfully adopted.
* Partner with L&D and Communications to enable change readiness and sustainment.

**Day-to-Day Operational Support**

* Manage continuous support for café teams and support centers across menu updates, tech tools, systems maintenance, and operational SOPs.
* Provide training and troubleshooting support to ensure high user adoption and minimal disruptions.

**Cross-Functional Collaboration**

* Partner closely with Operations, Finance, Technology, Culinary, Bakery, L&D, Visual, and Real Estate teams to integrate systems and tools that drive shared outcomes.

**Culture & Change Stewardship**

* Model and reinforce Tatte’s values and operating principles through every project, interaction, and communication.
* Act as a change leader to ensure new initiatives are embraced, understood, and aligned with our mission.

**Continuous Improvement**

* Partner with café leaders and operators to identify friction points, capture feedback, and drive continuous improvements in tools, systems, and support processes.

  

***Key Outcomes &*** ***Impact:***

* **Enhanced Operational Efficiency:** Deliver streamlined, user-friendly systems and processes that reduce manual effort, lower error rates, and increase team productivity.

* **Frictionless Deployment:** Design and manage deployment calendars that balance innovation with café capacity, ensuring smooth rollouts that stick.

* **Scalable Growth Enablement:** Build the operational infrastructure to support new café openings, menu expansions, and evolving guest experiences.

* **Cross-Functional Alignment:** Ensure all systems and initiatives are aligned across departments, delivering integrated solutions that reflect Tatte’s brand, culture, and business goals.

* **Elevated Team Experience:** Empower café and support teams through tools, training, and consistent communication, enhancing engagement and performance.

  

***Qualifications:***

**Required**

* 8+ years of experience in operations, systems, or project leadership roles, ideally in restaurant, retail, or hospitality industries.
* Proven track record of leading cross-functional initiatives that resulted in measurable performance improvements.
* Strong leadership and team development experience, with ability to inspire and grow high-performing teams.
* Exceptional organizational and prioritization skills; thrives managing multiple initiatives in a fast-paced environment.
* Advanced skills in project management, process design, and deployment planning.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills; capable of influencing across all levels of the organization.
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Office; especially Excel, Outlook, Word.

**Preferred**

* Experience with tools such as Toast, UltiPro, CrunchTime, HRIS systems, Google Business Tools, and WordPress.
* Experience working in or supporting café/restaurant operations.
* Bilingual in Spanish is a plus.

***Our Benefits and Perks:***

* Competitive pay
* 401(k) (with a vesting match)
* Free EAP employee assistance programs
* Paid vacation time (after three months of full-time service)
* Health, dental and vision insurance
* Generously discounted meals and free drinks
* Exciting potential for growth

  

Please note that Tatte is an E-Verify Employer.

Equal Opportunity Employer  
This employer is required to notify all applicants of their rights pursuant to federal employment laws. For further information, please review the Know Your Rights notice from the Department of Labor.

title: Alliance Manager – VAR Channel (Cybersecurity) - North America
description:
**Job Title:** Alliance Manager – VAR Channel (Cybersecurity) - North America

**Location:** Remote / North America

**Job Type:** Full-time

**About the Role:**

We are looking for an experienced **Alliance Manager** to lead and expand our channel partnerships in the Data and AI security space across North America. As the Alliance Manager, you will be responsible for building strategic relationships with top-tier VARs and Regional SIs to accelerate market penetration, drive joint sales and go-to-market initiatives, and enable these partners to deliver security solutions and services to their customers.

In this role, you will leverage your deep knowledge of these partners and your security expertise to deliver value to our customers, revenue for the partner and us and overall enhance our market positioning.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Partner Management:** Create,, nurture, and manage relationships with strategic VAR partners in the Data and AI security sector across North America.
* **Business Development:** Identify, recruit, and onboard high-potential VAR partners with a focus on Data and AI security solutions.
* **Go-to-Market Execution:** Collaborate with VARs to build joint go-to-market strategies, aligning securiti offerings with partners’ existing portfolios, and driving product adoption.
* **Sales Enablement:** Empower partners with the necessary resources, product training, certifications, and support to successfully sell cybersecurity solutions to end customers.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Establish and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to monitor partner performance, including pipeline development, sales growth, and certifications in cybersecurity solutions.
* **Strategic Planning:** Create and manage joint business plans that define revenue goals, tactical initiatives, and performance targets for VAR partners.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Work closely with product management, marketing, and sales teams to align on product positioning, partner marketing campaigns, and security solution offerings.
* **Cybersecurity Expertise:** Serve as the internal and external cybersecurity subject matter expert to help VAR partners understand the unique value proposition of the Securiti’a security products and services.

title: Product Marketing – Multicloud Security
description:
**Product Marketing – Multicloud Security**

We are looking for a seasoned product marketing professional to drive messaging,

content generation and sales enablement for Securiti’s award-winning multicloud data

protection, privacy and governance solution. This position will focus on multicloud data

security, including sensitive data discovery and classification, access controls, data

security posture management, data streaming analysis (Kafka bus, Confluent, etc.), and

data risk analysis. Key cloud environments include AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI, Snowflake,

Databricks and major SaaS applications. You will be a product evangelist and play a key

role in driving thought leadership and creating awareness in the marketplace. You will

have a deep technical understanding of the products and solutions, working closely with

product management.

**Responsibilities:**

* Lead product positioning and messaging of your product, including crisp

communication of value propositions

* Drive content for the website, collateral, webinars, trade shows and other

demand generation activities.

* Enable sales and partners with training, demos, collateral and customer

engagement to maximize success in the market.

* Maintain deep understanding of competitors and their positioning
* Collaborate with product management and field marketing to develop product

positioning and messaging that resonate with our target buyer personas.

* Plan product launches and manage the cross-functional implementation of the

plan.

* Act as the primary thought leader for the products you support externally,

including speaking engagements and written content.

**Skills & Qualifications:**

* 8 – 10 years of product marketing experience
* 5+ years in cloud security, with an understanding of data protection and

classification

* Strong understanding of major cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, GCP, OCI,

Snowflake, Databricks and major SaaS applications.

* Strong communicator with ability to drive succinct messaging and positioning
* Strong writing and power point creation skills
* Experience in public speaking, hosting webinars, and delivering presentations to

customers

* Ability to operate in a fast-paced startup environment and scale to

accommodate rapid growth

* 4-year degree in computer science, electrical engineering or related discipline

title: Principal Product Manager - Platform and Shared Services
description:
Principal Product Manager - Platform and Shared Services

About the Role

As a **Principal Product Manager** focused on our **SaaS Platform and Shared Services**, you will play a pivotal role in defining and driving the strategy, roadmap, and execution for the foundational platform services that power our Data and AI Security, Privacy, and Safe use of AI products. You’ll lead cross-functional initiatives to enhance platform scalability, resilience, security, and developer enablement across internal and external teams.

This role is ideal for a systems thinker who thrives in platform environments, understands the intricacies of multi-tenant SaaS architectures, and is passionate about delivering frictionless experiences for product teams, developers, and end users alike. You’ll collaborate closely with Engineering, Architecture, Security, and GTM stakeholders to ensure the platform evolves to meet the needs of a growing, diverse customer base.

Impact You’ll Make

* Define and evolve the product vision and roadmap for platform capabilities such as identity and access management, APIs, developer tooling, eventing systems, tenant management, observability, and data services.
* Lead cross-team efforts to modernize and unify shared services across multiple product lines, ensuring consistency, scalability, and high performance.
* Partner with engineering leaders to deliver a robust and secure platform architecture that accelerates innovation across product teams.
* Translate technical requirements into clear, prioritized initiatives, balancing long-term strategic investments with immediate business needs.
* Champion developer experience by delivering intuitive, reliable, and well-documented services that increase velocity and reduce cognitive load.
* Drive alignment across stakeholders through clear communication, documentation, and transparent decision-making.
* Monitor platform health and performance using KPIs, customer feedback, and adoption metrics to inform continuous improvement.

Required Qualifications

* 8+ years of product management experience, with at least 3 years focused on SaaS platforms, infrastructure, or shared services.
* Strong technical acumen with a deep understanding of multi-tenant cloud architectures, APIs, microservices, and access controls like RBAC and ABAC.
* Demonstrated success delivering platform products that support internal and external developers at scale.
* Proven ability to lead cross-functional initiatives in highly matrixed organizations.
* Experience developing roadmaps, writing detailed product requirements, and managing delivery in an Agile environment.
* Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills, including the ability to influence without authority.

Preferred Qualifications

* Experience with authentication and authorization frameworks (e.g., OAuth2, SAML, OpenID Connect).
* Familiarity with service mesh architectures, event-driven systems, or data pipelines.
* Background in developer tooling, API lifecycle management, or platform reliability.
* Previous experience in a high-growth B2B SaaS company or platform team.
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related technical field; advanced degree is a plus.

title: Event Specialist
description:
We believe in the power and joy of learning

At Cengage Group, our employees have a direct impact in helping students around the world discover the power and joy of learning. We are bonded by our shared purpose – driving innovation that helps millions of learners improve their lives and achieve their dreams through education.

Our culture values diversity, engagement, and discovery

Our business is driven by our strong culture, and we know that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace is essential to the success of our company and our learners, as well as our individual well-being. We recognize the value of diverse perspectives in everything we do and strive to ensure employees of all levels and backgrounds feel empowered to voice their ideas and bring their authentic selves to work. We achieve these priorities through inclusive programs, benefits, and initiatives that are integrated into the fabric of how we work every day. To learn more, please see

https://www.cengagegroup.com/about/inclusion-and-diversity/.

Cengage Academic is seeking an Event Specialist responsible for the logistical execution of trade shows and in-person hosted events. The Event Specialist will work closely with stakeholders to ensure all trade shows reflect and support our overarching brand, product & campaign strategies.

Essential Duties:

* Collaborate with members of the marketing, product, and sales teams to implement trade shows and customer events
* Provide strategic event management expertise to marketing and product partners throughout the execution process
* Lead all aspects of trade show and event execution from launch to completion
* Manage and supervise event budgets and spend, including timely payments for all services provided to Cengage
* Review and analyse post-event feedback and customer interactions for future improvements
* Provide logistical support to team members as needed, ranging from meeting food orders to registration site builds and customer satisfaction survey creation
* Based on project, specific duties could include:
* Work with multiple vendors to secure booth space, arrange for equipment, utilities and inbound/outbound shipments
* Site research, selection and contract review for event venues and services
* Build and maintain online registration sites (using Cvent)
* Coordinate and communicate logistics for A/V, internet, sleeping rooms, equipment rental, parking, air and ground transportation, food and beverage, etc.
* Make sure to communicate clearly with customers to give them the information they need to market and promote all upcoming events
* Travel to events to provide onsite management as needed

Requirements:

*Must have*

* BA in Hospitality, Marketing, or other related experience
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* 1-3 Years of tradeshow/event planning
* 1-3 Years contract negotiation experience
* 1-2 years of using events to drive Brand Awareness, Demand Generation and Sales Enablement
* Exceptional project management skills with utmost attention to detail
* Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
* Ability to work independently with a positive attitude and ability to learn
* Ability to travel 5 to 8 times per year
* Able to meet physical demands associated with essential functions of the role, including lifting 50 lbs., packing and unpacking event materials, and standing for extended periods
* Requires proficiency with MS Office and Office 365 and a mastery of Excel

*Preferred*

* Strong understanding of events impact on the marketing funnel and sales pipeline
* Experience with Event Technology (Cvent or similar) and Project Management technology (Workfront or similar)

About Cengage Group

Cengage Group, a global education technology company serving millions of learners, provides affordable, quality digital products and services that equip students with the skills and competencies needed to be job ready. For more than 100 years, we have enabled the power and joy of learning with trusted, engaging content, and now, integrated digital platforms. We serve the higher education, workforce skills, secondary education, English language teaching and research markets worldwide. Through our scalable technology, including MindTap and Cengage Unlimited, we support all learners who seek to improve their lives and achieve their dreams through education.

Cengage Group is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital status, parental status, cultural background, organizational level, work styles, tenure, and life experiences. Or for any other reason. You may view Cengage’s EEO/Affirmative Action Policy signed by CEO Michael Hansen and Equal Employment Opportunity is the Law notice by visiting their corresponding links.

Cengage Group is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations.ta@cengage.com or you may call us at +1 (617) 289-7917.

Compensation

At Cengage Group, we take great pride in our commitment to providing a comprehensive and rewarding Total Rewards package designed to support and empower our employees.

Click here

to learn more about our *Total Rewards Philosophy*.

The full base pay range has been provided for this position. Individual base pay will vary based on work schedule, qualifications, experience, internal equity, and geographic location. Sales roles often incorporate a significant incentive compensation program beyond this base pay range.

$20.00 - $25.00 USD
company_description: We are the global edtech company helping learners achieve their education and career goals and lead choice-filled lives.

title: Sr. Technical Solutions Manager
description:
LiveRamp is the data collaboration platform of choice for the world’s most innovative companies. A groundbreaking leader in consumer privacy, data ethics, and foundational identity, LiveRamp is setting the new standard for building a connected customer view with unmatched clarity and context while protecting precious brand and consumer trust. LiveRamp offers complete flexibility to collaborate wherever data lives to support the widest range of data collaboration use cases—within organizations, between brands, and across its premier global network of top-quality partners.

Hundreds of global innovators, from iconic consumer brands and tech giants to banks, retailers, and healthcare leaders turn to LiveRamp to build enduring brand and business value by deepening customer engagement and loyalty, activating new partnerships, and maximizing the value of their first-party data while staying on the forefront of rapidly evolving compliance and privacy requirements.

At LiveRamp, we believe connected data drives better experiences—and we power those experiences across the advertising ecosystem with unmatched scale, privacy, and precision. As a Technical Solutions Consultant (TS), you’ll partner with leading brands, agencies, platforms, and data providers to implement and optimize LiveRamp’s ad tech solutions.

In this role, you'll act as a trusted technical advisor, owning key accounts from onboarding through expansion. You’ll help customers activate data across channels, navigate signal loss, and measure outcomes—while also helping to build internal best practices that level up our broader team.

Responsibilities:

Technical Client Solutions Management

* Lead the end-to-end onboarding and technical adoption of LiveRamp’s ad tech solutions, serving as a trusted technical advisor to brands, advertisers, agencies, and financial institutions. Build and maintain strong, consultative client relationships to align technical implementation with business objectives.

Implementation & System Configuration

* Design and execute strategic implementation plans tailored to client goals. Oversee the technical setup and configuration of data onboarding, identity resolution, and audience activation workflows within LiveRamp platforms. Troubleshoot integration challenges and deliver scalable solutions to drive platform value.

Technical Project Management & Support

* Track customer adoption metrics and usage patterns to identify optimization opportunities. Proactively recommend system enhancements to improve campaign performance, operational efficiency, and alignment with evolving client needs.

Cross-Functional Technical Collaboration

* Act as the technical liaison between clients and internal teams, including product, engineering, technical services, legal, and privacy. Manage escalations, support the rollout of platform updates, and coordinate QA and UAT processes for new deployments.

Customer-Facing Technical Documentation & Enablement

* Develop and maintain clear, comprehensive technical documentation such as runbooks, integration guides, and workflow maps. Deliver technical enablement and training to both customers and internal teams to ensure successful product adoption and long-term success.

Customer Advocacy & Product Feedback

* Translate customer feedback into actionable insights for product development and roadmap planning. Advocate for client needs to refine platform features, reduce complexity, and increase automation in workflows.

Strategic Communication & Stakeholder Engagement

* Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear, client-friendly manner across both business and technical audiences. Provide regular updates on project milestones, product enhancements, and issue resolutions to drive stakeholder alignment.

Client Engagement & Industry Representation

* Support LiveRamp’s strategic initiatives through occasional travel for client meetings, workshops, and industry events. Strengthen client relationships and reinforce LiveRamp’s position as a leading ad tech partner.

Qualifications:

Technical Skills

* Understanding of Ad Tech Ecosystem: Familiarity with DSPs, SSPs, DMPs, CDPs, ID graphs, clean rooms, and data onboarding.
* Data Integration & APIs: Experience working with REST APIs, file-based integrations (e.g., SFTP), and data transformation processes.
* Web Technologies: Knowledge of web tracking (e.g., pixels, tags, cookies), identity resolution, and data flow across the martech/ad tech stack.
* Data & Querying: Competency in SQL, data analytics tools, or scripting for troubleshooting and insights.
* Troubleshooting & Debugging: Strong problem-solving skills in diagnosing and resolving technical issues across distributed systems.

Client-Facing & Communication Skills

* Client Relationship Management: Ability to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders across advertisers, agencies, and publishers.
* Solution Design & Presentation: Comfort creating and presenting solution proposals, technical diagrams, and use-case-specific workflows.
* Project & Account Management: Experience managing complex onboarding projects with cross-functional stakeholders and tight deadlines.
* Customer Advocacy: Ability to translate customer feedback into actionable insights for product and engineering teams.

The approximate annual base compensation range is $93,000 to $140,500. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, geography, as well as internal equity among our team.

Benefits:

* People: Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.
* Fun: We host in-person and virtual events such as game nights, happy hours, camping trips, and sports leagues.
* Work/Life Harmony: Flexible paid time off, paid holidays, options for working from home, and paid parental leave.
* Comprehensive Benefits Package: LiveRamp offers a comprehensive benefits package designed to help you be your best self in your personal and professional lives. Our benefits package offers medical, dental, vision, life and disability, an employee assistance program, voluntary benefits as well as perks programs for your healthy lifestyle, career growth and more.
* Savings: Our 401K matching plan—1:1 match up to 6% of salary—helps you plan ahead. Also Employee Stock Purchase Plan - 15% discount off purchase price of LiveRamp stock (U.S. LiveRampers)
* RampRemote: A comprehensive office equipment and ergonomics program—we provide you with equipment and tools to be your most productive self, no matter where you're located

More about us:

*LiveRamp’s mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principles—one that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across nine countries and four continents. Click* 

*here*

*to learn more about Diversity, Inclusion, & Belonging (DIB) at LiveRamp.*

LiveRamp is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer (AA/EOE/W/M/Vet/Disabled) and does not discriminate in recruiting, hiring, training, promotion or other employment of associates or the awarding of subcontracts because of a person's race, color, sex, age, religion, national origin, protected veteran, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetics or other protected status. Qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

California residents: Please see our

California Personnel Privacy Policy

for more information regarding how we collect, use, and disclose the personal information you provide during the job application process.

To all recruitment agencies: LiveRamp does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, LiveRamp employees or any other company location. LiveRamp is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
company_description: LiveRamp aspires to make it safe and easy for companies to use data effectively.

title: Digital Workplace - Digital Experience & Engagement Lead
description:
**The position is described below. If you want to apply, click the Apply Now button at the top or bottom of this page. After you click Apply Now and complete your application, you'll be invited to create a profile, which will let you see your application status and any communications. If you already have a profile with us, you can log in to check status.**

Need Help?

*If you have a disability and need assistance with the application, you can request a reasonable accommodation. Send an email to* *Accessibility* *(accommodation requests only; other inquiries won't receive a response).*

**Regular or Temporary:**

Regular

**Language Fluency:** English (Required)

**Work Shift:**

1st shift (United States of America)

### **Please review the following job description:**

Senior-level trusted advisor and thought-leader playing a critical role in driving the adoption and effective use of digital tools and platforms across the organization. This role is responsible for enhancing digital dexterity among teammates, ensuring they are confident, capable, and empowered to leverage technology in their daily work—ultimately reducing reliance on support services and improving productivity.  
This individual will champion the Digital Workplace brand, delivering clear, engaging, and consistent messaging around digital initiatives. By leveraging data and analytics, they will track adoption trends, measure engagement, and identify opportunities to optimize the digital employee experience.  
The ideal candidate combines a passion for communication and change enablement with a strong understanding of digital tools, user behavior, and organizational culture.  
  
1. Drive Technology Adoption: Develop and execute strategies to increase awareness and usage of digital tools and platforms, leading to improved teammate productivity and reduced support volume.  
2. Enhance Digital Dexterity: Create programs and campaigns that improve digital literacy and confidence across the organization, enabling teammates to work more efficiently and independently.  
3. Build the Digital Workplace Brand: Lead internal branding and messaging efforts to ensure consistent, engaging, and clear communication around digital initiatives and capabilities in partnership with Corporate Communications  
4. Leverage Data and Insights: Use analytics to track adoption, engagement, and performance of digital tools; identify gaps and opportunities to improve the digital employee experience.  
5. Support Strategic Transformation: Partner with enterprise teams to align digital engagement efforts with broader transformation initiatives, such as Core Banking and Enterprise Digital Strategy.  
6. Communicate Across Audiences: Translate complex digital capabilities into clear, compelling narratives for a variety of audiences—from executive leadership to frontline teammates.  
7. Evaluate Emerging Trends: Stay informed on digital workplace and employee experience trends to identify new opportunities for innovation and engagement.  
8. Collaborate Across Functions: Work closely with Technology, Corporate Communications, HR, and Change Management to ensure alignment and integration of digital engagement efforts.  
9. Develop Business Cases: Support the development of business cases for new digital engagement initiatives, articulating the value and investment required.  
10. Champion a Culture of Innovation: Foster a mindset of continuous improvement and digital curiosity across the organization

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**  
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.  
1. Evaluate financial-technology and other emerging technology trends in the industry to identify opportunities that warrant consideration and potential investment by the CTO.  
2. Stay abreast of business trends to identify existing and emerging enterprise gaps or opportunities; develop strategies to address gaps and take advantage of opportunities.  
3. Establish principles, rules, standards and best practices for enterprise technologies, injecting these in the established architecture and project review processes.  
4. Support strategic business transformation initiatives (Core Banking transformation, Enterprise Digital Strategy).  
5. Develop business cases that effectively represent the business opportunity and the investments (people, funding, time) required to achieve the enterprise value.  
6. Effectively communicate technology and business enablement future-state recommendations to a variety of audiences (from Board level/Executive Management to technologists to end-users) such that it engenders buy-in and active support.  
7. Establish framework for identifying broad architecture strategies, choices and standards.  
8. Identify future Truist transformation needs.  
9. Develop and leverage a network of external business partners, academics and technology thought leaders to ensure Truist positioned for the digital future.  
10. Collaborate with the broader Truist architecture community and provide input into Information Technology (IT) strategies and Architecture standards.  
11. Provide influential leadership that supports insightful decision-making, effectively aligns technology capabilities with business needs.

**QUALIFICATIONS**  
**Required Qualifications:**  
1. Bachelor's degree in Business, Management, or Management Information Systems-related field, or equivalent education and related training  
2. Fifteen to twenty years of progressively responsible leadership experience in technology;  
3. Fifteen to twenty years of experience in technology strategy and/or architectural domains  
4. Comprehensive experience with various architectural domains such as application, data, infrastructure, security and integration  
5. Broad understanding of technology, architectural and strategic-planning concepts  
6. Ability to identify and translate enterprise-level needs into technology plans/business solutions  
7. Ability to interact effectively with Executive Management  
8. Strong interpersonal, collaboration and communication skills  
9. Ability to think and act strategically  
10. Substantial experience as a senior-level and effective negotiator (internal and external negotiations)  
11. Demonstrated proficiency in basic computer applications, such as Microsoft Office software products

**Preferred Qualifications:**  
1. Master's degree in Business or IT

2. Previous experience communicating tech changes in corporate environment

3. Proven experience building digital programs in corporate environment

4. Previous banking experience

**OTHER JOB REQUIREMENTS / WORKING CONDITIONS**

**Sitting**  
Frequently (25% - 50% of the time)  
**Lifting**  
Up to 25 lbs.  
**Visual / Audio / Speaking**  
Able to access and interpret client information received from the computer and able to hear and speak with individuals in person and on the phone.  
**Manual Dexterity / Keyboarding**  
Able to work standard office equipment, including PC keyboard and mouse, copy/fax machines, and printers.  
**Availability**  
Able to work all hours scheduled, including overtime as directed by manager/supervisor and required by business need.  
**Travel**  
Up to 25%

**General Description of Available Benefits for Eligible Employees of Truist Financial Corporation:** All regular teammates (not temporary or contingent workers) working 20 hours or more per week are eligible for benefits, though eligibility for specific benefits may be determined by the division of Truist offering the position. Truist offers medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability, accidental death and dismemberment, tax-preferred savings accounts, and a 401k plan to teammates. Teammates also receive no less than 10 days of vacation (prorated based on date of hire and by full-time or part-time status) during their first year of employment, along with 10 sick days (also prorated), and paid holidays. For more details on Truist’s generous benefit plans, please visit our Benefits site. Depending on the position and division, this job may also be eligible for Truist’s defined benefit pension plan, restricted stock units, and/or a deferred compensation plan. As you advance through the hiring process, you will also learn more about the specific benefits available for any non-temporary position for which you apply, based on full-time or part-time status, position, and division of work.

***Truist is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, citizenship or national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other classification protected by law. Truist is a Drug Free Workplace.***

title: AVP, Brand Partnerships & Buying Strategic Initiatives
description:
Salary Range $188,000 - $245,000\\*
  
  
**Job Description:**  
As AVP of Brand Partnerships & Buying Strategic Initiatives, you will serve as a key enterprise leader, driving the execution of transformative business strategies across multiple functions. You will provide executive oversight of critical initiatives, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives while delivering operational excellence, cross-functional integration, and scalable growth. This role requires a visionary leader with strong business acumen, executive presence, and the ability to navigate complex stakeholder environments to deliver high-impact results.
  
  
Enterprise Strategy & Initiative Leadership
  
  
Serve as the executive sponsor and enterprise lead for high-profile initiatives such as Reliance-SFA USA and Saks on Amazon, ensuring successful cross-functional execution across merchandising, marketing, real estate, and brand partners.
  
  
Lead the strategic planning, prioritization, and execution of complex, enterprise-level programs that align with long-term business objectives and drive revenue growth.
  
  
Define and implement scalable processes that support business agility, innovation, and partnership expansion.
  
  
Business Planning & Executive Alignment
  
  
Drive the annual strategic planning process, executive business reviews, and critical market events in partnership with the BP & Buying senior leadership team.
  
  
Align cross-functional teams around shared goals through robust planning frameworks and integrated operating models.
  
  
Act as a thought partner to senior executives, translating the Brand Partnerships vision into actionable roadmaps.
  
  
Organizational Transformation & Operating Model Redesign
  
  
Lead strategic transformation efforts in collaboration with external consultants (e.g., PwC), Talent, and Brand Partnerships and Buying leadership to evolve organizational design, team structures, and job architecture.
  
  
Oversee enterprise change management efforts, championing new ways of working to increase agility, accountability, and impact.
  
  
Market Readiness & Enablement
  
  
Own the market enablement strategy, ensuring comprehensive readiness for key product and brand partner events.
  
  
Develop and lead executive-level frameworks, timelines, and communication strategies to drive operational excellence and stakeholder engagement.
  
  
Performance Management & Innovation Oversight
  
  
Establish a centralized governance model for merchandising initiatives including brand activations, new category expansions, and product launches.
  
  
Drive performance analysis and continuous improvement through robust KPIs and executive-level reporting, optimizing for profitability, partner satisfaction, and customer experience.
  
  
Cross-Functional Integration & Strategic Real Estate Planning
  
  
Partner with Store Planning and Real Estate leadership to align renovation and expansion efforts with merchandising and brand strategies.
  
  
Lead cross-functional integration efforts, ensuring strategic alignment between real estate investments and enterprise growth goals.
  
  
Oversee special merchandising programs such as brand activations, category expansions, product launches, and seasonal campaigns.
  
  
Ensure initiatives are aligned with global strategy, governance standards, and brand partner expectations.
  
  
Analyze key performance indicators to assess impact and optimize execution for improved profitability and customer experience.
  
  
It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.
  
  
Saks.com is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
  
  

* The above expected salary range may have some variability based upon factors including, but not limited to, a candidate’s overall experience, qualifications, and geographic location. If you are interested in the role, we encourage you to apply and, if selected to move forward in the interview process, you will have a chance to speak with our recruitment team regarding your specific salary expectations.

title: Manager, Enablement Strategy
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category

Sales

Job Details

**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

We are looking for an experienced Strategic Program Manager to join our Field Readiness Strategy team, sitting at the heart of a Learning and Enablement organization. This high-impact role is made for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, has a bias for action, and is passionate about the future of work, particularly the rise of agentic AI and the digital workforce.
  
As a catalyst for change, you will be at the forefront of transformation, leading the design and execution of both seasonal initiatives and multi-year programs that span internal transformation and go-to-market strategic enablement. You'll partner cross functionally to drive organizational change, shape scalable strategic programs, and unlock new, innovative ways of working in the age of AI.

What You’ll Do

* Design, lead, and execute global strategic initiatives focused on internal transformation or driving productivity for go-to-market teams.
* Design and execute change management strategies to implement organisational transformation and adoption of Agentic AI
* Partner with cross functional teams to create upskilling and engagement strategies to drive transformation with Agentic AI
* Champion the integration of Digital Workforce capabilities and AI-powered tools, ensuring successful adoption and sustained impact.
* Translate complex strategies into clear plans and communications that drive clarity and execution
* Stay at the forefront of AI, helping the team integrate AI into our ways of working and drive adoption through scalable change programs
* Serve as a thought partner and trusted advisor to stakeholders, connecting the dots across teams and ensuring programs land with clarity and impact.

What We’re Looking For

* 6+ years of experience in strategy consulting, business transformation, or strategic program/change management roles (consulting background preferred but not required)
* Proven experience designing and executing enterprise-level change management strategies and strategic programs
* Passion for AI transformation, agentic AI, and enabling a Digital Workforce.
* Strong strategic thinking and structured problem-solving skills, with the ability to simplify complexity
* Strong communicator and storyteller who can distill complex topics into clear, compelling narratives
* Bring a data-driven mindset, leveraging insights and analytics to inform decision-making, measure impact, and continuously optimize programs for effectiveness and scale
* A “get-it-done” mindset with a bias for action, balanced with strong stakeholder management and collaboration
* Exceptional executive presence and comfortable communicating and engaging senior leadership
* Ability to thrive in ambiguity, adapt quickly, and move from strategy to execution with urgency and precision.

Why Join Us

* You’ll be joining a high-performing, collaborative team that sits at the heart of an Enablement and Learning Organization. We are change agents, dot-connectors, and problem-solvers who love to think big and execute even bigger. If you’re excited by AI, passionate about strategic impact, and want to drive meaningful change across a global organization, we’d love to hear from you.
* As a catalyst for change, you will be at the forefront of transformation, leading the design and execution of both seasonal initiatives and multi-year programs that span internal transformation and go-to-market strategic enablement. You'll partner cross functionally to drive organizational change, shape scalable strategic programs, and unlock new, innovative ways of working in the age of AI.

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

Posting Statement

Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. title: Director of Product Management, Data Cloud
description:
*To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.*

Job Category

Product

Job Details

**About Salesforce**

We’re Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too — driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good – you’ve come to the right place.

We are looking for a passionate Product Manager that wants to be a part of defining the future. The right candidate will have in-depth experience building Data Management, BI and AI analytics platform capabilities using metadata driven system, configuration based extensibility across UI, persistence, analytics and integration layers, integrating data in heterogeneous application landscapes with use of APIs & connectors and domain expertise with Salesforce or equivalent CRM or Marketing solutions. Experience with big data technologies, analytic platforms or applications built for high scale and performance is a big plus.

  

REASONS TO JOIN:

* Impact - your work will be used by thousands of customers, including Fortune 500 companies
* Technology - you will be working with consumer-scale big data and analytics technologies.
* People - you will work with great people in engineering, user experience, research, data science, customer success and more. Providing excellent opportunities to contribute and Learn from the best!
* Broad Exposure - you’ll partner with dozens of teams across the company, building your profile and influence while you learn a ton about the top products.
* Learning - you will join a highly cross functional team who interact with all parts of the business every single week.
* Customer Success - You will work in an organization highly focused on delivering customer success throughout their lifecycle
* Culture - Salesforce is a great place to work where there’s open and honest communication with our Ohana culture.

RESPONSIBILITIES

* Develop a comprehensive and forward-thinking product strategy and roadmap for Data Cloud, deeply guided by a deep understanding of meta data driven platforms and industry best practices.
* Delivering multiple features with a focus on Data Management, Governance, and Privacy impacting our AI and Data roadmap.
* Work with other Salesforce cloud products to light up end to end use cases based on data and analytics integrations.
* Collaborating with Salesforce Platform R&D teams to drive necessary platform requirements and dependencies.
* Deliver resources to support adoption through various channels, training, trailhead, blogs, open source and internal proof of concepts.
* Collaborate across multiple teams internally. These services have a high number of internal stakeholders with conflicting needs and require strong product leadership to ensure alignment, consistent design principles, and adoption from other teams.
* Balance product vision & roadmap with partner and customer feedback, competitive analysis, prioritizing across a diverse set of inputs and constituents.
* Engage with our partner and customer communities to deliver feature and product enablement, drive customer success and product adoption.
* Highly Data Driven, experienced with estimations, drive metrics and KPI for adoption, growth etc.
* Experienced in CTS analysis, Pricing and Packaging.
* Work closely with key customers to envision, plan and execute along with assigned architecture and consulting resources.

QUALIFICATIONS

* A deep understanding of building App Platforms including metadata, custom objects & fields, APIs and Setup.
* Strong understanding of Saas Platform technologies, architecture, and integrations, experience with Salesforce Platform is a big plus, including Developer Platform, DX, extensibility, UI, API.
* Demonstrated success in conceptualizing and launching platform products, ideally within the Salesforce ecosystem
* BS or MS in Engineering, Computer Science, or related disciplines or equivalent experience in technical leadership roles.
* Minimum of 10 years’ combined experience in engineering or product management with expertise in SaaS or PaaS environments.
* Proven ability to influence and coordinate cross-functional teams to execute against a plan.
* Well-developed leadership, management, and strategic-thinking skills, with the ability to excite and lead others.
* Excellent organization and communications skills, with experience communicating across groups with varying degrees of technical background.
* Experience presenting to executive leadership, participating in the sales cycle, and handling sensitive customer escalations.
* Experience with big data technologies, analytic platforms and AI/ML frameworks

Accommodations

If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

Posting Statement

Salesforce is an equal opportunity employer and maintains a policy of non-discrimination with all employees and applicants for employment. What does that mean exactly? It means that at Salesforce, we believe in equality for all. And we believe we can lead the path to equality in part by creating a workplace that’s inclusive, and free from discrimination. Know your rights: workplace discrimination is illegal. Any employee or potential employee will be assessed on the basis of merit, competence and qualifications – without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression or identity, transgender status, age, disability, veteran or marital status, political viewpoint, or other classifications protected by law. This policy applies to current and prospective employees, no matter where they are in their Salesforce employment journey. It also applies to recruiting, hiring, job assignment, compensation, promotion, benefits, training, assessment of job performance, discipline, termination, and everything in between. Recruiting, hiring, and promotion decisions at Salesforce are fair and based on merit. The same goes for compensation, benefits, promotions, transfers, reduction in workforce, recall, training, and education.

In the United States, compensation offered will be determined by factors such as location, job level, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles may be eligible for incentive compensation, equity, and benefits. Salesforce offers a variety of benefits to help you live well including: time off programs, medical, dental, vision, mental health support, paid parental leave, life and disability insurance, 401(k), and an employee stock purchasing program. More details about company benefits can be found at the following link: https://www.salesforcebenefits.com.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring, Salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

### **For Washington-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $211,500 to $306,600.**

### **For California-based roles, the base salary hiring range for this position is $230,800 to $334,600.**

title: Sales Ops Intern
description:
**About Us:**

Digimarc Corporation (NASDAQ: DMRC) is the global leader in product digitization. A pioneer in digital watermarks, Digimarc connects every physical and digital item to a digital twin that enables the capture of product data, records events and interactions, and supports powerful new automations. Trusted to deter counterfeiting of global currency for more than 20 years, Digimarc is also recognized for ensuring product authenticity, improving plastics recycling, and more, with a commitment to promoting a prosperous, safer, and more sustainable world. In 2023, Digimarc was named to the Fortune 2023 Change the World list and honored as a 2023 Fast Company World Changing Ideas finalist. See more at Digimarc.com.

**About the Role**

We are seeking a data-savvy, process-minded intern to join our Revenue Operations (RevOps) team and support our Sales Operations. This internship is ideal for students or recent graduates in Business, Finance, Analytics, Mathematics, or related fields who are eager to gain hands-on experience in sales operations, forecasting, performance reporting, and GTM process optimization.

As a Sales Operations Intern, you will help build and manage reporting cadences, support forecasting efforts, drive operational efficiency and contribute to high-impact projects that improve sales productivity and decision-making. This role offers broad exposure to how a fast-paced revenue organization operates and an opportunity to learn from experienced professionals.

### **Key Requirements**

* **Reporting & Analytics**

  

* Assist in creating and maintaining dashboards and reports for pipeline health, forecast accuracy, and sales performance metrics
* Support ad hoc data requests and help uncover actionable insights from sales trends and activities
* Help maintain data integrity within Salesforce and other GTM tools

* **Forecasting & Business Reviews**

  

* Support weekly and monthly forecasting processes, including updates to master forecast files and leadership reporting
* Assist in preparing materials for monthly and quarterly sales reviews (e.g., actuals, attainment, pipeline coverage)
* Track and summarize key metrics such as revenue, bookings, utilization, and sales activity

* **Operational Process Support**

  

* Document and optimize key sales processes (e.g., territory planning, account assignment, pipeline hygiene)
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (Marketing, Finance, GTM) to gather requirements and support RevOps initiatives
* Help streamline reporting workflows and establish consistent publication cadences (weekly, biweekly, monthly)

* **Communication & Documentation**

  

* Draft internal updates and summaries for leadership calls and sales newsletters
* Help maintain content and documentation related to RevOps processes and policies
* Partner with the Sales team to support enablement efforts through data, reporting, and process improvements that drive productivity and readiness

* **What You Bring**

  

* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Business, Analytics, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, or a related field
* Strong Excel or Google Sheets skills; familiarity with Salesforce is a plus
* Analytical thinker with the ability to synthesize data and draw insights
* Excellent attention to detail, organization, and time management
* Clear communicator — both written and verbal — who’s comfortable working with cross-functional teams
* Curious, resourceful, and eager to learn in a fast-paced environment

**Why This Role Matters**

You’ll gain practical experience supporting one of the most critical functions of a growing business — Revenue Operations. This internship will help you build a foundation in sales analytics, forecasting, and business process improvement, setting you up for future roles in operations, sales strategy, or GTM leadership.

**Our Culture:**

We are a team of problem-solvers united by our company’s immense potential to help solve complex challenges.

We align to the following Digimarc core values:

**Collaborative** – Stronger together

We embrace diverse perspectives and harness our collective talent to realize our full potential.

**Curious** – Listen and look forward

We think differently and seek out opportunities for growth to exceed our stakeholders’ expectations.

**Courageous** – Innovate with integrity

**Benefits:**

Comprehensive Benefits Including Medical, Dental, Vision, & Retirement Savings Plan

Restricted Stock Units

Flexible Paid Time Off & Holidays

Life Insurance

Tuition Reimbursement

Mentorship Opportunities

Training & Development

Remote work

We challenge each other and do the right thing – even when it’s difficult – to deliver wins for our customers.

Join our team and work in support of a technology platform that can transform how consumer goods are made, bought, sold, and recycled around the globe. Digimarc is committed to the health and safety of our employees and their families. We are dedicated to diversity, professional development, and the success of our employees. For more information, visit us at www.digimarc.com.

Digimarc is seeking diverse applicants. We are an equal opportunity employer and consider qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected factor. We want the best people who share our values.

*This job posting is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.*

*Principals only. No recruiters please.*
