title: Director of Channel Partnerships and Enablement, Open Banking
description:
**Our Purpose**

*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*

**Title and Summary**

Director of Channel Partnerships and Enablement, Open BankingPosition Overview:  
  
We are seeking an experienced and dynamic Director of Channel Partnerships and Enablement to lead the activation strategy and go-to-market enablement of our channel partners within the Open Banking Customer Success team. This role is pivotal in designing and executing strategies that rapidly scale partnerships with acquirers, processors, Payment Service Providers (PSPs), credit platforms, mortgage enablers, and technical integrators.
  
  
This role is all about strategic activation, scalable GTM execution, and revenue-driving programs. The ideal candidate brings deep expertise in joint sales strategy, referral programs, co-marketing, and enabling partner sales motions to generate commercial outcomes.
  
  
Key Responsibilities:  
  

* Channel Activation Strategy:

Develop and execute an activation and GTM strategy for key channel partners, with a focus on rapidly enabling revenue generation across strategic segments (processors, PSPs, acquirers, mortgage tech, etc.).
  
  

* Joint Go-to-Market Planning:

Build joint value propositions and market-facing messaging in partnership with Sales and Marketing. Define scalable GTM plays for each partner type.
  
  

* Sales Enablement:

Design and deliver partner training programs and sales collateral to drive product fluency and effective positioning among partner teams.
  
  

* Referral & Reseller Program Design:

Launch and manage referral, co-sell, and reseller models. Define engagement tiers, incentive structures, and program governance.
  
  

* Partner Pipeline Development:

Track and optimize partner-driven opportunities through CRM and sales channels. Collaborate with Sales to ensure visibility, velocity, and impact.
  
  

* Co-Marketing Execution:

Plan and launch joint marketing campaigns, webinars, and event sponsorships to drive awareness, leads, and adoption.
  
  

* Strategic Partner Onboarding (Selective):

Partner with Sales and BD to selectively support onboarding of strategic partners—ensuring rapid ramp-up of commercial activity.
  
  

* Performance Measurement:

Define success metrics and implement dashboards to monitor activation performance, optimize program outcomes, and report impact to senior leadership.
  
  

* Cross-Functional Collaboration:

Coordinate closely with Marketing, Sales, Legal, Product, and CSMs to ensure alignment across partner-facing initiatives.
  
  

* Market Intelligence:

Stay current on industry trends, competitive landscape, and partner innovations to continually evolve our partner activation model.
  
  
All About You:  
  

* Education:

o Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Finance, or a related field.
  
o MBA or advanced degree preferred.
  
  

* Experience:

o Deep experience in partnerships, channel enablement, or GTM strategy within fintech, open banking, or financial services.
  
o Proven success launching referral or reseller programs and enabling channel sales organizations.
  
  

* Industry Knowledge:

Strong understanding of the open banking ecosystem and its distribution players.
  
  

* Go-to-Market Expertise:

Experience building joint GTM strategies, sales plays, and co-branded marketing campaigns.
  
  

* Revenue Orientation:

Comfort owning partner-influenced pipeline targets and optimizing commercial impact.
  
  

* Communication & Influence:

Ability to influence internal stakeholders and external partners with clarity, confidence, and data-driven insights.
  
  

* Leadership & Execution:

Skilled in managing cross-functional initiatives from concept to execution, with the ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment.Mastercard is a merit-based, inclusive, equal opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We hire the most qualified candidate for the role. In the US or Canada, if you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process or during the recruitment process, please contact reasonable\\_accommodation@mastercard.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. The Reasonable Accommodations team will respond to your email promptly.

**Corporate Security Responsibility**

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

In line with Mastercard’s total compensation philosophy and assuming that the job will be performed in the US, the successful candidate will be offered a competitive base salary based on location, experience and other qualifications for the role and may be eligible for an annual bonus or commissions depending on the role. Mastercard benefits for full time (and certain part time) employees generally include: insurance (including medical, prescription drug, dental, vision, disability, life insurance), flexible spending account and health savings account, paid leaves (including 16 weeks new parent leave, up to 20 paid days bereavement leave), 10 annual paid sick days, 10 or more annual paid vacation days based on level, 5 personal days, 10 annual paid U.S. observed holidays, 401k with a best-in-class company match, deferred compensation for eligible roles, fitness reimbursement or on-site fitness facilities, eligibility for tuition reimbursement, gender-inclusive benefits and many more.

**Pay Ranges**

Purchase, New York: $124,000 - $186,000 USDSan Francisco, California: $130,000 - $194,000 USD

title: (USA) Director, Revenue Operations Scaled Services, Enablement and Support
description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------

**Description:**

At Sam’s Club, we are member obsessed. We look to add value to the Sam’s Club membership, and we partner with suppliers to bring unique and exciting values to our members. Sam’s Club Member Access Platform (MAP) is the nexus of the Supplier -Marketer- Merchant partnership and are responsible for delivering our suppliers (advertisers) impactful omnichannel member experiences that are married with measurable insights. This is a unique opportunity to join a fast growing, highly visible team within Sam’s Club. We believe all digital advertising can be targeted and accountable – and we have Sam’s Club first party membership sales data to prove it. MAP wins when suppliers invest in digital media to drive growth; Sam’s and our supplier partners win when your digital expertise helps sell more goods online and offline. Growth in our digital advertising business is key to fueling Sam’s overall growth strategy.

MAP’s Director, Revenue Operations will lead an agile team of associates supporting revenue and billing operations for the advertising sales arm for Sam’s Club. As the leader of the Revenue Operations team, you will be responsible for partnering with Head of Sales managing the overall hygiene and accuracy of the pipeline and monthly forecast submissions. You will be the primary bridge between MAP and our Finance partners. You will be responsible for producing MAP’s weekly business update in collaboration with MAP’s Head of Sales and Head of MAP Strategy that is provided executive leadership team.

In this role you will provide thought leadership on innovative ways the Revenue Operations team can provide more insight and value for MAP beyond weekly business and sales updates. This includes identifying new ways to support.

Also, as the Director, Revenue Operations you will create a data-driven narrative to support AOP targets partnering with our GM, VP and Head of MAP Strategy. This includes partnering with the Director, Business Operations on workforce and annual SG&A budget planning alongside our enterprise cross-functional partners in Finance and Human Resources.

This means you will be responsible for MAP’s entire billing operations process working across Sales, Suppliers, and enterprise xfn teams – Finance, Accounting, Controllership, etc.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**:

* Develop, drive, and enhance ongoing reporting efforts of sales performance data and business metrics. Specifically, you will be partnering with Head of Sales on the pipeline hygiene and achieving high fidelity as to relates to forecast accuracy.
* Oversee MAP’s end-to-end Billing operations for on-time and accurate invoicing.
* Validate and deliver Quarterly SIP (sales incentive plan) reporting to Total Rewards. This includes advising VP/GM, and HR re: SIP exception requests.
* Collaborate with the MAP Finance team on monthly forecast, AOP development, ad hoc analyses requested
* Establish high levels of quality, accuracy, and process consistency in revenue planning, forecasting, and annual budgeting approaches.
* Partner with the Business Intelligence team on defining data needs and continuous improvements and enhancements to dashboards needed to support the financial reporting and insights needs of the business.
* Able to operate in a fast-paced dynamic environment delivering high quality output under tight timelines is a must.
* Support effective change management and own the roll out of process improvements and related documentation, training, and reporting. Create meaningful feedback loops to evaluate effectiveness of initiatives and support future iterations.
* Lead through influence, providing strategic guidance and effecting change outside of lane in the interest of bettering the overall organization
* Convert data to make it analysis-ready by compiling data from multiple sources and presenting it in a digestible and actionable format.
* Ability to dive deep to find answers with actionable outcomes and/or solutions leveraging strong data extraction skills to curate insights through analyzing historic data, variances, and trends, and to identify and mitigate gaps/risks/impact and uncover opportunities.
* Identify, develop, manage, and execute analyses to uncover opportunities and provide written recommendations.
* Communicate data clearly and concisely, adjusting your style for different audiences to address complex finance issues effectively. Your communication influences critical business decisions.
* Ability to dive deep to find answers with actionable outcomes and/or solutions leveraging strong data extraction skills to curate insights through analyzing historic data, variances, and trends, and to identify and mitigate gaps/risks/impact and uncover opportunities.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Minimum 7 years in Revenue Ops/Finance or comparable field in highly matrixed organization.
* Minimum of 5 years people management experience preferred
* Minimum of 7 years working with Sales and exhibits a commercial mindset understanding the needs/pain points of Sales.
* Experience working with Sales or with commercial business stakeholders
* Ability to communicate with impact and influence both verbally and written across diverse audience within a highly matrixed organization
* A fundamental understanding on what motivates sales organizations to perform.
* A fundamental understanding of how metrics can be used to track and improve the performance of sales teams.
* A creative problem solver – willing to look at old problems in new ways.
* Bachelor’s degree in business or finance required.
* Experience with CRM, OMS, and or other forecasting or BI tools.
* Digital advertising experience preferred

At Sam's Club, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet!

‎

* Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage

‎

* Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance

‎

* Paid time off benefits include PTO, parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.

‎

For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices.

‎

* Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.

‎

Live Better U is a company paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

‎

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.

‎

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.

‎

**Minimum Qualifications...**
-----------------------------

*Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.*

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, communication, digital media/advertising, or related area and 5 years' experience in campaign management, business development, market development, or related area.  
  
Option 2: 7 years' experience in campaign management, business development, market development, or related area.

**Preferred Qualifications...**
-------------------------------

*Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.*

6 years' experience in account management., 6 years' experience in customer-facing role., 6 years' experience in digital media., Leading cross-functional teams, Master's degree in business, marketing, communication, digital media/advertising or related area and 4 year's experience in campaign management, business development, market development, or related area., With CRM.

title: Senior Lead Vehicles Services Trainer
description:
This role is responsible for the execution of the overall Automotive Technician training center strategy, in alignment with Manheim and Mobility business priorities and objectives.  
  
The Senior Lead Vehicle Services Trainer will also lead a team of supporting training professionals who are all focused on delivering and supporting a training curriculum that enhance associate technical skills and capability and deliver a superior training experience. This position requires an experienced training professional and leader that demonstrates exceptional collaboration with both functional and operational leaders to align training design, execution, and reinforcement across the Manheim Reconditioning and select Mobility technician workforces.  
  
A proven track record driving training results in large, complex organizations is critical to the success of the role to align training and development with business requirements, objectives, and strategy. The Senior Lead Vehicle Services Trainer leader is responsible for promoting an engaged, high-performance culture across a newly combined training team, including coaching and developing leaders and individual contributors while influencing across the organization. The position functions as an internal partner to senior leaders by assessing developmental gaps and learning needs of our tech force and determining appropriate and measurable training and enablement initiatives.  
  
PRIMARY DUTIES/KEY RESPONSIBILITES  

* Partner with business leaders to vision and build training and enablement strategies aligning to the overall Vehicle Services business strategy, coordinating across the organization to identify and prioritize learning needs and collaborating to ensure effective implementation.
* Align with key stakeholders, including business leaders, HR, IT, Global Learning, Marketing, and Product on the role of the training organization as part of the wider training and enablement ecosystem and formulate a plan to execute, ensuring consistency in our approach across all of CAI.
* Organize training teams into a cohesive and productive organization to execute on key priorities, providing guidance and direction to direct reports, senior managers, and individual contributors, building a high performance and trusted team culture.
* Management of existing programs and support the design/creation of new programs and training materials and a vision for how our approach will evolve in the next 2-3 years.
* Direct the instructional design and development of learning solutions for a variety of topics and delivery methods including learning campaigns, e-learning and instructor-led content.
* Develop effective leadership coaching and development strategies in alignment with business needs.
* Partner with senior execs to continually evaluate the effectiveness of the tech training and enablement programs based on KPIs and ROI metrics. Modify existing plans as required to ensure future success.
* Establish strong relationships and meet regularly with leaders to understand needs and opportunities.
* Analyze learning evaluation data and metrics to diagnose gaps, identify opportunities and implement change to ensure content is current, relevant and delivered in the most efficient and effective manner.
* Manage vendor partnerships and build relationships with 3rd party training providers and software vendors as needed.
* Perform any other duties assigned

  
Qualifications:  

* Bachelor degree preferred. Equivalent industry experience will be considered.
* 10+ years of experience with Automotive Technology training
* Demonstrated knowledge of instructional design techniques
* Strong leadership and team development skills
* Leadership experience in the Learning & Development area demonstrated success in building a tech learning, enablement, and/or development strategy
* Proactive, analytical, and strategic approach to instructional program design and development
* Excellent ability to motivate, inspire and communicate to multiple levels of the organization
* Must possess strong business acumen
* Superior written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Experience with Learning Management Systems (LMS) and/or software
* Ability to drive vision and consciously cultivate a culture of positivity and excellence
* Ability to engage key stakeholders, build support and influence outcomes to drive the agenda
* Ability to handle a high volume of work in a short period of time, handle multiple priorities simultaneously and operate in a demanding work environment
* Travel: up to 50%

  
MSCOX  
  
USD 99,000.00 - 165,000.00 per year  
  
**Compensation:**  
  
Compensation includes a base salary of $99,000.00 - $165,000.00. The base salary may vary within the anticipated base pay range based on factors such as the ultimate location of the position and the selected candidate's knowledge, skills, and abilities. Position may be eligible for additional compensation that may include an incentive program.  
  
**Benefits:**  
  
The Company offers eligible employees the flexibility to take as much vacation with pay as they deem consistent with their duties, the company's needs, and its obligations; seven paid holidays throughout the calendar year; and up to 160 hours of paid wellness annually for their own wellness or that of family members. Employees are also eligible for additional paid time off in the form of bereavement leave, time off to vote, jury duty leave, volunteer time off, military leave, and parental leave.  
  
Applicants must currently be authorized to work in the United States for any employer without current or future sponsorship.

title: Enterprise Risk Manager
description:
**Want a meaningful career where you can make a difference? Edward Jones sounds perfect for you.**  
  
Collaboration. Autonomy. Opportunity. Words our headquarters associates use when talking about working at Edward Jones. Words that describe what it's like being part of a firm where everyone is aligned toward a singular focus: serving the client. And everyone is working to make the firm better together - as they grow as individuals. If these words resonate with you, we should talk.  
  
**Job Overview**  
  
**Position Schedule:** Full-Time  
  
This job posting is anticipated to remain open for 30 days, from 17-Jun-2025. The posting may close early due to the volume of applicants.  
  
The Enterprise Risk Manager is responsible for implementing components of the Edward Jones Enterprise Risk Management framework and following established processes and procedures as set forth by senior leadership. This position collaborates within the division and ERM as needed to support risk identification, risk measurement, risk controls and risk monitoring. The position will analyze data and provide recommendations that aid in risk reporting within their specific domain and with senior leadership guidance. As part of the Enterprise Risk Management team, this individual will contribute to the build and enablement of our Enterprise risk culture. The Enterprise Risk Manager is an individual contributor with knowledge and awareness in the risk management field and financial services industry, and is directly responsible to an Enterprise Risk Management Director.  
**What You'll Do:**  

* Assists with the execution of Enterprise risk strategies, in alignment with the company's strategic objectives and our Enterprise Risk Management strategy.
* Contributes to the development of Enterprise Risk Management programs, policies, standards and processes to analyze and report enterprise risks, and to manage risks according to the Enterprise Risk Management Framework.
* Assists with components of the Enterprise Risk Management Framework, such as framework pillars, programs, or objective-level execution.
* Review components of the Enterprise risk profile to aid in the identification of risk insights to ensure effective risk management and prioritization of our most significant risks at the firm level.
* Assists leadership to ensure components of the organization's risk management framework and strategies are in compliance with applicable regulations, rating agency standards, and strategic imperatives of the organization.
* Works with partners within ERM to further develop and strengthen our Enterprise Risk Management framework.
* Assists leadership to support effective risk management practices across the company's governance ecosystem and decision-making processes.
* Contributes to a collaborative, accountable, transparent and proactive risk culture within the function.
* Acts as a resource to implement targeted enhancements to the Enterprise Risk Framework to ensure the effectiveness and continuous improvement towards maturity.
* Stays informed on risk industry and educational/development opportunities.

  
Edward Jones' compensation and benefits package includes medical and prescription drug, dental, vision, voluntary benefits (such as accident, hospital indemnity, and critical illness), short- and long-term disability, basic life, and basic AD&D coverage. Short- and long-term disability, basic life, and basic AD&D coverage are provided at no cost to associates. Edward Jones offers a 401k retirement plan, and tax-advantaged accounts: health savings account, and flexible spending account. Edward Jones observes ten paid holidays and provides 15 days of vacation for new associates beginning on January 1 of each year, as well as sick time, personal days, and a paid day for volunteerism. Associates may be eligible for bonuses and profit sharing. All associates are eligible for the firm's Employee Assistance Program. For more information on the Benefits available to Edward Jones associates, please visit our benefits page.  
  
**Hiring Minimum:** $84100  
**Hiring Maximum:** $143100  
  
Qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records will be considered for employment in accordance with the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance and the California Fair Chance Act. Edward Jones is prohibited from hiring individuals with certain specified criminal history as set forth in Section 3(a)(39) and 15(b)(4) and Rule 17a-3(a)(12) of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, and conducts background reviews consistent with FINRA Rule 3110(e). A copy of a notice regarding the provisions of the Los Angeles County Fair Chance Ordinance is available at: dcba.lacounty.gov/wp-content/uploads/2024/08/FCOE-Official-Notice-Eng-Final-8.30.2024.pdf.  
  
Read More About Job Overview  
  
**Skills/Requirements**  

* Knowledge of Enterprise Risk Frameworks, methodologies and best practices.
* Knowledge of the financial services and wealth management industries.

  
Preferred Knowledge  

* Basic organizational knowledge and savvy to understand how to best apply industry frameworks to Edward Jones successfully.

  
Read More About Skills/Requirements  
  
**Awards & Accolades**  
  
At Edward Jones, we are building a place where everyone feels like they belong. We're proud of our associates' contributions to the firm and the recognitions we have received.  
  
Check out our U.S. awards and accolades: Insights & Information Blog Postings about Edward Jones  
  
Check out our Canadian awards and accolades: Insights & Information Blog Postings about Edward Jones  
  
Read More About Awards & Accolades  
  
**About Us**  
  
Join a financial services firm where your contributions are valued. Edward Jones is a Fortune 500¹ company where people come first. With over 9 million clients and 20,000 financial advisors across the U.S. and Canada, we're proud to be privately-owned, placing the focus on our clients rather than shareholder returns.  
  
Behind everything we do is our purpose: We partner for positive impact to improve the lives of our clients and colleagues, and together, better our communities and society. We are an innovative, flexible, and inclusive organization that attracts, develops, and inspires performance excellence and a sense of belonging.
  
  
People are at the center of our partnership. Edward Jones associates are seen, heard, respected, and supported. This is what we believe makes us the best place to start or build your career.
  
  
View our Purpose, Inclusion and Citizenship Report.  
  
¹Fortune 500, published June 2024, data as of December 2023. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.  
  
Edward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.  
  
#LI-HO

title: Enterprise Strategy Marketing Manager
description:
Join us as we work to create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
  
  
Enterprise Strategy Marketing Manager
  
  
We are looking for an Enterprise Strategy Marketing Manager to join the Enterprise Segment Marketing team within our Marketing department. In this role, the Enterprise Strategy Marketing Manager will support the Enterprise go to market strategies. This involves partnering closely with our marketing partners and sales stakeholders to define marketing initiative objectives, align messaging with target audiences, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to execute impactful content.
  
  
The Marketing Manager will work closely with marketing partners and sales leadership to develop, implement, and be an expert on compelling messaging that resonates with our Enterprise prospects and their various buyer personas, while aligning to our athenahealth brand and value messaging. This individual will leverage data to make informed recommendations on how to refine our market segmentation and targeting for quarterly outbound activations with SDR teams among other tactics, as well as make recommendations for prescriptive prospecting across the Sales Development team.
  
  
Finally, the Enterprise Strategy Marketing Manager will be responsible for conducting regular analysis and developing reporting for the Enterprise business segment to understand the needs, preferences, and behaviors of the Enterprise market, and identify insights that will inform Enterprise Segment marketing program strategies.
  
  
**The Team:** Enterprise Segment Marketing team owns the Enterprise go-to-market strategy for healthcare organizations with 275+ MDs, working in close alignment with our Sales stakeholders and Marketing partners to help grow pipeline and bookings. We support the new and existing logo Enterprise business through at-scale, 1:few, and 1:1 tactics informed by our strategy to grow the business across our key audiences, by leveraging tactics like web and paid media, lead generation partnerships, outbound activations, industry and proprietary events, sales enablement, active pipeline deal support, and customer co-marketing.
  
  
Job Responsibilities
  
  
Develop and execute comprehensive go-to-market strategies that align with overall business objectives and target key market segments and/or audiences
  
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product, sales, and creative to ensure cohesive messaging and campaign execution
  
  
Oversee program execution from planning to post launch analysis, tracking kpis and refining tactics to optimize results
  
  
Conduct regular in-depth analysis of Enterprise business segment to understand the needs, preferences, and behaviors of the Enterprise market, and applying them to the go-forward Enterprise Segment go-to-market strategy
  
  
Stay close to and understand competitor landscape and emerging industry trends to inform strategic decisions
  
  
Understand core audience sub-segments and have pulse on how they are performing – conversion rates, meetings, gross adds, bookings across each key audience
  
  
Support development of compelling messaging that resonates with our Enterprise prospects and their various buyer personas, while aligning to our athenahealth brand and value messaging
  
  
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure messaging consistency across all marketing channels, including outbound activations, collateral, events
  
  
**Conduct Segment Performance Analysis & operational Reporting:** Provide monthly business reports summarizing the activations performance, inbound performance, and performance of any other channels like events, including recommendations of how to modify that strategy based on findings. Provide regular performance updates for weekly leadership updates, quarterly marketing/sales reviews, and ad-hoc performance analysis as requested by leadership
  
  
Typical Qualifications
  
  
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Healthcare Administration, or a related field.
  
  
5+ years in relevant Marketing / Commercial Operations or Marketing Strategy role, with experience in Healthcare IT a plus
  
  
Demonstrated success developing and enhancing reporting, weaving together inputs from multiple teams, marketing channels, and data sources
  
  
Excellent understanding of prospect segmentation and targeting strategies
  
  
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate and influence effectively across teams.
  
  
Proven experience working with marketing and sales teams
  
  
Proficient in managing multiple marketing initiatives simultaneously, while meeting deadlines with high-quality deliverables
  
  
About athenahealth
  
  
**Our vision:** In an industry that becomes more complex by the day, we stand for simplicity. We offer IT solutions and expert services that eliminate the daily hurdles preventing healthcare providers from focusing entirely on their patients — powered by our vision to create a thriving ecosystem that delivers accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all.
  
  
**Our company culture:** Our talented employees — or athenistas, as we call ourselves — spark the innovation and passion needed to accomplish our vision. We are a diverse group of dreamers and do-ers with unique knowledge, expertise, backgrounds, and perspectives. We unite as mission-driven problem-solvers with a deep desire to achieve our vision and make our time here count. Our award-winning culture is built around shared values of inclusiveness, accountability, and support.
  
  
**Our DEI commitment:** Our vision of accessible, high-quality, and sustainable healthcare for all requires addressing the inequities that stand in the way. That's one reason we prioritize diversity, equity, and inclusion in every aspect of our business, from attracting and sustaining a diverse workforce to maintaining an inclusive environment for athenistas, our partners, customers and the communities where we work and serve.
  
  
**What we can do for you:**  
Along with health and financial benefits, athenistas enjoy perks specific to each location, including commuter support, employee assistance programs, tuition assistance, employee resource groups, and collaborative workspaces — some offices even welcome dogs.
  
  
We also encourage a better work-life balance for athenistas with our flexibility. While we know in-office collaboration is critical to our vision, we recognize that not all work needs to be done within an office environment, full-time. With consistent communication and digital collaboration tools, athenahealth enables employees to find a balance that feels fulfilling and productive for each individual situation.
  
  
In addition to our traditional benefits and perks, we sponsor events throughout the year, including book clubs, external speakers, and hackathons. We provide athenistas with a company culture based on learning, the support of an engaged team, and an inclusive environment where all employees are valued.
  
  
**Learn more about our culture and benefits here:** athenahealth.com/careers
  
https://www.athenahealth.com/careers/equal-opportunity

title: Director of Media Operations
description:
Company Description

**About Adtalem Global Education**  
  
Adtalem Global Education is a national leader in post-secondary education and leading provider of professional talent to the healthcare industry. Adtalem educates and empowers students with the knowledge and skills to become leaders in their communities and make a lasting impact on public health, well-being and beyond. Through equitable access to education, environments that nurture student success, and a focus on expanding and diversifying the talent pipeline in healthcare, Adtalem is building a brighter future for communities and the world.  
  
Adtalem is the parent organization of American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine, Chamberlain University, Ross University School of Medicine, Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine and Walden University.  
  
We operate on a hybrid schedule with four in-office days per week (Monday–Thursday). This approach enhances creativity, innovation, communication, and relationship-building, fostering a dynamic and collaborative work environment.  
  
Visit Adtalem.com for more information, and follow on Twitter and LinkedIn.

Job Description

**Opportunity at a Glance**

The Director, Media Operations will be a strategic and results-oriented leader responsible for overseeing and optimizing all aspects of media operations. This role involves identifying operational requirements, streamlining processes, and ensuring the effective execution of media campaigns to achieve business objectives. The ideal candidate will possess strong leadership skills, technical expertise in media platforms and analytics, and a proven ability to drive operational excellence and innovation. This candidate will have a deep understanding of marketing platforms, measurement & experimentation methodologies, and media enabling data flow ecology.

**Responsibilities**

**Strategic Execution**

* Develop and oversee lead flow continuity and optimization that spans the marketing funnel, aligning with Chamberlain University's objectives for brand growth, enrollment and student outcomes.
* Identify operational requirements, create and organize streamlined processes, and facilitate agency enablement and usage.
* Understand the digital measurement infrastructure strategy and evolve with industry and ecosystem to achieve segment business objectives.
* Identify potential operational risks and develop robust contingency plans and disaster recovery strategies.
* Identify bottlenecks, streamline workflows, implement best practices, and leverage data.
* Oversee tracking and attribution infrastructure.
* Innovate to derive increased value from lead generation through enrollment conversion.
* Work cross-functionally with Enrollment, Product/Technical specialists, and Partners to synthesize technical and strategic business requirements into cohesive business cases and drive operational excellence.
* Promote and triage hand-offs for implementation, acting as a liaison between key partner teams to ensure project completion.
* Establish clear processes and accountability across internal stakeholders and external vendors to drive lead flow continuity.
* Create feedback loops to apply learnings, run experiments, and continuously improve the effectiveness of media efforts.

**Leadership**

* Translate the organization's overall strategy into clear operational goals.
* Lead teams through technological transitions, workflow redesigns, or strategic shifts, ensuring buy-in and smooth adoption of new processes or systems.
* Articulate complex technical details to non-technical stakeholders, report on performance, present strategic plans, and manage vendor relationships.
* Foster strong internal partnerships across marketing, enrollment, and analytics teams to ensure cohesive planning and execution.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

* Bachelor's degree required, graduate degree preferred.

**Platform Proficiency:**

* Google Marketing products (SA/DV/GCM 360)
* Meta Business Manager
* Cloud infrastructure & data warehouses (DSP/CDP/DMP)
* CRM systems (Salesforce)
* MAP (Eloqua)

**Data and Analytics:**

* Thorough understanding of lead data workflows across various platforms
* Knowledge of tracking logic, tag management, and attribution methodologies
* Ability to troubleshoot data integrity issues and ensure measurement accuracy across campaigns and channels
* Proficiency with Google Analytics 4

**Process and Optimization:**

* Ability to identify operational requirements, create and organize streamlined processes
* Skill in identifying bottlenecks, streamlining workflows, and implementing best practices
* Proven ability to build process and improve documentation
* Experience developing and implementing standard operating procedures (SOPs)

**Problem Solving and Risk Management:**

* Foresight to identify potential operational risks and develop robust contingency plans
* Capacity to analyze complex operational issues, evaluate potential solutions, and implement effective fixes

**Cross-functional Collaboration and Communication:**

* Skilled in cross-functional collaboration, especially between marketing, analytics, technology teams, and agencies
* Ability to articulate complex technical details to non-technical stakeholders
* Experience in managing vendor relationships

**Lead Management and Conversion:**

* Ability to own the end-to-end flow of qualified leads
* Capability to innovate to derive increased value from lead generation through enrollment conversion
* Ability to establish clear processes and accountability across internal stakeholders and external vendors to drive lead flow continuity
* Skill in creating feedback loops to apply learnings, run experiments, and continuously improve the effectiveness of media efforts
* Ability to travel - 10%.

Additional Information

*In support of the pay transparency laws enacted across the country, the expected salary range for this position is between $100,171 and $181,034. Actual pay will be adjusted based on job-related factors permitted by law, such as experience and training; geographic location; licensure and certifications; market factors; departmental budgets; and responsibility. Our Talent Acquisition Team will be happy to answer any questions you may have, and we look forward to learning more about your salary requirements. The position qualifies for the below benefits.*  
  
*Adtalem offers a robust suite of benefits including:*

* *Health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance*
* *401k Retirement Program + 6% employer match*
* *Participation in Adtalem’s Flexible Time Off (FTO) Policy*
* *12 Paid Holidays*  
    
  *For more information related to our benefits please visit:* *https://careers.adtalem.com/benefits**.*  
    
  *You are also eligible to participate in an annual incentive program, subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors, including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.*

Equal Opportunity – Minority / Female / Disability / V / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation

title: Senior Manager, Business Strategy
description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

Walmart is redefining how we serve our customers by transforming our internal capabilities and experiences. As part of this transformation, the Customer Engagement Services (CES) organization is launching a Customer Success team focused on supporting internal lines of business with strategic guidance, advocacy, and operational excellence.  
We are seeking a Senior Manager of Customer Success to lead this effort—an experienced, relationship-driven, and strategic leader who can act as a trusted advisor to Walmart’s internal teams, enabling them to achieve their goals while aligning with broader enterprise strategies.

**What you'll do...**
---------------------

What You'll Do

Customer Relationship Management

* Serve as the primary point of contact for assigned business units, developing deep relationships and becoming a trusted advisor.
* Learn and speak the language of the business units to ensure alignment and relevance.
* Establish regular touchpoints and engagement plans with executive stakeholders.

Strategic Planning & Execution

* Develop and execute a tailored Customer Success strategy for each business unit, focused on adoption, satisfaction, and measurable outcomes.
* Collaborate on long-term roadmaps that align with customer needs and organizational goals.
* Track success metrics and communicate progress to stakeholders and leadership.

Cross-Functional Collaboration

* Partner with internal teams such as Product, Engineering, Sales, Marketing, Renewals, and Professional Services to deliver a seamless customer journey.
* Ensure cross-functional alignment around key initiatives, launches, and priorities.

Customer Advocacy

* Collect, analyze, and present internal customer feedback to inform product, service, and operational improvements.
* Champion the voice of internal partners in strategy conversations, ensuring their needs shape Walmart’s direction.

Performance & Value Optimization

* Monitor customer performance and engagement metrics, proactively identifying areas for improvement.
* Drive increased adoption of tools and services, identifying opportunities for innovation and business impact.
* Support revenue and cost-efficiency initiatives through strategic insights and recommendations.

Change Management & Enablement

* Lead or support key change initiatives that impact teams, ensuring readiness, alignment, and successful adoption.
* Provide guidance, training, and communication to facilitate understanding and engagement with new systems or processes.

Leadership & Team Collaboration

* Act as a senior member of the CES organization, mentoring junior team members and helping define scalable processes.
* Contribute to the development and maturity of the Customer Success function at Walmart.

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.

‎

‎

‎

You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.

‎

For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices.

‎

‎

Live Better U is a Walmart-paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.

‎

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.

‎

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.

‎

The annual salary range for this position is $90,000.00-$180,000.00

‎

Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses.

‎

Additional compensation for certain positions may also include:

‎

‎

* Stock

‎

‎

**Minimum Qualifications...**
-----------------------------

*Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.*

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Statistics, Social Science, Communications, or related field and 4 years’ experience in retail merchandising, operations management, or related area OR 6 years’ experience in retail merchandising, operations management, or related area.

**Preferred Qualifications...**
-------------------------------

*Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.*

Leading cross-functional teams, Supervisory experience

**Primary Location...**
-----------------------

702 Sw 8Th St, Bentonville, AR 72716, United States of America

title: Manager, Business Analysis And Insights, Emerging Sales
description:
**Position Summary...**
-----------------------

**What you'll do...**
---------------------

Join the Walmart Connect Sales Strategy and Enablement Team as a dynamic leader passionate about digital advertising and e-commerce. This role involves proactive stakeholder management, insights generation, and support for the fastest-growing segment in the Ads Business.

The Walmart Connect Sales Strategy and Enablement Team is seeking someone who is passionate about retail media, digital advertising, and e-commerce. The ideal candidat would have strong communication skills and the ability to build essential relationships across Sales, Operations, and other cross-functional partners. We are searching for a motivated self-starter with exceptional analytical skills dedicated to developing insights, reporting, and strategy recommendations to execute key against aggressive goals across a scaled Sales and Retail organization. In this role, you will be asked unique questions and investigate deep intel to provide actionable learnings to multiple layers of the organization. The ideal candidate will excel in analytical development, communication, modeling, strategy, process, and systems.

Analysts should be comfortable with ambiguity, exhibit strong attention to detail, and be motivated by a fast-paced and entrepreneurial environment. In addition, this role requires the initiative to complete complex tasks and projects quickly and independently, respond promptly to situations requiring rapid turnaround, switch priorities on short notice, and take effective action.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

**Business Measurement & Reporting:**

* Collaborate with leaders in Emerging Sales and other inter-dependent teams to design, develop, and propose solutions for reporting and measurement needs.
* Support the process of defining KPIs, collecting data, ensuring data quality for appropriate measurement.
* Own and develop scaled reporting solutions for Sales teams.
* Manage reporting collateral, including dashboards, to facilitate teams' understanding of business health and goal achievement levels.

**Strategy Planning:**

* Address ambiguous strategic questions facing the business and collaborate with leaders across Walmart Connect to build business cases for new business initiatives.
* Drive the execution of initiatives across partners.
* Develop a profound understanding of our overall business and how our different ads products, media channels, and sales investments align with our broader strategy.
* Report and maintain various input and output metrics used to evaluate our progress, which serve as the backbone of our reporting and strategic planning processes.
* Use data extraction and analytical skills to support ad hoc analyses, results, performance, and drive planning and process discussions.

**Basic Requirements:**

* 2-3 years of work experience in a role requiring analytical skills, such as business analyst, data analyst, or statistical analyst.
* Understanding of sales processes and tools, including Salesforce CRM systems, sales quota, account planning, territory assignment, performance management, forecasting and territory assignment, and analytics, to support a world-class Sales Team.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to shift styles based on the setting and audience across all mediums including emails, presentations, and meetings.
* Proficiency in writing complex and efficient SQL queries to extract data.
* Ability to work with internal and external customers to gather and document business requirements and user stories, propose solutions, evaluate feasibility, conduct technology assessments, ROI analysis, and assess complexity for various potential processes and system solutions.
* Ability to partner with core internal technical teams (CRM, Data Warehouse, etc.) to design and implement sales operations solutions that address customer needs.
* The ability to communicate findings and make recommendations for improvement clearly and effectively.
* The capability to model and simulate improvements to existing business processes, evaluate 'what-if' scenarios, and conduct dry runs to identify and resolve gaps before implementation.
* Capacity to independently manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize responsibilities.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, even when faced with ambiguity.

**Nice to Have:**

* Master's degree (MBA, Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field).
* Advanced knowledge of data mining, SQL, data warehousing, statistical analysis tools, Data Science, Modeling Skills, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau or PowerBI.
* Exceptional communication skills (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
* Excellent organizational skills, including prioritization, scheduling, time management, and meeting deadlines.
* Exposure to and understanding of digital advertising.
* Experience working closely with a distributed sales team.

**Join Us:** If you are passionate about digital advertising and e-commerce, thrive in a dynamic environment, and are ready to make a substantial impact, we invite you to consider joining us. This role offers an exciting opportunity to shape the future of digital advertising within the world's largest company.

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.

‎

‎

‎

You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.

title: Senior Technical Coach - Engineering Enablement & Developer Experience
description:
**Work Location Type:****Hybrid**

**About Grainger:**

W.W. Grainger, Inc., is a leading broad line distributor with operations primarily in North America, Japan and the United Kingdom. At Grainger, We Keep the World Working® by serving more than 4.5 million customers worldwide with products and solutions delivered through innovative technology and deep customer relationships. Known for its commitment to service and award-winning culture, the Company had 2024 revenue of $17.2 billion across its two business models. In the High-Touch Solutions segment, Grainger offers approximately 2 million maintenances, repair and operating (MRO) products and services, including technical support and inventory management. In the Endless Assortment segment, Zoro.com offers customers access to more than 14 million products, and MonotaRO.com offers more than 24 million products. For more information, visit www.grainger.com.

**Compensation:**

The anticipated base pay compensation range for this position is $111,500.00 to $185,800.00.

**Rewards and Benefits:**

With benefits starting on day one, our programs provide choice and flexibility to meet team members' individual needs, including:

* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans with coverage starting on day one of employment and 6 free sessions each year with a licensed therapist to support your emotional wellbeing.
* 18 paid time off (PTO) days annually for full-time employees (accrual prorated based on employment start date) and 6 company holidays per year.
* 6% company contribution to a 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan each pay period, no employee contribution required.
* Employee discounts, tuition reimbursement, student loan refinancing and free access to financial counseling, education, and tools.
* Maternity support programs, nursing benefits, and up to 14 weeks paid leave for birth parents and up to 4 weeks paid leave for non-birth parents.

For additional information and details regarding Grainger’s benefits, please click on the link below:

https://experience100.ehr.com/grainger/Home/Tools-Resources/Key-Resources/New-Hire

The pay range provided above is not a guarantee of compensation. The range reflects the potential base pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual base pay compensation will depend, in part, on factors such as geographic work location and relevant experience and skills.

The anticipated compensation range described above is subject to change and the compensation ultimately paid may be higher or lower than the range described above.

Grainger reserves the right to amend, modify, or terminate its compensation and benefit programs in its sole discretion at any time, consistent with applicable law.

Position Details:

Are you passionate about scaling engineering excellence and enabling teams to build faster, better, and more reliably? As a Staff Software Engineer in our Engineering Effectiveness team, you’ll be a key player in shaping Grainger’s engineering culture. You’ll partner with teams to improve delivery speed and quality, promote sustainable practices, and influence both product and platform decisions across the engineering landscape.

This role is designed for engineers who thrive on elevating others. You’ll lead by example, help reduce complexity, and introduce smarter defaults that improve how our teams design, build, and ship software every day.

You Will:

* Collaborate with Product Engineers across the organization to understand and remove friction in the development experience.

* Help engineering teams align on best practices, architectural tradeoffs, and technical priorities that accelerate delivery and reduce long-term cost.

* Design and deliver impactful consulting sessions and immersive ‘dojo’ experiences to enable product teams to self-solve and scale.

* Serve as a trusted technical partner through embedded engagements, guiding teams through all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).

* Influence upstream teams like SRE, Security, and Core Engineering to build shared services that support safer and more resilient delivery.

* Influence Engineering Effectiveness teams —Delivery Insights, Core Engineering, Developer Experience (DevEx), and AI Enablement—to shape strategy and capability roadmaps.

* Mentor engineers across teams, supporting their growth not just in technical skills, but also in navigating ambiguity, driving influence, and scaling their impact.

* Promote continuous improvement by identifying and leading improvements to processes, tooling, and collaboration models that uplift the engineering organization.

You Have:

* 6+ years of experience in software engineering within large, distributed environments and across multiple teams.

* Deep empathy for developers and a strong passion for pair programming, coaching, and building inclusive, collaborative team cultures.

* Full stack engineering experience, with a strong emphasis on Java, React, and NextJS.

* Practical experience building, deploying, and operating containerized workloads (Docker / Kubernetes), APIs, and microservices at scale.

* Cloud exposure across UI, API, and CLI (AWS / GCP / Azure).

* Hands-on experience implementing Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform, Ansible) and CI/CD pipelines aligned to DevOps best practices.

* Knowledge of cloud-native, event-driven architectures and operational patterns (e.g., Kafka, AWS SQS).

* Familiarity with observability and monitoring tools such as DataDog, OTEL, Dynatrace, and Splunk.

* Experience with DevOps and collaboration tools including GitHub, Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and Bamboo.

* A growth mindset and commitment to learning; comfortable with experimentation and evolving engineering practices.

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related discipline—or equivalent work experience.

*We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status or any other protected characteristic under federal, state, or local law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.*

*We are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible work environment that includes both providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities during the application and hiring process as well as throughout the course of one’s employment, should you need a reasonable accommodation during the application and selection process, including, but not limited to use of our website, any part of the application, interview or hiring process, please advise us so that we can provide appropriate assistance.*

title: Director- Service Advantage Center Lean Value Stream Transformation, Med Surg Americas, Hybrid– San Antonio, TX
description:
Thank you for your interest in working for our Company. Recruiting the right talent is crucial to our goals. On April 1, 2024, 3M Healthcare underwent a corporate spin-off leading to the creation of a new company named Solventum. We are still in the process of updating our Careers Page and applicant documents, which currently have 3M branding. Please bear with us. In the interim, our Privacy Policy here: https://www.solventum.com/en-us/home/legal/website-privacy-statement/applicant-privacy/ continues to apply to any personal information you submit, and the 3M-branded positions listed on our Careers Page are for Solventum positions. As it was with 3M, at Solventum all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

**Job Description:**

**Director- Service Advantage Center Lean Value Stream Transformation, Med Surg Americas – Hybrid – San Antonio, TX**

**At Solventum, we enable better, smarter, safer healthcare to improve lives. As a new company with a long legacy of creating breakthrough solutions for our customers’ toughest challenges, we pioneer game-changing innovations at the intersection of health, material and data science that change patients' lives for the better while enabling healthcare professionals to perform at their best. Because people, and their wellbeing, are at the heart of every scientific advancement we pursue.**

**We partner closely with the brightest minds in healthcare to ensure that every solution we create melds the latest technology with compassion and empathy. Because at Solventum, we never stop solving for you.**

**The Impact You’ll Make in this Role**

The Director of Lean Value Stream (LVS) Transformation leads the Service Advantage Center Systems, Continuous improvement, and transactional Customer Experience teams. This strategic role is instrumental in driving organizational transformation across the entire order and support value streams to achieve net revenue growth, enhance customer experience, and optimize operational effectiveness across the full Field Service and Advantage Center functions for our Americas organization and in collaboration with our commercial, IT and finance partners.

As Director of LVS Transformation, MedSurg Americas, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:

**Operational Leadership**

* Develop and execute strategies that align with company and departmental goals.
* Lead planning, budgeting, and decision-making across key operational functions.
* Solve complex business challenges through data-driven analysis and structured prioritization.
* Drive enterprise change management and build a culture of agility and accountability.
* Set and track performance metrics to ensure measurable progress and impact.

**Service Systems & Automation**

* Design scalable system enablement strategies to support operational growth and innovation.
* Drive workflow automation and process improvements to enhance efficiency.
* Collaborate with IT and Digital teams to align road maps and ensure on-time delivery.
* Guide development of business requirements and lead quality assurance for solution rollouts.
* Ensure platforms are adaptable to future needs and emerging opportunities.

**Continuous Improvement (Lean / Everyday Solvers)**

* Lead the operational improvement roadmap, prioritizing high-impact initiatives.
* Build a strong CI team and train employees across levels in Lean methodologies.
* Leverage data and analytics to drive insights and targeted improvements.
* Implement Lean tools to reduce waste, improve flow, and optimize performance.

**Customer Success:**

* Champion a customer-centric culture by embedding the voice of the customer across the organization.
* Build and lead a customer success team focused on improving outcomes, value, and experience.
* Translate customer insights into strategies that drive adoption, retention, and seamless engagement.
* Align business KPIs to reflect customer success metrics and priorities.

**Cross-functional Collaboration:**

* Lead enterprise-wide initiatives to align strategy and execution across diverse functions.
* Facilitate stakeholder alignment by promoting transparency, shared accountability, and cohesive teamwork.
* Leverage cross-disciplinary expertise to drive innovation, problem-solving, and break down organizational silos.

**Your Skills and Expertise**  
To set you up for success in this role from day one, Solventum requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Marketing, or a related field AND

15 years of proven experience in leadership roles overseeing transactional operations and transformation efforts

**OR**

* High School Diploma/GED AND 19 years of proven experience in leadership roles overseeing transactional operations and transformation efforts

I**n addition to the above requirements, the following are also required:**

* Certified Lean Six Sigma Champion with a focus on transactional environments.
* Extensive experience in leading and managing Project Management Office (PMO) initiatives, including strategic planning, governance, and execution of complex projects, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and successful delivery of project outcomes.

**Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:**

* Master’s Degree from an accredited institution.
* Experience in the medical device industry
* Demonstrated track record of success in driving revenue growth and enhance operational effectiveness and efficiency.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate data into actionable strategies and initiatives.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate across all levels of the organization.

**Work location**:

* Hybrid Eligible (Job Duties allow for some remote work but require travel to [San Antonio, TX at least 4 days per week)

**Travel:** May include up to 25% domestic/international

**Relocation Assistance:** May be authorized

**Must be legally authorized to work in a country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).**

**Supporting Your Well-being**

Solventum offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, Solventum regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Applicable to US Applicants Only:The expected compensation range for this position is $222,044 - $271,387, which includes base pay plus variable incentive pay, if eligible. This range represents a good faith estimate for this position.
